title: Night Porter
description:
The Sutton Place Hotel at Revelstoke Mountain Resort is a luxury 4-star hotel, located directly opposite the gondola and activities that provide experiences of a lifetime for our guests.

The Sutton Place Hotel and Revelstoke Mountain Resort (RMR) are a division of Canada's largest privately held hospitality company, Northland Properties Corporation (NPC), and since its inception in 2007, we have gained a reputation for big mountain riding, legendary powder, and an authentic Canadian resort town. If you love to connect with people and have a passion for providing an exceptional hospitality experience, then we invite you to join our Sutton Place Family!


We are currently accepting applications for the position of Night Porter. The Night Porter is responsible for patrolling resort premises, maintain security, respond in a professional manner to alarms, investigate disturbances, document daily/nightly activities, warn persons of rule infractions or violations. The Hotel Night Porter must possess a positive and upbeat personality with a desire to deliver outstanding customer service to our guests. The Hotel Night Porter must have the ability to multi-task, be detail-oriented, and be able to problem solve in order to effectively deal with internal and external customers.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide overnight services and security for three buildings, hallways, parking lots and public areas
  • Respond to and assist with guest requests and concerns in a professional manner
  • Enforce quiet times throughout Resort
  • Produce nighty reports as required
  • Open/Close Pool, Hot Tub and Fitness Center
  • Maintain Public Areas to a high standard
  • Work closely and professionally with all other departments
  • Administrative duties
  • All other duties as required

Requirements

  • Experience in all aspects of customer service
  • Strong working knowledge of hospitality industry
  • Ability to analyze and interpret the needs of clients and offer the appropriate options, solutions, and resolutions required
  • Exceptional conflict resolution, negotiation, and objection handling skills
  • Able to respond quickly in a dynamic and changing environment
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing

Benefits:

  • Complimentary Season's Pass to Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • Reciprocal deals on lift tickets at other local mountains.
  • Third Party partnership discounts for all employees.
  • Group Life Insurance, Extended Health, Dental, Vision Care (after 6 months of full-time service)
  • Matching RRSP program (after 1 year of full-time service)
  • Limited Staff Accommodation available

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sutton Place Hotel, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Night Auditor
description:
Luxurious hotel living with classic European style, The Sutton Place Hotel's luxury hospitality experience has arrived in Halifax. An integral part of Nova Centre, and located in the heart of our city, The Sutton Place Hotel Halifax offers elegant modern charm in a marriage of traditional and contemporary design with the warmth of East Coast Hospitality.

Each of our 262 guest rooms and suites are fully automated with lights, temperature, and fan regulators all accessed through the Allure in-room wall control, iPhone, Android, or manually. Our fully equipped fitness centre, on-site Chop Steakhouse & Bar, and underground parking are a few of the amenities that provide the ultimate in service, comfort, and style unique to our well-appointed location.

Our dedication to the health and safety of our guests, employees and partners is paramount and we follow our PureClean program- Staying Safe Together.

The key to providing this exceptional service level is our team and we are currently considering candidates for the following position:

Night Audit Agent

Key Responsibilities

This is an overnight shift and begins at 11:00pm. The successful candidate will consistently provide a warm welcome and exceptional experiences to our guests in a prompt and courteous manner within the framework of hotel and departmental guidelines. Responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):

  • Check-in and check-out services
  • Answering guest inquiries, accommodating special requests and assisting in resolving and concerns or issues in person or via telephone
  • Prepare, check, and correct room rate variances by conducting thorough audits
  • Ensure wake-up calls are set for the morning to ensure accuracy & complete as required
  • Runs the nightly processing sequence to reset systems for the next days' use
  • Prepares and transmits credit card deposits
  • Balance the rooms audit
  • Keep team informed of all problems, emergencies and unusual matters of significance
  • Adheres to all established credit and inventory control procedures
  • Present statement of charges to departing guests and receive payment
  • Identify and record special billing instructions and notify Accounting
  • Minimize loss of revenue by adhering to all established credit and inventory control procedures
  • Ensure the security of keys, company and guest information
  • Report unsafe work conditions, areas requiring repair or suspicious persons
  • Must be able to assist with parking and retrieving of guest vehicles if required
  • Assisting with emergency response as required

Qualifications:

  • This is an excellent opportunity for an, energetic, self-motivated, team-oriented individual, with a minimum 2 years previous customer service experience.
  • 1 year's previous guest service/front desk or accounting experience is required
  • Previous professional experience requiring the use of a computer is required
  • Strong knowledge of computer systems required, OPERA (or similar) and additional languages are an asset.
  • A valid driver's license with clean drivers abstract; the ability to drive manual (standard) vehicles is an asset.
  • Proven, exceptional guest service and communication (both verbal and written) skills
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities
  • Position requires continuous standing and walking throughout the shift.

PERKS:

  • Team rates from $59 per night
  • 25% discount at our restaurants for up to 6 people
  • ½ price passes/lift tickets at Grouse Mountain and Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • RRSP Matching for eligible employees
  • HumanaCare free mental health support & counselling
  • Employment milestone rewards
  • Ongoing employee events, incentives and recognition

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sutton Place Hotel, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Bartender
company: Sun Peaks Resort LLP/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
Work, Live and Play

Sun Peaks Resort LLP has proven to be one of the highest levels of guest service providers within the ski industry. We can promise you a memorable and gainful working experience within our high volume and challenging work environments. Sun Peaks Resort LLP has many benefits to offer our employees including:

  • Hike/Bike Pass and Golf pass for our full-time employees (Summer)
  • Employee Health and Wellness Program including EFAP services
  • Mountain of Food Program
  • Companywide outlet discounts
  • Staff Housing available to employees 19+ years of age
  • Reciprocal riding at other participating BC and Alberta bike parks
  • Gain valuable job-related skills: organization and time management; teamwork & collaboration; build your network, and work with a diverse group of co-workers & guests

Your Responsibilities will include:

  • Prepare beverages using proper bartending techniques
  • Practice responsible alcohol service
  • Check patrons' identification to ensure that they meet minimum age requirements for consumption of alcoholic beverages
  • Communicate to guests about the current health and safety guidelines while visiting the outlet
  • Knowledge of current drink trends and the ability to add new exciting items to our drink menu
  • Clean and maintain bar area and wash glassware
  • Maintain/control inventory of bar stock and supplies
  • Provide food and beverage product knowledge
  • Prepare checks that itemize total meal costs and sales taxes
  • Cash-out and reconcile cash with total sales
  • Check with customers to ensure that they are enjoying their meals and take action to correct any problems
  • Perform basic cleaning tasks as needed, as per schedule, or directed by the supervisor
  • Proper storage of all cleaned dishes and equipment incorrect areas
  • Adhere to grooming and appearance standards consistently
  • Be knowledgeable about products and services available at the resort

Ideal Candidates:

  • Professional appearance and attitude
  • Must be legal drinking age
  • Exceptional customer service skills are required
  • Cash handling experience
  • Ability to multi-task
  • Knowledge of relevant laws and regulations
  • A secondary school diploma is preferred
  • Courses in bartending are an asset
  • Serving It Right is required
  • Safe food handling is required where applicable
  • First aid is an asset

Incentive Program:

This role is eligible for an incentive for successful applicants to receive a $250 prepaid visa card.  

If you are a student currently enrolled in a college/university tourism and/or hospitality program (validated by uploading the required documentation and completing the information on your student status in the job application fields), you are also eligible for fully reimbursed staff accommodation for the Summer season for successful applicants.

Please ensure you provide the required documentation and complete the information on your student status in the job application fields. (Conditions apply and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interview and at the job offer stage).

Conditions apply to these incentives and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interviews and the job offer stage.

title: Housekeeping Room Attendant / Laundry Attendant
description:
We celebrate Housekeeping Room Attendants as the heart of our hotels. Without you, we simply could not open. Your passion for cleanliness and eagle-eye for detail really help to set us apart, and your commitment to friendly customer service brings our guests back time after time. On top of a competitive compensation package and flexible schedule, we're committed to your professional development and offer real career growth. We know you'd love to hear about our perks'incredible team rates and discounts at all 7 of our restaurant brands is just the beginning! With over 60 hotels (and growing!) there has never been a more exciting time to join our team.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • No education or experience required, we will train one on one
  • Ability to follow instruction
  • Good communication skills are an asset
  • Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) is an asset
  • Able to deal with people sensitively, tactfully, diplomatically, and professionally at all times
  • Professional appearance and manners

DUTIES:

  • Clean rooms according to Sandman Hotels standards
  • Maintains an up to date knowledge of all chemicals and cleaning products, and the correct handling procedures
  • Responds to guests and staff inquiries, requests and complaints in a prompt and courteous manner
  • Ensures all lost property items left in guest rooms are recorded on the worksheet and handed in to the Supervisor/Manager at the end of the shift
  • Ensures all maintenance and safety hazards are promptly reported to the Supervisor/Manager to minimize hazard risk
  • Takes personal responsibility for equipment, ensuring it is operated correctly and secure at all times
  • Reports any unusual or suspicious persons/activities happening in the area of security to the manager
  • Reports any maintenance issues including burned out light bulbs
  • Check under bed, drawers, and closet for left behind articles and or trash
  • Cleans sink and fixtures and restock all terry, soap, glasses, comment cards, coffee and other amenities
  • Clean coffee pots when needed, - ensures pots are plugged in
  • Arrange furniture following use by guests
  • Ensure security of guest rooms and privacy of guests
  • Perform Laundry tasks when necessary including collect, sort, transport laundry at the beginning of each shift.
  • Remove laundry from dryers and fold immediately to prevent wrinkling.
  • Stock linen supply room with clean linens for use for next day.
  • Laundry to include: bed linens, blankets, Duvets/Comforters, towels & face cloths, and restaurant table linens. At end of day all cleaning cloths will also be washed, dried and folded for housekeeping needs.
  • Small mending repairs required as needed.
  • Perform Houseperson duties if required.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Excellent customer relations.
  • Must have time-management skills.
  • Adaptable to change and be able to handle multiple priorities under pressure.
  • Eager and focused to exceed guest expectations.

PERKS:

  • Team rates from $59 per night
  • 25% discount at our restaurants for up to 6 people
  • ½ price passes/lift tickets at Grouse Mountain and Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • RRSP Matching for eligible employees
  • HumanaCare - free mental health support & counselling
  • Employment milestone rewards
  • Ongoing employee events, incentives and recognition

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required. You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker. Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

title: Facilities Maintenance Worker $17-$19/hr
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?:

Welcoming and helping our guests by maintaining and beautifying our hotels.

What perks can you expect?:
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe  
  • Work experience in an  iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location  
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuitâ€™s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an  inclusive culture  and  make life-long friends  
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth  or future work at  other Pursuit  locations  
  • Access to one of the worldâ€™s most beautiful and iconic National Parks  
  • Flexible shift schedules, 4 days on, 3 days off.
What will you do in this job?:

  • Coordinate with Maintenance Manager and Supervisors  

  • Ensure adequate upkeep of mechanical equipment
  • Perform repairs and maintenance in guest rooms and common areas of the property
  • Tracking and performing preventative maintenance  
  • Caring for walk ways, lawns and flower gardens
  • Garbage removal as necessary  
What skills and experience do you need for this job?:
  • Current Alberta Driver's License
  • Able to speak, read, write and understand English
  • Basic computer skills an asset
  • Able to lift up to 20lbs (frequently) up to 100lbs (occasionally)
  • Prior maintenance experience in a hotel environment
  • Previous trade experience an asset
  • To honour our  commitment to be â€œAlways Honestâ€ all employees must consent to a criminal record and credit check
 
What will your work environment be like?:
  • Beautiful.  Youâ€™ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring  locations. Youâ€™ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. Youâ€™ll participate in team events â€“ and fun!  
  • Independent.  Youâ€™ll spend your days in and around National Parks
  • Remote.  Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog.  Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of  through  WiFi  
  • Busy.  You  need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required    

This job description describes the role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up.  We work as a team and believe that we succeed together â€“ these job duties may change based on the needs of the  team and company as a whole.  

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in  Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in  Canada  is required.

title: Sales Coordinator
description:
We pride ourselves in achieving exceptional results in operating hotels from our ability to blend the superior science of hotel management with the art and professionalism of hospitality. Are you seeking a successful company to grow with? Do you have what it takes to grow with us?

We are seeking a dynamic Sales Coordinator person to join our team. This unique individual must possess excellent organization and communication skills in customer relations, Sales Coordinators provide administrative assistance and support to sales managers.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Applicants must be able to communicate information and ideas clearly. They must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and be able to handle everyday situations quickly and effectively.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit is a definite asset.
  • Considerable Sales & Hospitality Background
  • Office Administration Background
  • Excellent written, oral and presentation skills.
  • Great Communication & Interpersonal Skills
  • Working knowledge of Windows, MS Word, Excel & Outlook.
  • Self-motivated and creative in problem solving.
  • Detail orientated and be able to work within deadlines.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality and privacy.
  • Building and maintaining existing relationships.
  • Prepare sales proposals to clients incorporating clearly defined terms and conditions.
  • Establish an effective sales call cycle for key customers, partners and contacts.
  • Maintain a clear line of communication on sales commitments to Hotel/Chain Operations.
  • Work to achieve agreed goals and objectives.

DUTIES:

  • Sales and Administrative support to the Sales Team, assisting in all aspects of the sales process.
  • Client file management
  • In-house/off-site sales calls.
  • Prepare proposals and contracts
  • Responsible for over-seeing all aspects of Group contracts and Group management.
  • Create and organize group files, sharing information to the different hotel departments.
  • Follow up guests experience before, during and after stay.
  • Maintenance of Calendar of Events and Corporate Client tracking.
  • Attend industry events and trade shows.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • A minimum of two years hotel sales experience
  • Diploma or Degree in Hotel/Restaurant Management would be an asset.
  • Commitment to exceeding guest expectations.
  • Computer literate with knowledge of a variety of computer software applications, including the Microsoft Office Suite and Maximizer.
  • Superior written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to set priorities for self

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

title: Guest Service Agent/Night Auditor
description:
First impressions count, right? We think so too! The Guest Service Agent is the face of our hotels. You're a people-pleaser who loves to go above and beyond to exceed the needs of our guests. You'll wear many hats-from meeter and greeter to problem-defeater. At Sandman Hotel Group, we recognize this vital role with a competitive compensation package and flexible schedule. We're also pleased to encourage personal development and real career growth, which means the sky's the limit. We know you'd love to hear about our perks-incredible team rates and discounts at all 7 of our restaurant brands is just the beginning! With over 60 hotels (and growing!) there has never been a more exciting time to join our team.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Completion of a two-year apprenticeship program in front desk operations or hotel management preferred
  • 1 year of experience as a Hotel Front Desk Clerk Preferred
  • Experience in all aspects of customer service and people management
  • Strong working knowledge of accounting practices and principles
  • Ability to analyze and interpret the needs of clients and offer the appropriate options, solutions, and resolutions required
  • Exceptional conflict resolution, negotiation, and objection handling skills
  • Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing
  • High level of proficiency with Microsoft and Maestro software packages

DUTIES:

  • To provide a warm, welcoming and friendly environment
  • Responsible for checking guests in and out of the Hotel.
  • Luggage assistance
  • Issues room keys, pamphlets, discount cards, etc.
  • Answers various questions from guests and arranges transportation for guests.
  • Respond to telephone, e-mail, and in-person inquiries from clients, business partners, and other parties.
  • Book telephone reservations
  • Computes bills, collects payment and makes change for guests.
  • Count and verify cash, shift activity, keys, gift certificates, and wireless internet cards with departing shift.
  • Print updated in-house, arrival, departure, and room status reports every two hours
  • Check all unresolved departures.
  • Ensure front desk is stocked with any items guests may require before housekeeping leaves for the day.
  • Write all wake-up call requests on specified form and enter on switchboard.
  • Complete welcome calls.
  • Clean and tidy front desk area.
  • Refer all inquiries to the appropriate individuals, divisions, or departments across the organization.
  • As a front-line worker, present a positive and professional image of the organization to all visitors, suppliers, inquiries, and other interactions.
  • Provide information to staff and/or clients about special activities.
  • Observe and report any security issues to the Manager.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Excellent customer relations.
  • Must have time-management skills.
  • Adaptable to change and be able to handle multiple priorities under pressure.
  • Eager and focused to exceed guest expectations.

PERKS:

  • Team rates from $59 per night
  • 25% discount at our restaurants for up to 6 people
  • ½ price passes/lift tickets at Grouse Mountain and Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • RRSP Matching for eligible employees
  • HumanaCare - free mental health support & counselling
  • Employment milestone rewards
  • Ongoing employee events, incentives and recognition

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

title: Central Reservations Agent - Calgary
description:
Sandman Hotel Group and Sutton Place Hotels are looking for a Reservations Agents for our Guest Support Centre. Reservations Agents are the first point of contact for our guests. You're friendly and efficient, and we'll train you to become an encyclopedia of knowledge on our hotels and the communities that we serve. You relish the opportunity to help our guests to plan their perfect trip, and are a valuable ambassador for Sandman Hotel Group and Sutton Place Hotels. So much so, that we're pleased to offer a competitive compensation package, work from home and flexible schedule. We're also committed to your professional development and contributing to your overall career goals. We know you'd love to hear about our perks-incredible team rates and discounts at all 7 of our restaurant brands is just the beginning! With over 60 hotels (and growing!) there has never been a more exciting time to join our team.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

  • Must be able type 60 WPM (minimum); Fast computer data entry skills.
  • All necessary tools/hardware will be provided for each agent to perform their work duties, including laptop and phone.
  • Experienced with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.)
  • Must be able to multi-task with exceptional attention to detail.
  • Previous experience in customer relations would be ideal, preferably in hotel reservations or front desk environment.
  • Applicants must be able to meet department's SLA.
  • Must have excellent command of the English language, knowledge of the French language is an asset.
  • Must be able to commit to a Full Time training with approx. 120 hours of training time.
  • Applicants must be flexible with work schedule. Position entails various shifts which may include weekends and holidays.

DUTIES:

  • Ensure inbound calls are answered in a professional and courteous manner and established procedures are adhered to without failure.
  • Ensure that proper selling techniques are utilized to sell all the properties.
  • Ensure all reservations and reports are completed and emails are responded to in a timely fashion.
  • Ensure all reservations have accurately interfaced into the system.
  • Answering all inquiries pertaining to individual hotels; including room types, rate, facilities, as well as surrounding areas.
  • Complete all duties as assigned by supervisors and managers.
  • Handling membership inquiries for loyalty members.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Excellent customer relations and typing skills with professionalism on the telephones.
  • Must be detail oriented and have excellent organizations and time-management skills.
  • Adaptable to change and be able to handle multiple priorities under pressure.
  • Computer literate with knowledge of a variety of computer software applications.
  • Familiarization with various property managements systems (PMS) (i.e. Maestro PMS (Northwind) / Opera Cloud (Micros|Oracle) would be an asset.
  • Eager and focused to exceed guest expectations.

PERKS:

  • Team rates from $59 per night
  • 25% discount at our restaurants for up to 6 people
  • ½ price passes/lift tickets at Grouse Mountain and Revelstoke Mountain Resort
  • RRSP Matching for eligible employees
  • HumanaCare - free mental health support & counselling
  • Employment milestone rewards
  • Ongoing employee events, incentives and recognition

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

title: Event Manager
description:
Overview:

Prepares all event documentation and coordinates with sales, departments, and customer to ensure consistent, high level service throughout pre-event, event and post event phases of hotel events; primarily handles events of average complexity. Ensures all hotel events have a seamless turnover from sales to service back to sales. Recognizes opportunities to maximize revenue opportunities by up-selling and offering enhancements to create outstanding events.

Responsibilities:

Operations

  • Coordinates and communicates verbally and in writing with customer (internal and external) regarding event details. Follows up with customer post-event.
  • Acts as liaison between field salesperson and customer throughout the event process (pre-event, event, post-event). Always makes presence known to customer during this process.   Is available to solve problems and/or suggest alternatives to previous arrangements.
  • Oversees customer experiences from file turnover through the post event phase until turnover back to sales.
  • Proactively identifies operational challenges associated with group and works with the hotel staff and customer to solve these challenges and/or develop alternative solutions.
  • Leads pre-event and post-event meetings for assigned groups.
  • Facilitates various meetings as necessary (Banquet Event Order meeting, block review, etc).
  • Manages group room blocks and meeting space for assigned groups.
  • Greets customer during the event phase and hands-off to the Event Operations team for the execution of details.
  • Adheres to all standards, policies, and procedures.
  • Integrates current trends in event management and event design

     Guest Satisfaction

  • Sets a positive example for guest relations.
  • Interacts with guests to obtain feedback on product quality and service levels. Effectively responds to and handles guest problems and complaints.
  • Empowers associates to provide excellent customer service. Ensures associates understand expectations and parameters.
  • Observes service behaviors of associates and provides feedback to individuals; continuously strives to improve service performance.
  • Conducts pre- and post-event meetings as required to review/communicate group needs and feedback.
  • Actively solicits feedback from departments to identify areas for improvement to enhance the Event Plannerâ€™s experience.
  • Reviews comment cards and guest satisfaction results with associates. Participates in the development and implementation of corrective action plans.
  • Emphasizes guest satisfaction during all departmental meetings and focuses on continuous improvement.

Sales and Revenue Management

  • Effectively up sells products and services throughout the event process.
  • Participates in customer site inspections and assists with the sales process when necessary.
  • Effectively manages customer budgets to maximize revenue and meet customer needs.
  • Accurately forecasts group sleeping rooms and event revenue (catering and audio-visual) for groups.

Other

  • To look out for the safety of yourself, co-workers and to follow all Health and Safety requirements in the workplace.
  • Performs other duties as assigned to meet business needs.
Qualifications:
  • High School diploma or equivalent. A college degree preferred
  • Must have prior experience
  • Two to five years of applicable on-the-job experience
  • Proficient in Microsoft Applications: word, excel, power point and outlook
  • Proficient in graphics applications
  • Supervisory or Management training
  • Ability to verbally communicate effectively with guests and co-workers.
  • Be able to clearly express oneself verbally in the English Language using good grammar, vocabulary, eye contact and a friendly voice inflection
  • Proven knowledge of proper serving etiquette.
  • Effective sales skills to up-sell products and services
  • Knowledge of menu planning, food presentation, and banquet and event service operations
  • Ability to manage guest room and meeting space inventories
  • Broad understanding of facility management
  • Strong customer development and relationship management skills
  • Knowledge of overall hotel operations as they affect department
  • Knowledge of Event Technology products and services
  • Knowledge of contract management and legalities
  • Financial management skills e.g. manage operating budgets, forecasting and scheduling
  • Strong communication skills (verbal, listening, writing)
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Strong customer and associate relation skills
  • Strong organization skills
  • Ability to use standard software applications and hotel systems
  • Effective decision making skills
  • Effective influence skills
  • Strong presentation and platform skills
  • Knowledge of governmental regulations and safety standards

The schedule for this position may vary and would require the ability to work shift work, late nights, weekends and holidays.

 

WE OFFER

  •  A competitive wage and excellent benefits.
  • Shuttle service from West Edmonton location.
  • All associates participate in our â€œCircle of Serviceâ€ program which rewards and empowers individuals who provide outstanding customer service.
  • An opportunity to work within a progressive, exciting team environment.
  • An opportunity to work with a skilled Management team.

title: Mount Royal Hotel - New Concept, Line Cook $17.50 - $19.50
description:
What will be your daily pursuit?:

Crafting food items  to fuel our guests in their explorations of the park!  

What perks can you expect?:
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe  
  • Work experience in an  iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location  
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuitâ€™s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an  inclusive culture  and  make life-long friends  
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth  or future work at  other Pursuit  locations  
  • Access to one of the worldâ€™s most beautiful and iconic National Parks  
What will you do in this job?:

The Food and Beverage Cook will provide excellent guest experiences through the careful preparation and cooking of food items while offering friendly, professional interaction with all of our guests. Candidate will consistently be working in a manner that provides a safe and enjoyable experience for the guest, co-workers and self. This position is based at the Mount Royal Hotel, Banff, Alberta.

 

Wage range $17.50 to $19.50 per hour depending on experience + gratuities

 

Responsibilities include:

  • Acts with integrity, honesty and knowledge that promotes the culture, values and missions of  Pursuit
  • Maintains a calm demeanor during periods of high volume or unusual events
  • Provides guests with exceptional service at all times
  • Follows operational policies and procedures
  • Ensures all areas of working environment are  clean and free of debris
  • Ensures that work environment is safe and free of hazards
  • Maintains regular and consistent attendance and punctuality
  • Preparation of foodstuffs in a manner consistent with recipes and health codes
  • Cooking of food in a manner consistent with recipes and health code
  • Cleaning and maintenance of work areas

 

What skills and experience do you need for this job?:
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Some previous cooking experience
  • Excellent organizational skills
  • Food Safe an asset
  • To honour our commitment to be â€œAlways Honestâ€ all employees must consent to a criminal record check
What will your work environment be like?:
  • Beautiful.  Youâ€™ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring  locations. Youâ€™ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. Youâ€™ll participate in team events â€“ and fun!  
  • Independent.  Youâ€™ll spend your days in and around national parks
  • Remote.  Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog.  Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of  through  WiFi  
  • Busy.  You  need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required  
  • Full time and part time positions available

This job description describes this role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up.  We work as a team and believe that we succeed together â€“ these job duties may change based on the needs of the  team and company as a whole.  

 

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in  Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in  Canada  is required.  

 
#CHFAB
 
EEO Information:Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Driver (Part-Time)
description:
1-800-GOT-JUNK? is hiring immediately for Truck Team Members. We are proud to be the leaders of our industry and to offer great people employment opportunities that help them grow and develop.

Truck Team Member - General Labour, Driver & Customer Service
Part-time or Casual at our Nanaimo office!
  • Flexible Hours: Various shifts are available. We operate Mon-Sun from 7 am - 6 pm and offer compressed workweeks (F/T hours in 4 days).
  • Starting pay: $18-$22/hr (base wage, profit share, tips, all in)
With 1-800-GOT-JUNK?, each day is different from the next. You’ll be matched up with team members and travel around to different areas of the city in our awesome shiny blue trucks! You'll visit our customers’ homes or businesses to provide "No Contact Junk Removal Services" and take away their unwanted items. We are committed to being environmentally friendly by recycling, donating and other options for keeping as much out of landfills as possible.

Plus fun perks like free breakfasts every morning! Plus dinners and work events!

Qualifications:
  • 21+ years of age (for insurance purposes)
  • A valid standard driver's license and clean driving record (past 3 years)
  • Available 1 day over the weekends
  • Reliable, hard-working, and a great attitude!
  • Previous customer service, labor, or sales experience an asset (but not required)
  • Able to lift 50lbs repeatedly
We have positions available immediately. We contact all qualified applicants within 2-business days for an interview. Successful candidates are offered employment within 24-hours of the interview and can start this or next week (or a future date if that’s more convenient). Apply today and look to hear from us - we move fast!
Backgrounds we look for:
  • Delivery Driver
  • Truck Driver
  • Delivery Driver
  • Construction
  • Moving
  • Demolition
  • General Labor
  • Warehouse worker
  • Service Industry: Grocery stores, Retail, Restaurants, Hotels

title: Loyalty & Guest Feedback Coordinator
description:
Sandman Hotel Group is seeking an experienced, motivated Loyalty & Guest Feedback Coordinator. In this role, you will provide a unique opportunity in supporting the overall guest feedback and loyalty program strategy across multiple hotel and restaurant brands, within the Marketing department.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Loyalty & Guest Feedback Coordinator will have computer background in reservations, working within various website dashboards, reporting tools and all applications within MS Office, including Excel and PowerPoint. Experience with Opera Cloud PMS, TravelClick GMS, GV360, iHotelier, and Galaxy is an asset. This position requires analytic work, organization, accuracy, efficiency, dedication, communication skills, and attention to detail. The role requires the individual to work closely with multiple hotel and restaurant brands, within the Marketing department. Requirements include multitasking amongst various mobile devices, desktop admin sites and programs. As such, we are seeking someone who is comfortable working flexible hours and dedicated to bringing new ideas into practice, within an evolving and growing department, at the forefront of new technology.

DUTIES:

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Maintenance of Loyalty Programs, including support for our program members.
  • Supporting projects that substantiate our Loyalty and Guest Feedback Strategy. Projects could include operational projects/enhancements to current offers, implementation of new capabilities or offers for an existing product, or future suite of products.
  • Work closely with the Senior Manager, Loyalty & Guest Feedback, to develop and maintain the appropriate documentation needed for guest feedback and loyalty programs.
  • Ensure that the activities authenticating our loyalty strategy are delivering value to our hotel guests and restaurant customers in a profitable way.
  • With the guidance of the Senior Manager, Loyalty & Guest Feedback, interact with customers, guests, and hotel and restaurant management to resolve issues in a timely manner.
  • Contribute to the evaluation of guest feedback and loyalty programs through effective scorecard and metric analysis. Review, track and close feedback matters; issue applicable letters, certificates, loyalty and rewards; administrative maintenance of profiles and rewards points.
  • Work closely with Guest Services and Marketing to ensure continued alignment of Loyalty strategy.
  • Support the department's efforts with respect to projects and development through systems such as (but not limited to) the GDS, IDS, CRS, PMS (Opera Cloud, TravelClick), mobile app and desktop website.

APPLICABLE SKILLS:

  • Minimum call centre experience, and/or experience in a development and/or special projects area within a hospitality or hotel management organization.
  • Proven record of developing, supporting and measuring special projects, guest feedback and loyalty activities.
  • Creative problem solver with a passion for innovation, critical thinking, problem resolution, organizational and analytical skills.
  • Ability to effectively interact with all levels within the organization; ensure maximum effectiveness of loyalty initiatives; use his/her networking experience to establish strong internal and external relationships in order to increase marketing opportunities; work well with others and influence teams.
  • Strong focus on performance delivery; results orientated.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work with and co-ordinate between various groups within various organizational structures.
  • Able to lead cross functional initiatives and influence effectively, collaborating with multiple levels within the organization, including senior management, support and operational managers.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills.
  • Developed project management skills, with the ability to manage several dissimilar projects simultaneously.
  • Highly developed PC skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint), including familiarity with key industry related software and databases such as the GDS, IDS, Extranets, CRS & PMS (Opera Cloud).
  • Written and verbal fluency in English is required. Bilingual in French and/or Spanish is an asset.

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

Sandman Hotel Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. Sandman Hotel Group does not discriminate on the basis of disability, veteran status or any other basis protected under federal, provincial or local laws. Sandman Hotel Group takes seriously its obligations under the Human Rights Code.

title: Content Coordinator
description:
Recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, sports, and construction, Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, the Dallas Stars, and Northland Asset Management Company. At this time Northland Properties is looking for a Content Coordinator to join its growing Digital team. The role will work within a cross-functional team, driving value by deploying content updates on all external & internal online/digital channels.

Responsibilities:

  • Implement timely content updates across applicable channels and mediums including Company owned/operated website(s), intranets, 3rd party websites, extranets, transactional & marketing emails, etc.
  • Undertake routine fact-checks to maintain quality, accuracy & relevancy of both written & visual content across applicable channels.
  • Coordinate with different teams [ie. hotel(s)/store(s), marketing, distribution, revenue, design teams] for content updates/maintenance & campaign activation including marketing & transactional emails.
  • Assist with preliminary search engine marketing & optimization tasks for timely content & campaign activation.
  • Continuously improve content management workflows and log both opportunities & bottlenecks with relevant vendor and/or team.

Requirements:

  • Minimum 1-2 years experience in agency role or previous experience in similar capacity with another hotel/hospitality brand will be an asset.
  • Bachelors degree in relevant field is mandatory.
  • Excellent oral, written & interpersonal communication abilities.
  • Strong command of English language is necessary.
  • Must be able to meet tight deadlines and execute flawlessly on projects in a fast-paced, multi-faceted team setting.
  • Familiarity with Content Management Systems (Drupal, Wordpress, Galaxy), HTML, SEO & SEM techniques and platforms will be beneficial.
  • Previous experience in administering multi-channel digital campaigns will be useful.
  • Professional appearance and manners.
  • Excellent Microsoft Office skills - Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.

Application Process:

Kindly submit your cover letter and resume using response function on this listing. Please include examples of projects and campaigns you may have dealt with in past roles in support of your application along with salary expectations. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted directly for in-person interview. Position will be based out of our Vancouver office.


SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with Northland Properties, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Accounts Payable Clerk
description:
Northland Properties is recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, sports, and construction. Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, Shark Club Sports Bar, Portmarnock Hotel and Golf Links, Revelstoke Mountain Resort, The Dallas Stars, Grouse Mountain, Northland Asset Management Company and more to come!

Proud to be 100% Canadian-owned and operated, with over 200 outlets nationwide, locations also in the UK and USA, their home office is in Vancouver and employs over 12,000 talented individuals.

Description:

We are looking for an AP specialist who has a passion for numbers, who is detail oriented while maintaining a high level of accuracy to join our Accounting team. This position will report to the AP Manager.

Key Responsibilities of the Role:

  • Coordinate and communicate with vendors
  • Reconciling of vendor statements
  • Processing and coding invoices and expense reports
  • Ensuring proper authorizations of invoices are in place
  • Monthly credit card reconciliations
  • Preparing weekly cheque runs and EFT
  • Assisting with month end procedures, reconciling GL and accruals process
  • Other duties as required

Requirements:

  • 2-3 years of experience in a high-volume environment
  • Retail or Hospitality experience would be an asset
  • Exceptional attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently, problem solve, and assist others when needed
  • Strong communication and computer skills
  • Ability to multi task and prioritize
  • Ability to adapt to fast paced, high growth environment
  • Exceptional time management skills and ability to meet deadlines

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Data Engineer
description:
Recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, and sports & entertainment. Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, the Dallas Stars, Grouse Mountain, Revelstoke Mountain Resort, and Northland Asset Management Company.

Business Challenge As Northland continues to rapidly expand its business across Canada, the US, and the UK, the company invests in cutting-edge technology to build a more customized and localized experience for its target markets. Technology and Marketing teams are spearheading initiatives such as a new eCommerce platform, Data Lake, CRM & ERP, along with other future-focused Hotel and Restaurant technologies.

Opportunity Northland is looking for a Data Engineer to manage existing data pipelines & repositories and support various enterprise project data needs. They will need to provide infrastructure support and management for both on-premises and cloud-based database systems. They will be required to develop, manage and support ETL processes with a keen eye on the performance and reliability of that information. May be required to assist with end-user reporting needs from time to time.

This position is based in Vancouver, Canada and will report to the Director, Project Delivery. They will work closely with the IT, Finance, Marketing, and other internal departments to power insight and provide meaningful data to enable consistently informed management decisions.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide day-to-day management and support of the data warehouse systems and troubleshoot existing procedures and processes to optimize for the complete system potential
  • Enhance data warehouse process models, including sourcing, loading, transformation, and extraction from other systems, such as food and beverage, property management systems, central reservation systems, and other third-party partners.
  • Works closely with other data consumers within the business to gather and populate data warehouse table structure and ensure data is optimized for reporting
  • Analyze business requirements for reporting and analysis and translate the emanating results into technical data design documents
  • Provide guidance and assistance for data visualization and report generation, specifically with visual data modelling tools such as Power BI
  • Verify the structure, accuracy, or quality of warehouse data
  • Implement transformative rulesets and data cleansing techniques to improve the quality and integrity of existing data
  • Create plans, test files, and scripts for data warehouse testing, ranging from unit to integration testing.
  • Create supporting documentation, such as metadata and diagrams of entity relationships, business processes, and process flow.

Skills & Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or related field, or equivalent work experience
  • Minimum two years experience in SQL server coding, SQL server database administration, and data warehouse development and architecture, preferably on the Microsoft Azure platform
  • Demonstratable understanding of dimensional modeling as well as other data warehousing techniques
  • Strong ability to draft, analyze and debug SQL queries and be proficient in scripting languages such as Python, C Sharp, Perl, and others.
  • Familiar with ETL (Extraction, Transformation, and Load), data warehousing, and business intelligence tools such as Power BI
  • Hands-on physical and logical database designing experience
  • Creative thinker with excellent analytical thinking, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail
  • Able to multi-task and prioritize workload
  • Deep passion for data analytic technologies as well as analytical and dimensional modelling
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to present information to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience in hospitality and/or travel industry preferred

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Food Production Assembly Worker - Mama Yolanda's Gourmet Lasagna
description:
Mama Yolandaâ€™s Gourmet Lasagna is home to the freshest frozen lasagna available in the freezer selection of retailers all across Ontario. Following a signature recipe thatâ€™s been passed down for seven generations, Mama Yolandaâ€™s is natural, fresh, and unapologetically Italian. Mama Yolandaâ€™s Gourmet Lasagna is a part of Carmenâ€™s Group;an entertainment and hospitality company committed to creating extraordinary experiences to our clients and guests.

If you have the desire to work as a Food Production Assembly Worker and are looking to join a team of champions we want to meet you.

AT MAMA YOLANDAâ€™S GORMET LASAGNA OUR PRODUCTION ASSEMBLY WORKERS HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO:

  • Effectively lead by example and work as a team of champions to achieve results.
  • Assist in all aspects of lasagna production, which includes following a specific recipe for the making of a patented sauce recipe (vegetable prep, spice prep, and grinding of meat products), the making of pasta sheets, and ultimately the assembly of lasagnas.
  • Ability to maintain clean and sanitized work area.
  • Work in a safe and conscientious manner.

PRODUCTION ASSEMBLY WORKER POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

  • Ability and desire to work in a team environment
  • 2 years food prep experience an asset
  • Experience in a HACCP approved food manufacturing facility an asset
  • Good communication and interpersonal skills
  • Ability to follow directions of Supervisory staff
  • Some positions require heavy lifting and repetitive movements
  • Self-starter requiring limited supervision

WHAT CAN WE OFFER?

  • Competitive wage package
  • Pay on demand
  • Full time, Monday-Friday schedule on the day shift
  • Pay on demand
  • Health and Dental benefits
  • Staff recognition, years of service rewards
  • Group RRSP
  • Hotel discounts
  • Wellbeing programs
  • Participation in staff events
  • Opportunities for growth and a chance to play a role in our vision to continue being innovators and industry champions within the Hamilton hospitality community

Carmenâ€™s Group is an entertainment and hospitality company committed to creating extraordinary memories for our guests and clients. Driven by our passion, creativity, innovative thinking, and world class service, we have remained industry champions for over 40 years. We are committed to enriching the lives of our guests through providing one of a kind experiences at each of our venues including Carmenâ€™s Banquet Centre, The Best Western Premier C Hotel by Carmenâ€™s, The Lakeview by Carmenâ€™s, and The Hamilton Convention Centre by Carmenâ€™s. We are devoted to bringing excitement to Hamilton and Southern Ontario, and to enhancing the image of Hamilton with every strategic initiative we pursue.

Carmen's Group makes certain there is an equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. Carmen's Group will strive to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability during the recruitment process, please notify Human Resources upon scheduling your interview.

title: Heavy Duty Mechanic - Field
description:
Company:

Finning Canada

Number of Openings:

1

Worker Type:

Permanent

Position Overview:

Join the Finning Canada family, part of the world’s largest Caterpillar dealer. We are currently looking for a dedicated Heavy Duty Mechanic who will be responsible for the field troubleshooting, maintenance and repair of a variety of Caterpillar and auxiliary equipment, based out of the Grande Prairie location.

This position will work a Monday-Friday, 5x2 shift rotation. If you are a safety conscious team player, self-motivated, autonomous, detail-oriented and possess your Journeyperson Heavy Equipment Technician certification with a valid driver’s license, then you are exactly who we are looking for!

Job Description:

  • Troubleshoot and repair Caterpillar equipment
  • Perform field diagnosis and field running repairs
  • Utilize Caterpillar SIS and ET daily
  • Complete technical documentation (service reports, warranty, crossover notes)
  • Interact with customers, sales support, and the rest of the Finning team
  • Work with the Service Supervisor and Leadhand on various tasks as required

Qualifications:

  • Interprovincial Heavy Equipment Technician (HET) Certification
  • Valid driver’s license with a successful recent drivers abstract
  • Safety conscious team player with excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills with a high attention to detail
  • Completion of Finning S-Levels, Failure Analysis, Machine Electronic Controls, or Tier 4 training would be considered an asset
  • Completion of Caterpillar product courses would be considered an asset

Note:

  • This field position is located out of the Grande Prairie branch on a Monday-Friday, 5x2 shift rotation
  • Overtime will be required along with some weekend work
  • May be required to work out of town - stay in camp or hotel
  • Candidate selection will be in compliance with the terms of the current collective agreement
  • Any future shift changes that may occur will be made in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Collective Agreement

We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

title: Community & Event Development Coordinator
description:
General Information:

 

As an equal opportunity employer, the City of Thunder Bay encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority groups and women.

 

ONTARIO HUMAN RIGHTS CODE:  It is a contravention of the Human Rights Code of Ontario to discriminate on the basis of: race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, age, record of offences, gender identity or gender expression.  Therefore, a resume submitted to the City must not include references to any of the above characteristics.  Do not include: 

  • Photos
  • Any certificates that have photo identification
  • Driver’s licences
  • Police records checks

Note: The above documentation will be requested by the Human Resources & Division should you be the successful applicant.  If a Criminal Record Check is required it will be requested by Human Resources should you be the successful applicant.  Please do not submit your Criminal Record Check with your application.

 

ACCOMMODATION:  Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for all parts of the recruitment process.

 

PRIVACY: Personal information on this form is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 302, as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment. Questions about this collection of personal information should be directed to the Human Resources & Corporate Safety Division, 125 Syndicate Ave Suite 42, Thunder Bay, Ontario, P7E 6H8, Telephone: 625-3866

 

Application forms must reference the competition number and be submitted to Human Resources by 11:59 p.m. on the closing date. 

 

Job Description

POSITION SUMMARY:  Under the general supervision of the Sport & Community Development Supervisor, is responsible for coordinating and providing support and services to community festivals and events and community development initiatives in accordance with the objectives of the Inspire Thunder Bay Culture Plan and Recreation & Facilities Master Plan, including program and service delivery at Prince Arthur’s Landing.  Key responsibilities include: overall management of the Event Services Program and the municipal Special Event License process, acting as a spokesperson for recreation programs and services at the Prince Arthur’s Landing site, developing and implementing a communications plan; liaising with the community groups, service providers and different groups of workers who maintain and operate this site; and supporting development, implementation and evaluation of innovative events, programs, and activities that utilize both new and existing infrastructure at Prince Arthur’s Landing.

 

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Participates as a member of the Section’s service delivery team to carry out the goals and objectives of the division.
  • Coordinates the City’s support to community events through the Event Services Program. Serves as a first point of contact for event organizers; assists in the coordination of City services and equipment involved with special events.
  • Coordinates licence and permit approvals and related meetings between event organizers and relevant City officials.
  • Works in co-operation and maintains regular communication with City police, Fire Rescue Service, Superior North EMS, Infrastructure & Operations Department, Parks & Open Spaces, Development & Emergency Services Department, and other departments and agencies involved in the Special Event Licence and Temporary Street Closure approval processes.
  • Ensures that streets are closed in accordance with Authorizations for Temporary Street Closure.
  • Develops, maintains and coordinates distribution of information and equipment resources to community groups.
  • Serves as on-site supervisor for point of contact and emergency/issues management at City facilities during events as required.
  • Assists with bid preparation and hosting activities for multi-sport games.
  • Conducts research, policy, and statistical analysis; researches and recommends opportunities for development, partnerships, and collaboration. Reviews opportunities for new/expanded programs and services at the Waterfront.
  • Develops promotional materials and content. 
  • Develops, implements, evaluates, and updates a marketing and communications plan to promote Prince Arthur's Landing, its facilities, programs, and events to local and tourist markets.
  • Develops methodology to monitor park usage/attendance for annual reporting.
  • Establishes and maintains positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders including the Yacht Club, Marina Boaters, Water Garden Pavilion Restaurant operator, Baggage Building operator, Waterfront hotel operator, CN Station tenants, relevant private developers, Events, Volunteers, Tourism, Public Art, Children & Youth, Police and Fire.
  • Develops calls for interest and request for proposals for year round and seasonal commercial, program and service opportunities at Prince Arthur’s Landing as required.
  • Maintains and updates the Unit’s web pages and social media.
  • Coordinates development opportunities for community event organizers on topics such as health & safety, organizational development, fundraising, marketing and sector trends.
  • Supervises program staff including recruitment and hiring, staff development, performance management/review, coaching/mentoring, health and safety, and discipline and termination decisions.
  • Participates in developing and implementing external visiting or hosted events.
  • Performs such other related duties as may be assigned.

  • QUALIFICATIONS:       

     

    Education/Experience:

    • Degree in a related field such as recreation, special event management, tourism, human services, social sciences or public or business administration along with two (2) years of experience in festival and event management and working with community and volunteer organizations; or
    • Diploma in a related field such as recreation, special event management, tourism, human services, social sciences or public or business administration along with four (4) years of experience in festival and event management and working with community and volunteer organizations.
    • Knowledge of the festivals and events sector
    • Previous supervisory experience
    • Experience in community development and partnerships, marketing, fundraising, organizational/event/sport development

    Skills/Abilities:

    • Ability to communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing
    • Must possess superior analytical, multi-tasking, organizational, customer service and teamwork skills
    • Demonstrated interpersonal skills and ability to establish and maintain effective professional and working relationships with a variety of people including funding agencies, staff, community partners and the public
    • Proven facilitation, report writing, presentation and oral communication skills
    • Ability to identify, understand, and meet/exceed the requirements of internal/external customers
    • Strong research, project/time management, analytical and problem-solving skills
    • Proven ability to function and contribute as an effective team member and to work independently
    • Must be at an intermediate skill level in word processing and spreadsheet software
    • Must be competent within the meaning of the Occupational Health and Safety Act

    Assets:

    • Experience in web page management
    • Knowledge of Thunder Bay’s festivals and events sector
    • Knowledge of the functions of City departments, outside boards and local community groups

    CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT: 

    • May be required to travel to various work locations and provide own transportation
    • Must be able to work irregular hours, and off site as required
    • Must undergo a successful Criminal Record and Judicial Matters Check (CRJMC)

title: Digital Marketing Strategist
description:
Recognized throughout Canada as one of the most trusted names in hotels, restaurants, sports, and construction, Northland Properties Corporation is the force behind such brands as Sandman Hotel Group, The Sutton Place Hotels, Moxie's Grill & Bar, Chop Steakhouse & Bar, Denny's Restaurants, the Dallas Stars, and Northland Asset Management Company. At this time Northland Properties is looking for an experienced Digital Marketing Strategist to join its growing Digital team. This new role will effectively connect our brands with their respective online customers based on insights & data. The role will work within a cross-functional team, driving value by aligning emerging opportunities and our business goals via digital channels.

Responsibilities:

  • Build, plan & implement digital marketing strategies using all necessary tools (e.g. website, emails, social media and blogs) & channels (organic vs. paid)
  • Research products, services and current strategies to identify new opportunities
  • Analyze & measure ROI and KPIs by way of standard traffic metrics and suggest solutions to measurably improve online content/web presence
  • Monitor & report SEO/SEM/Paid Social efforts including marketing and sales performance metrics to forecast trends
  • Keep up-to-date with changing market dynamics and proactively suggest new campaigns
  • Liaise with Marketing, Sales, Distribution, Design and Content teams to optimize campaign deployment, customer experience and brand consistency
  • Establish & share best practices in digital marketing by brand for larger team
  • Stay up-to-date with digital technologies developments including monitoring competition

Requirements:

  • 5+ years as a Digital Marketing Strategist or Digital Marketing Manager with a hospitality company or commensurate agency background
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical and project management skills
  • Demonstrable experience with SEO/SEM and CRM software
  • Familiarity with Marketing Automation & Social Acquisition will be beneficial
  • Experience implementing and optimizing Google Adwords campaigns
  • Solid knowledge of web analytics tools like Google Analytics
  • Hands on experience with online marketing tools and practices
  • Familiarity with web design and HTML
  • Degree in Marketing, Digital Technologies, Advertising or relevant field

SUMMATION:

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.

**Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.

**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with Northland Properties, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Count Team Member - Membre de l'Ã©quipe de comptage
description:
Playground is rapidly expanding and is currently seeking a dynamic, efficient and honest Count Team Member to join our Cage Operations team.

Playground is proud to have grown from modest beginnings to a poker destination of international caliber.  With the continued support of poker players from all over the world, Playground continues to expand and further develop our service offerings for our valued guests. Conveniently located just 15 minutes south of downtown Montreal in the Mohawk territory of Kahnawake, the complex currently offers over 40 poker tables and a selection of over 500 Electronic Gaming Devices (slots). In addition, Playground includes an inviting and locally renowned restaurant The Rail Coal Fire Bistro and is in the midst of an exciting expansion project that will include expanding the gaming floors, a stunning hotel and additional contemporary food and beverage outlets. 

Schedule: Wednesday-Sunday 6AM-3PM

Reporting to the Count Team Supervisor and Cage Supervisor, the incumbent in this position is responsible for performing the activities of the Count Room(s) to ensure the integrity of all currency and chip counts derived from EGMâ€™s and poker tables, as well as ensuring compliance with the Kahnawake Gaming Commission (KGC) regulations.

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain protection of large amounts of chips and/or currency, ensuring loss prevention by showing great attention to detail.
  • Ensure that procedures and proper controls are followed to protect counted receipts.
  • Sustain close control of all activity in the Count Rooms by maintaining an awareness of changes and/or problems; which may affect the security of the currency and chips in the Count Rooms.
  • Maintain visual and electronic surveillance of personnel to certify prevention of monetary loss.
  • Perform and observe counts, review count slips, and reconcile total funds to ensure the integrity of the count.
  • Transfer receipts to the Cage and the corresponding documentation to the accounting department on a daily basis.
  • Order and stock parts for equipment repair to ensure proper operation and maintenance of all equipment.
  • Perform the duties described in compliance with local laws and regulations.
  • Have knowledge of the regulations, policies, and procedures relating to the employeeâ€™s department.
  • Consult Internal Control Procedures and Policy Manuals for guidance.
  • Report illegal activity to Security and Surveillance or appropriate levels of Management.

Requirements:

  • Ability to communicate effectively with co-workers and management
  • Ability to identify, count and stack different denominations of gaming chips and currency
  • Ability to move or lift full and empty cash/chips boxes weighing up to 20 pounds each
  • Ability to remain standing for the majority of shift and efficiently move around the counting room area
  • Must be at least 18 years of age
  • Flexibility with scheduling (nights, weekends, holidays, special events, and extended
  • hours)
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, with experience of business specific software or computer applications preferred
  • Fluency in English and French (written/spoken)
  • Experience in counting, management and supervision is a strong asset
