title: Custodian
description:
About Us

VOALA

Helping Our Most Vulnerable Change Their Life Stories

Volunteers of America is a non-profit human services organization committed to serving people in need, strengthening families, and building communities. VOALA provides a variety of social services to Los Angeles area communities such as Head Start programs, Upward Bound college prep programs, veterans’ services, homeless shelters, low-income housing program as well as drug and alcohol rehabilitation. Learn more at www.voala.org.

Job Summary And Purpose

The Custodian performs daily janitorial duties, and immediate minor repairs to the facility, reporting any maintenance or safety deficiency to management for correction. Performs all tasks needed to maintain cleanliness, sanitation and safety of the facility, adhering to janitorial schedules provided

Duties And Responsibilities
  • Maintains the interior and exterior of the facility, including building, parking lot and grounds, in good condition
    • Daily cleaning of assigned areas using various cleaning products.
    • Restock bathrooms
    • Responsible for dusting, window cleaning, waste cans, and vacuuming lobby area and hallways.
  • Performs or assists in minor repairs that might include the following: Carpentry, Plumbing, Interior painting, Refurbishing and cleaning, Landscape and irrigation systems.
  • Follows daily checklist provided by supervisor; Assures tools and supplies are stocked and appropriately secured in store rooms; maintains cleanliness and order of store rooms
  • Checks facility daily for any safety concerns; understands local and building safety codes and requirements as well as OSHA, health department and EPA requirements; reports all deficiencies to management
  • Prepares and sets-up rooms for meetings, classes and events
  • Other duties as assigned
Qualifications

REQUIREMENTS:
  • Must be able to pass a fingerprint clearance, background check, including criminal history, personal references, employment and education verifications
Experience
  • Experience cleaning high foot traffic areas and bathrooms, or similar building maintenance experience
Knowledge
  • Must be able to understand how to safely work with caustic chemicals and cleaning materials
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to perform under circumstances of possible emotional stress and conflict, including dealing with un-cooperative clients.
  • Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA, FMLA, and other federal, state, and local standards, with or without reasonable accommodation, including meeting qualitative and quantitative productivity standards.
  • Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with ADA, FMLA, and other federal, state, and local standards.
Competencies
  • Must have valid California driver's license and have clean driving record to be insured by VOALA insurance
Preferred Qualifications
  • High school diploma (or GED/High School Equivalence Certificate)
  • Custodial or building maintenance experience in a shelter or a school setting preferred
  • Ability to read and write instructions in English preferred
  • Background in construction trades a plus
  • Proven familiarity with homelessness and related issues a plus
Voala Benefits Summary
  • Choice of 3 medical insurance plans
  • Choice of 2 dental insurance plans (one plan for employee only; has no premium)
  • Vision insurance plan
  • Voluntary Supplemental Coverage
  • Accidental Injury Coverage
  • Hospital Care Coverage
  • Critical Illness Coverage
  • Pet Insurance
  • Paid vacation time
  • Paid sick time
  • 10 company paid holidays
  • Company funded 401a retirement pension plan
  • Optional employee contribution to 403b retirement savings plan
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • Programs to maintain your health and well-being
  • Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) – (No cost to employee and 100% confidential)
  • Company funded Short-term Disability Insurance (STDI) Insurance
  • Company funded Long-term Disability Insurance (LTD)
Volunteers of America is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran Status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law

This employer participates in E-Verify as required by the federal government and will provide the federal government with your Form 1-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S.

If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (OHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment.

title: ACTIVITY WORKER (CASUAL)
description:
Are you someone who has a real passion for helping others? Follow the path to an exciting career in long-term care. Help create a home environment for our seniors at Acropolis Manor.

Positions at this level function under the general supervision of a senior position such as an Occupational Therapist, Registered Nurse, D.O.N., Site Manager or Activity Program Director. These positions assist in providing a balanced program of purposeful services and activities to meet client’s activation, life skills, recreational and social needs which will encourage clients to maintain optimum levels of involvement and independence.

Acropolis Manor is composed of three units East Pod, North Pod and West Pod. All Pods are located on the main floor. There are 56 beds including three respite beds plus five short stay beds. Acropolis Manor is attached to Prince Rupert Regional Hospital through a covered link on one end. Downtown is minutes away and residents can access Handi-Dart and taxi services as needed. The Recreation Therapist who develops therapeutic and leisure interventions that are tailored to support the mental, physical, social and spiritual well-being of the residents who live at Acropolis Manor establish recreation opportunities.

Prince Rupert is a coastal port city with a population of 12,220 (2021). It is nestled into a mountain and surrounded by the Great Bear Rainforest. See rare wildlife, explore our rugged landscapes, and experience world-class fishing adventures you won’t find anywhere else. Check out more on Prince Rupert, known as the halibut capital of the world.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.
  • Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service
  • Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions
  • Employee referral program
  • Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC
  • “Loan Forgiveness Programs” offered through the Federal and BC Government
  • Grade 12.
  • Successful completion of recognized recreational program plus two (2) years of recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing.
  • Physical ability to carry out duties of position.
  • Ability to organise work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Ability to teach.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation’s communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.
skills: ['Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service', 'Successful completion of recognized recreational program plus two (2) years of recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.']

description:

Job Description

Provides organized recreation and leisure activities to enhance clients/patients/residents quality of life (mental, emotional, physical and spiritual).

Experience

  • Basic computer skills, where required by the job
  • Valid drivers license, where required by the job
  • Organizational skills
  • Communication skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to work with special needs clients/patients/residents
Other Information

Additional Information

No guaranteed hours. Must be available a minimum of twenty-four (24) hours per 3 week period. Must be available all shifts, short shifts, short notice calls, stats and holidays, where applicable.

Working in Canada

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :OLIVER

Facility :MCKINNEY PLACE

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

We are presently seeking new team members to join our Recreation Therapy Department at McKinney Place in Oliver BC. A strong candidate will have completed a course or certificate from a recognized recreation therapy program and hold a Class 4 BC Driver’s License.

The facility embodies a resident-centered philosophy designed to support residents’ choices, help people function at their highest level, and provide the best quality of life possible. It is a one-storey building on 11 acres, with 153 residential, 60 short-stay and 2 respite beds.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents and short stay clients. This position assists in getting residents to/from their programs and carries out established leisure/recreation therapy programs. Staff go on outings with the residents and facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.) including one-to-one programs. The Recreation Therapy Worker also reports relevant observations of resident progress and behavior to the Supervisor/Recreation Therapist and provides suggestions for changes or modifications to the existing programs.

Casual employment means work requirements can vary between Zero and 37.5 hours per week. Shifts are primarily on days. Shift times are from 08:00 to 16:00 or 09:00 to 17:00. Once hired into a casual role, employees are eligible to apply for internal postings including permanent part time or full time positions. There are many opportunities with Interior Health that begin with casual on-call positions and lead to regular employment.

Apply today to join a great team!

**Please Note**
  • We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.
  • Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor
Qualifications

Education, Training and Experience:
  • Grade 12, completion of a recognized recreation course(s) plus two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license as required
This posting is for casual work at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order. The posting is open to all qualified staff but those currently working at a single site facility should note that the hiring Manager will contact the current Manager to discuss the ability to release staff.

title: Yard Worker
description:
Job Description

Join Our Team!

Sunbelt Rentals strives to be the customer's first choice in the equipment rental industry. From pumps to scaffolding to general construction tools, we aim to be the only call needed to outfit a job site with the proper equipment. Not only do we offer a vast fleet that ranks among the best in the industry, we pair it all with a friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our employees are our greatest asset, and although we present a comprehensive equipment offering, our expertise and service are what truly distinguish us from the competition.

We pride ourselves on investing in our workforce and offer competitive benefits, as well as extensive on-the-job training for all eligible employees.

As a highly successful national company, we are constantly looking for talented individuals to support our growth. If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career, we invite you to review our opportunities!

Job Description Summary

Are you seeking an entrepreneurial, empowering workplace that allows you to:
  • Work in a challenging, fast-paced environment where no day is the same
  • Advance into mechanic, driver or customer service roles
  • Work with an incredible team of people in a safety-focused culture

Sunbelt Rentals--the fastest growing rental business in North America--is seeking a Yard Worker.

The Yard Worker is responsible for the stationing and retrieving equipment on the location's property. The role maintains a written maintenance schedule and may service equipment as necessary to ensure equipment meets all set specifications. The Yard Worker also inspects equipment prior to and after rental to document any lost and/or damaged equipment, wash bay duties.

Education or experience that prepares you for success:
  • High school diploma or GED preferred
  • Experience with common construction and industrial tools preferred
  • Some experience and/or training in repair of mechanical equipment preferred

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities You May Rely On
  • Ability to communicate effectively with customers (written and oral)
  • Ability to perform basic math skills (add, subtract, multiply and divide)
  • Working knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, etc)
  • General mechanical aptitude
  • safety-focus

The physical demands of this role require bending, squatting, crouching, reaching, lifting 50 pounds or more, and working indoors/outdoors when required by the job. The above description is not a complete listing of all miscellaneous, incidental or similar duties which may be required from day to day. Reasonable accommodations may be made to comply with applicable laws.

Related experience may include: Porter Hostler, Yard Hand, Yard Jockey, Yard Spotter, Entry Level Mechanic, Mechanic Trainee, Construction Laborer, Washbay Attendant, Equipment Washer, Forklift Driver, Warehouse Worker

Sunbelt Rentals has competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits program.

Although we appreciate all who apply we will contact only those candidates who meet our requirements.

Sunbelt Rentals requires applicants to undergo a background verification process prior to commencing employment with the company. Employment with Sunbelt Rentals is contingent on the satisfactory completion of a pre-employment background check.

Sunbelt Rentals is an Equal Opportunity Employer — women, people with disabilities, Aboriginal peoples, and visible minorities.

EAST21

Gear up for an exciting career!

If a current Sunbelt Rentals employee has referred you for an employment opportunity please notify them that you are applying for this position. In order for the employee to get a referral bonus they need to contact their regional recruiter.

title: Food Prep Worker - Yosemite - Wawona Hotel
description:
Job Description

The Food Prep Worker prepares, and portions food items and performs various duties in accordance with production requirements and Aramark sanitation standards. Uses daily worksheets and standardized recipes to cook meals.

Job Responsibilities
  • Prepares all food items using prep lists and standard Aramark recipes.
  • Follows proper food handling procedures.
  • Maintains accurate rotation of food to assure top quality and freshness.
  • Manages leftover foods correctly; cover, label, date, and accurately store according to Aramark standards.
  • Maintains clean and orderly refrigerators and work areas.
  • Ensures stations are cleaned, sanitized, and organized at the end of the shift (including cleaning of kitchen equipment).
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary work environment that conforms to all food safety standards and regulations.
  • Follows safety policies and accident reporting procedures.
  • Completes all required training.
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Minimum one-year prep work or food service-related work preferred.
  • Knowledge of food prep, proper knife handling, temperature control, and sanitation is helpful.
  • Must be able to read and write to facilitate communication with others.
  • Mathematical ability required.
Education

About Aramark

Our Mission

Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.

At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

About Aramark

The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food, facilities, and uniform services in 19 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook , Instagram and Twitter .

title: Form Yard Worker
description:
BURNCO's BC Ready-Mix Division is recruiting a Form Yard Worker for our Ready-Mix division in Vernon, BC. Reporting to the Form Yard Foreman, the duties vary from day to day depending on customer requirements. The role will be primarily assembling form package orders, cleaning and maintaining the forms, constructing new forms or swamping with the delivery truck. Stripping, re assembling and oiling lock block forms. Our concrete form yard is an integral part of our business, being used by contractors for forming up foundations to have BURNCO concrete poured in residential construction projects. This is a full time, seasonal role to start.

Location: Vernon, British Columbia

What You Will Be Doing

All responsibilities below are deemed required and are variable in frequency:
  • Construction and maintenance of wood forms
  • Cleaning and oiling concrete forms
  • Assisting the Crane truck with form deliveries to customers’ sites
  • Safe operation of a Forklift to load and move forms
  • Operate hand tools
  • Other duties as required

Reality of the Job
  • You will work long hours during peak times and demand
  • You'll be working Monday through Friday (and weekends from time-to-time as required)

Requirements

What We Would Like From You
  • Experience working with wood concrete forms is an asset
  • Physically fit and able to lift 50+ lbs / 23+ kgs
  • Class 5 license required
  • Capable of working in all weather conditions
  • Ability to work safely in a fast-paced environment
  • Display and maintain a strong and positive work ethic, following all instructions as issued by the Form Yard Foreman
  • Enjoy working independently and within a team
  • Successful candidate must have a track record of being punctual and reliable; being at work every day and on time is a core requirement
  • Forklift operating experience is considered an asset
  • Having experience or knowledge of the concrete and construction materials industry would be an asset

IMPORTANT: As this is a safety sensitive position, it is a condition of employment that candidates selected for hire must successfully pass pre-employment background checks that includes a drug and alcohol screen (including cannabis - regardless of purpose or use frequency), as well as a Fitness To Work assessment.

Posting Open Until Filled

Since 1912, BURNCO has been supplying aggregate construction materials as a successful, family-run business based in Calgary. Over the last 110 years we have embraced innovative technology and new marketplaces while always maintaining the vision and values that were first introduced by our founder, James F. Burns. Today we continue our unwavering commitment to safety, our renewed focus on family leadership and our steady, dependable growth into the future. We look forward to having you join us on that journey.

title: Activity Worker
description:
Job Title Activity WorkerWork Site Evergreen Extended Care Unit, Powell River General Hospital - Powell River, BCStatus CasualStart Date

As soon as possible

Salary $25.83 per hourHours VariousReference# 148303-atr

Come work as an Activity Worker in Powell River, BC with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for an Activity Worker who has completed recognized recreational courses to join its team at Powell River Hospital. Apply today to join our team! In this position you will work in cooperation with a multi-disciplinary team to carry out activity programs.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order) as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

As an Activity Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health you will make your impact by
  • Organizing activities, accompanying clients/residents on outings, and coordinating portering.
  • Demonstrating and teaching activity techniques, and assisting clients/residents with practicing daily living skills.
  • Reporting relevant observations of client/resident progress and behaviours to Therapists and/or other healthcare staff.
  • Providing direction to volunteers, and organizing equipment and supplies for activities.
  • Ensuring a safe work environment and maintaining established inventory of supplies.
About Powell River, Bc

On the Sunshine Coast of British Columbia, where endless green mountains meet sheltered Pacific Ocean waters, Powell River provides a stimulating blend of outdoor adventure and cultural amenities. Originally founded as a resource extraction centre - once home to the world's largest pulp and paper mill - Powell River now offers adventurers countless opportunities for kayaking, canoeing, rock climbing, golfing, boating, hiking, biking, fishing, and scuba diving. This area is host to world-class art galleries, tremendous dining opportunities, and memorable events and festivals.

On the doorstep of both Vancouver and Vancouver Island, the Powell River region offers an array of experiences for travelers of all kinds, no matter the season. Experience the legendary Sunshine Coast Trail and Powell Forest Canoe Route, rock-climb the Eldred Valley, snowshoe in the Knuckleheads; this is the adventure destination you've long been waiting for.

Qualifications

Education & Experience
  • Grade 12, completion of recognized recreational courses plus two (2) years’ recent related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Knowledge & Abilities
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to teach.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity and inclusion are essential to delivering exceptional care and building a great place to work. At VCH, we value and accommodate unique differences to ensure that our staff and medical staff (both current and prospective) have the opportunity and are supported to thrive.

To build a strong and representative workforce, we are seeking candidates who will contribute to a caring and inclusive culture. We encourage applications from members of communities that are disadvantaged on any grounds under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including Indigenous Peoples, people of colour, people of all genders and sexualities and people with disabilities.

VCH is proud to be recognized as a Best Place to Work in Canada in 2021 by Glassdoor and Forbes.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Furniture Builder and Recovery Co-Worker
description:
WHO YOU ARE
• You are enthusiastic about work and working with others on a team
• You can prioritize, are disciplined, show initiative and have a flexible attitude
• You’ve worked with material handling equipment before (or are very open to learning about it!)
• You are computer savvy and generally comfortable with technology (and can easily learn new software and systems)
• You have about 6-month work experience in a high-volume environment where you dealt with replenishment and receiving (warehouse experience is a strong asset but not necessary)
• You are totally cool working in a physically demanding, fast-paced, work environment

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
• Focus on understanding how you impact the customer experience by making sound decisions on which returned products can be put back on the shelves and which cannot, and how to responsibly and sustainably handle those that cannot
• Properly process products that can be given a second chance, ensuring presentable and proper packaging, assembly, pricing and labeling
• Proactively partner with other internal departments to minimize their internal damages and waste
• Proudly display IKEA products in the As-Is section, ensuring displays are clear and attractive
• Always be aware of customers when on the shop floor, prioritizing their requests and needs, giving suggestions even when engaged in other tasks
• Always consider the sustainability impact when deciding when and how to recover our products
• Support the team and with additional duties, as required

TOGETHER AS A TEAM
The Recovery team contributes to the completion of the store replenishment process before opening, in the most efficient, commercial and safe way and secure the goods flow operations are optimized. They do this through using knowledge of IKEA, as well as the IKEA tools and the experience and expertise of their colleagues. This results in agreed goods availability for customers at the lowest possible costs.




JUST SO YOU KNOW
In the IKEA world, this position is officially referred to as: Recovery Co-Worker

Full-time: 35+ hours / week (Including Evenings and Weekends)

Address: 1000 Lougheed Highway, Coquitlam, British Columbia V3K 3T5

Internal candidate application deadline: April 18, 2022

Please note: This position requires the submission of a satisfactory criminal record check. A record under the Criminal Code and/or other federal offence record(s) does not automatically mean you will be ineligible for the position.

title: Étudiant d'été Aide ouvrier - Routes, déchets solide, graffitis et bouche d'incendie
description:
No de demande : 1295 

Direction générale : Direction générale des travaux publics

Postes multiples

Information sur le salaire : $15.013 par heure (taux de rémunération de 2022)

Affiliation : CUPE 503 Inside/Outside 

Ville: Ottawa, ON

Catégorie d’emploi : Recrutement d'étudiants pour les emplois d'été; Entretien et métiers 

Date limite des candidatures : 2022-09-02

RÉSUMÉ DES FONCTIONS

Le mandat du Service des routes et du stationnement consiste à assurer l’entretien intégré, efficace et en toute sécurité des emprises routières municipales et du réseau de transport ainsi que la gestion des fonctions relatives au stationnement.

Le titulaire est responsable de l’exécution des activités d’entretien des routes dans la zone géographique qui lui est assignée.

L’aide-ouvrier IV, Entretien, est chargé de consigner toute utilisation quotidienne des bornes-fontaines aux différents emplacements. Le titulaire est posté à différents lieux dans la ville. De plus, il aide à résumer et à analyser les données, ainsi qu’à maintenir à jour la base de données des bouches de vidange.

L’aide-ouvrier, Entretien – graffiti doit prêter main-forte aux techniciens en élimination des graffiti. La tâche comprend la préparation et le renouvellement des stocks du parc de véhicules, la prise de photos avant et après le nettoyage, le calcul et le remplissage des feuilles de données, la prestation d’une aide au technicien lors de l’application de produits chimiques pour l’enlèvement des graffiti sur la surface vandalisée, la recherche de graffiti dans les secteurs à tolérance zéro durant la patrouille des techniciens.

Lorsqu’il aura reçu une formation plus approfondie, l’aide-ouvrier, Entretien – graffiti pourra aider à l’installation de l’équipement de gestion de la circulation, comprenant des cônes et des panneaux de circulation, ainsi qu’à l’exécution des tâches du signaleur routier. Ses autres tâches sont de surveiller et de trier les demandes de services, et d’y répondre.

FORMATION ET EXPÉRIENCE

Études secondaires en cours - Avoir terminé au moins sa 10e année.

Au moins un (1) an, mais pas plus de deux (2) ans, d’expérience pertinente requise

Expérience préalable du travail à l’extérieur en lien avec l’exécution de tâches physiques connexes aux activités d’entretien des routes.

PERMIS ET ACCRÉDITATIONS

Permis de conduire en règle catégorie G sans restriction de l’Ontario (ou l’équivalent provincial) et au plus 6 points d’inaptitude perdus

CONNAISSANCES

Connaître les lois pertinentes en matière de santé et de sécurité, les dangers réels ou potentiels pour la santé et la sécurité en milieu de travail et les mesures à prendre pour assurer la santé et la sécurité du personnel, conformément aux lois de même qu’aux politiques et procédures municipales pertinentes.

COMPÉTENCES ET APTITUDES
  • Savoir conduire des véhicules légers, se servir de petits appareils (p. ex., une tondeuse à gazon, un taille-bordures, une souffleuse à feuilles, etc.) et être disposé à le faire.
  • Être capable de:
  • suivre des directives;
  • travailler de façon responsable sous une supervision minimale;
  • bien travailler au sein d’une équipe.
  • Capacité de soulever des objets leurs et disposition à le faire.
  • Capacité de travailler à l’extérieur, quelles que soient les conditions météorologiques, et disposition à le faire.
  • Porter des bottes de travail homologuées par la CSA.
  • Avoir accès à son propre véhicule.

CE QUE VOUS DEVEZ SAVOIR
  • Exigences linguistiques : Exigences linguistiques variées; la maîtrise de l’anglais, du français OU des deux langues peut être exigée. Certains postes nécessitent la capacité à parler, à lire et à écrire en anglais ou en français.; Exigences linguistiques variées; la maîtrise de l’anglais, du français OU des deux langues peut être exigée. Certains postes nécessitent la capacité à parler, à lire et à écrire en anglais ou en français.
  • Exigences relatives au permis de conduire : Posséder un permis de conduire valide de l’Ontario de catégorie G sans restriction (ou un permis équivalent délivré par une autre province) comportant un maximum de six points d’inaptitude.
  • Doit fournir ses propres chaussures de sécuritéàsemelle point vert homologuées CSA.
  • Une expérience jugée pertinente et une formation reconnue et dont la fiche de service atteste d’un rendement satisfaisant et d’aptitudes manifestes pourront permettre aux candidats de ne pas être tenus de satisfaire à l’exigence relative aux études requises.
  • Veuillez conserver une copie de l’avis de concours. Une fois la date de clôture passée, il ne sera plus disponible.

Nous remercions tous les candidats de leur intérêt et leurs efforts déployés dans le cadre du présent processus de sélection. Toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes retenues pour une entrevue. La Ville d’Ottawa promeut les principes de la diversité et de l’inclusion et respecte les principes de la Loi canadienne sur les droits de la personne et du Code des droits de la personne de l’Ontario. Nous encourageons la candidature de femmes, d’Autochtones et de personnes de toute race, origine ethnique, religion, capacité, orientation sexuelle et identité et expression de genre.

La Ville d’Ottawa offre, sur demande et pendant tout le processus d’embauche, des mesures d’adaptation aux personnes handicapées qui présentent une demande d’emploi. Si nous communiquons avec vous pour participer au processus de sélection, veuillez nous indiquer si vous avez besoin de mesures d’adaptation.

Des formats accessibles et des soutiens à la communication sont offerts sur demande. Veuillez communiquer avec le CentreServiceRH@ottawa.ca au 613-580-2424, poste 47411. Centre de services des RH au 613-580-2424, poste 47411.

title: RECREATION WORKER (RW-01)
description:
RHA Job Number:GO-00674064

Number of Vacancies:1

Profession:Recreation Worker

Hours of Work:Shift Information: Weekends

In a 6 week rotation: 6 shifts of 6.50 hours

Rate of Pay:Pay Band 10 $22.020 to $23.550 (3 step range)

Job Description

Provides organized recreation and leisure activities to enhance clients/patients/residents quality of life (mental, emotional, physical and spiritual).

Job Qualifications

  • Grade 12
Experience

Previous: Twelve (12) months previous experience working in a health care environment.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities

  • Basic computer skills, where required by the job
  • Valid drivers license, where required by the job
  • Organizational skills
  • Communication skills
  • Ability to work independently

Other Information

title: Resident Caretaker
description:
There is an exciting opportunity for a talented professional to join the Property Management team as a Resident Caretaker in either Abbotsford or Surrey. You will work to serve the tenants within a rental apartment building. Must be personable, hardworking, 'Jack of all Trades' with a track-record in providing exceptional customer service.

About The Company

For over half a century, Onni has been building communities for people to live, work, and play. Our success reflects our commitment to our employees and partners, and our dedication to quality construction, innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction. Our expertise expands across North America, with offices in Vancouver, Toronto, Los Angeles, Seattle, Phoenix, and Chicago.

Duties Will Include, But Are Not Limited To
  • Collecting rent & security deposits
  • Scheduling & showing units
  • Move-in & move out inspections
  • Janitorial work in/out of building
  • Coordinating and managing trades/consultants
  • Dealing with tenant related issues
  • Basic painting, drywall repair and plumbing when needed
Summary Of Qualifications & Requirements
  • Excellent email correspondence
  • Able to read, write and speak English
  • Basic operations of a computer and smart phone
  • Customer service experience
  • Previous Building Manager/Operator or related field experience
All interested applicants please submit your resume and cover letter stating your salary expectations.

We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. No phone calls please.

title: Yard Worker / Detailer / Handyperson
description:
Job description

This job is a critical cog in the Iron Wind Marine machine. The role demands a person with great common sense and a can do attitude. As the principle support person for logistics (moving boats) testing (running boats) and final unit preparation (detailing boats) for delivery this role requires someone with a range of skills.

If you're tired of doing the same old thing over and over and want to have variety in your day this job will provide it. Towing, launching, retrieving boats, cleaning boats, shrink wrapping, coordination of the movement of boats in and out of the service shop, lot checks to ensure our clients boats are in good condition, minor property repairs, assisting setting up boat shows are just some of the things that this position gets to work on.


What is detailing?

In boat detailer jobs, you have various duties, including cleaning the boat in detail, applying wax, and working to make the boat look like new. As well as applying paint to the bottom of boats. An eye for detail is important to ensure our clients receive their boat in tip top condition. Boat detailer is a very physically demanding job. You should be able to be on your feet for extended periods. Ideally candidates would have prior experience detailing boats. Experience in car detailing would also be considered an asset.


What is involved with Yard Work?

Yard Work involves moving boats with fork lift and truck, moving and adjusting blocks and stands, assisting with loading boats on trailers and keeping the facility clean and tidy. Once experienced a senior Yard Person will be able to operate our hydraulic trailer and our transport truck to load and move boats around the Maritimes. We are prepared to train the right candidate to operate a Class 1 vehicle.


What is a Handyperson?

A Handyperson is someone who can handle small repairs to our property and equipment as needed. This isn't a part of the job that requires extensive previous experience but rather someone who is generally reasonably good at handling general small maintenance items around the property.

We are looking for a motivated person with a great attitude that wants to learn and thrive in an interesting industry. We are looking for a long term permanent employee and we will train the right candidate in aspects of the position that they may not currently have experience with. We are looking for someone who wants a solid long term career with an established small business.


Some travel is necessary during trade show season (Feb-March-April)


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent


Valid Class 5 Drivers License (Required)

Valid Class 3 Drivers License (Preferred)

Valid Class 1 Drivers License (Would be perfect)

Pleasure Craft Operator Card (Required)


*please live within easy driving distance of Prospect Road in Halifax.

We do not participate in relocation programs overseas.

title: Facility Custodian
description:
From $24 to $28 per hour

Toronto Branch

3333 James Snow Parkway North, Milton, ON L9T 8L1

From spotless warehouses to manicured lawns and walking trails, maintaining world-class facilities is as important to Uline as providing quality products and great service. Join a Facilities team that helps manage over 16 million square feet of property on over 50 million square feet of grounds.

Position Responsibilities
  • Perform general labour to support operation requirements as needed.
  • Sweeping, mopping, wiping racks, yard maintenance, building maintenance, etc.
  • Process trash removal and corrugated scraps with a compactor.
  • Clean restrooms.
  • Operate floor scrubber (electric or propane) and other equipment.
  • Set up and clean employee workspaces.
  • Assist with meeting set-up and teardown.
Minimum Requirements
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Previous custodial / cleaning experience required.
  • Ability to lift and / or move up to 50 lbs.
Benefits
  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with 5% employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
  • Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Employee Perks
  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.
  • First-class fitness center.
About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,000 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace.

Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer

(#IN-TOROF)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

title: サービススタッフ
description:
料飲関係の経験を存分に生かせるサービスと料理のアンバサダーとして、温かく、心のこもった対応と豊富な知識でゲストに価値ある体験を提供します。

特典、育成、活動等:
  • ホテルで働く上で特典と思われる見本、サンプルを３，４点箇条書き
  • 世界中のアコーホテルズで使用可能な従業員特典割引カード
  • アカデミーによる研修プログラム
  • CSR(企業の社会的責任)活動への参加（例：プラネット21)
  • 国内外でのキャリア形成のチャンスがあります。
職責:
  • 情報をもとにメニューアイテムをゲスト目線で説明する
  • ドリンクリスト、販売促進アイテム、メニュー、料理方法について十分な知識を持つ
  • 料理、飲料を扱う際は安全衛生基準を遵守する
必要な経験と能力:
  • ゲストの希望を注意深く捉え、常に冷静さを保ち、おもてなしができる
  • 人間構築に長け、問題も解決できる
  • 迅速さが必要な場面でも十分な仕事ができる
  • チームメンバーの1人として結束力を持ち協力的に仕事をすることができる
職場環境:
  • ホテルグループの文化を反映させるようなチーム、ホテル、オフィス環境の紹介を１、2文章

注意：カスタマイズには就業規則のようなそれぞれの地域や法律上必要となるものも含まれる可能性がある

私達の約束、多様性と包括

私達は包括的な会社です。多様な人を採用し、昇進の道を用意することを志しています。

なぜアコーに勤務しますか？

宴会サービス

料飲に関する全ての仕事、またお客様を笑顔にすることに情熱を持ち、お客様の心に触れ、思い出深い特別な経験を作り出します。

特典、育成、活動等:
  • ホテルで働く上で特典と思われる見本、サンプルを３，４点箇条書き
  • 世界中のアコーホテルズで使用可能な従業員特典割引カード
  • 能力向上を推進するためのアカデミーによる研修プログラム
現職のホテル又は世界中のホテルで才能を伸ばし成長できるチャンス
  • CSR(企業の社会的責任)活動への参加（例：プラネット21)

職責:
  • 特別食やお客様の好みを織り交ぜながら宴会メニューの説明をする。食事に合わせた飲み物を提供する
  • ホテル内の会議室や使用エリアを設営する
  • サービスエリアが清潔、整頓されていることを確認しテーブル類を片付ける
  • 食品衛生の基準を守る
必要な経験、能力:
  • 温みのあるサービスや人の世話を得意とする人材; ハウスキーピング経験者等
  • チームの一員として結束力を高めて仕事をする
  • プロとしておもてなしの意識を持ち、お客様の希望を予測し対応できる
職場環境:
  • ホテルグループの文化を反映させるようなチーム、ホテル、オフィス環境の紹介を１、2文章

注意：カスタマイズには就業規則のようなそれぞれの地域や法律上必要となるものも含まれる可能性がある

私達の約束、多様性と包括

私達は包括的な会社です。多様な人を採用し、昇進の道を用意することを志しています。

なぜアコーに勤務しますか？

私たちは世界的なリーダー以上の存在です。皆さんを喜んでお迎えしたいと思いますので、あなたの個性に合った仕事やブランドを見つけてください。

私たちはあなたが日々成長し、学ぶことをサポートし、仕事があなたの人生に目的をもたらすことを確実にすることで、私たちと共に旅する間、あなたはアコーの無限の可能性を探求し続けることができます。

アコーに入社することで、あなたのストーリーのすべての章があなた自身が書き上げるものとなり、私たちは共に明日のおもてなしを思い描くことができます。アコーであなたを待っている人生を発見してください。ぜひhttps://careers.accor.com/をご覧ください。

title: Custodian / Janitor
description:
料飲関係の経験を存分に生かせるサービスと料理のアンバサダーとして、温かく、心のこもった対応と豊富な知識でゲストに価値ある体験を提供します。

特典、育成、活動等:
  • ホテルで働く上で特典と思われる見本、サンプルを３，４点箇条書き
  • 世界中のアコーホテルズで使用可能な従業員特典割引カード
  • アカデミーによる研修プログラム
  • CSR(企業の社会的責任)活動への参加（例：プラネット21)
  • 国内外でのキャリア形成のチャンスがあります。
職責:
  • 情報をもとにメニューアイテムをゲスト目線で説明する
  • ドリンクリスト、販売促進アイテム、メニュー、料理方法について十分な知識を持つ
  • 料理、飲料を扱う際は安全衛生基準を遵守する
必要な経験と能力:
  • ゲストの希望を注意深く捉え、常に冷静さを保ち、おもてなしができる
  • 人間構築に長け、問題も解決できる
  • 迅速さが必要な場面でも十分な仕事ができる
  • チームメンバーの1人として結束力を持ち協力的に仕事をすることができる
職場環境:
  • ホテルグループの文化を反映させるようなチーム、ホテル、オフィス環境の紹介を１、2文章

注意：カスタマイズには就業規則のようなそれぞれの地域や法律上必要となるものも含まれる可能性がある

私達の約束、多様性と包括

私達は包括的な会社です。多様な人を採用し、昇進の道を用意することを志しています。

なぜアコーに勤務しますか？

宴会サービス

料飲に関する全ての仕事、またお客様を笑顔にすることに情熱を持ち、お客様の心に触れ、思い出深い特別な経験を作り出します。

特典、育成、活動等:
  • ホテルで働く上で特典と思われる見本、サンプルを３，４点箇条書き
  • 世界中のアコーホテルズで使用可能な従業員特典割引カード
  • 能力向上を推進するためのアカデミーによる研修プログラム
現職のホテル又は世界中のホテルで才能を伸ばし成長できるチャンス
  • CSR(企業の社会的責任)活動への参加（例：プラネット21)

職責:
  • 特別食やお客様の好みを織り交ぜながら宴会メニューの説明をする。食事に合わせた飲み物を提供する
  • ホテル内の会議室や使用エリアを設営する
  • サービスエリアが清潔、整頓されていることを確認しテーブル類を片付ける
  • 食品衛生の基準を守る
必要な経験、能力:
  • 温みのあるサービスや人の世話を得意とする人材; ハウスキーピング経験者等
  • チームの一員として結束力を高めて仕事をする
  • プロとしておもてなしの意識を持ち、お客様の希望を予測し対応できる
職場環境:
  • ホテルグループの文化を反映させるようなチーム、ホテル、オフィス環境の紹介を１、2文章

注意：カスタマイズには就業規則のようなそれぞれの地域や法律上必要となるものも含まれる可能性がある

私達の約束、多様性と包括

私達は包括的な会社です。多様な人を採用し、昇進の道を用意することを志しています。

なぜアコーに勤務しますか？

私たちは世界的なリーダー以上の存在です。皆さんを喜んでお迎えしたいと思いますので、あなたの個性に合った仕事やブランドを見つけてください。

私たちはあなたが日々成長し、学ぶことをサポートし、仕事があなたの人生に目的をもたらすことを確実にすることで、私たちと共に旅する間、あなたはアコーの無限の可能性を探求し続けることができます。

アコーに入社することで、あなたのストーリーのすべての章があなた自身が書き上げるものとなり、私たちは共に明日のおもてなしを思い描くことができます。アコーであなたを待っている人生を発見してください。ぜひhttps://careers.accor.com/をご覧ください。

好きなことをして、世界を大切にし、今の状況に挑戦してください！#BELIMITLESS

title: Food Prep Worker / 3rd Cook - Remote Camp - Timmins
description:
Job Description

The Food Prep Worker prepares, and portions food items and performs various duties in accordance with production requirements and Aramark sanitation standards. Uses daily worksheets and standardized recipes to cook meals.

Job Responsibilities
  • Prepares all food items using prep lists and standard Aramark recipes.
  • Follows proper food handling procedures.
  • Maintains accurate rotation of food to assure top quality and freshness.
  • Manages leftover foods correctly; cover, label, date, and accurately store according to Aramark standards.
  • Maintains clean and orderly refrigerators and work areas.
  • Ensures stations are cleaned, sanitized, and organized at the end of the shift (including cleaning of kitchen equipment).
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary work environment that conforms to all food safety standards and regulations.
  • Follows safety policies and accident reporting procedures.
  • Completes all required training.
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Minimum one-year prep work or food service-related work preferred.
  • Knowledge of food prep, proper knife handling, temperature control, and sanitation is helpful.
  • Must be able to read and write to facilitate communication with others.
  • Mathematical ability required.
Education

About Aramark

Our Mission

Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.

At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

About Aramark

The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food, facilities, and uniform services in 19 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook , Instagram and Twitter .

title: Cleaner / Laundry Worker 2 (Casual)
description:
Come work as a Laundry Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Laundry Worker to join the Laundry team at Little Mountain Place in Vancouver, BC. Apply today to join our team!

As a Laundry Worker, you will perform laundry duties including sorting, folding and distributing linens. Operate domestic and well as non-domestic washers and dryers without supervision of others.

Job Title Laundry Worker 2 (Cleaner)Work Site

Laundry, Little Mountain Place

330 E 36th Ave, Vancouver, BC V5W 3Z4

Status CasualStart Date As soon as possibleSalary $21.77 per hourHours variousReference# 162658-eag

Qualifications

Education & Experience
  • Grade 10 or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Recent experience in a commercial or industrial laundry environment is a plus!
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Yard Worker
description:
AutoReqId: 15126BR

Line Of Business: Concrete

Department: Production

Primary Location: Kelowna-BC

Pay Class: Hourly

Job Posting:

OK Ready Mix, a division of Lehigh Hanson Materials limited is currently looking for responsible, safe, and dependable F orm Yard Workers to join our local team. As a Form Yard Worker you will support our business needs by ensuring a safe and productive work environment. In this position, you will have the opportunity to use different skills every day as you learn about the form business in Kelowna, BC.

We offer:
  • Secure, long-term employment
  • Competitive wage and benefits package
  • Training and development
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • OT available

What You Will Get to Do:
  • Operate mobile equipment on plant property (forklift)
  • Maintain cleanliness of work areas
  • Clean, maintain, build and lubricate concrete forms
  • Prepare form orders for delivery.
  • Transport materials to and from storage and shop areas
  • Ensure compliance with all health, safety, and environmental regulations, as well as company policies and procedures; assist with physical inspections of plant property/departments.

Who We Are Looking For:
  • High school diploma or GED required
  • Previous experience in concrete or construction is an asset
  • Previous experience using power tools such as routers, circular saws and cordless drills
  • Desire to work cooperatively as part of a productive team
  • Ability to work safely, and independently without constant supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
  • Capable of learning through on the job training
  • Able to work inside and outside in year-round weather conditions
  • In good physical condition, able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs., sit and stand for extended periods of time, kneel, climb ladders, and walk on varied terrain
  • Ability to work different extended hours, holidays and/or overtime required

title: Distribution Worker
description:
EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

POSITION: Distribution Worker

REPORTS TO: Shipping Supervisor

LOCATION: Moncton, NB

SALARY: $21.54, as per Collective Agreement

Bimbo Canada has immediate openings for Distribution Workers at their Moncton Distribution Centre.

Position Summary

As a Distribution Worker, you are responsible to ship, receive and record the movements of incoming and outgoing materials. Associate works both as a member of crew and individually, under minimal supervision, to perform the functions of the job. The role requires following instructions and pre-established guidelines.

Please note: This is a part-time position and will be scheduled between Monday-Friday. Shift times can start between 6:00AM and 12:00PM and all shifts can be 8 hours or 10 hours with a potential for overtime hours.

Hourly Rate And Premiums Offered
  • $21.54 to start with an increase of 0.05 cents per hour each three (3) months of work.
  • We offer a shift premium of $1.00 per hour which shall be paid for all hours worked between 9:00 p.m. and 6:00 a.m.
  • There is a potential for overtime hours.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Perform all duties pertaining to distribution; this includes both, shipping and receiving of our goods
  • Operate a variety of shipping equipment (e.g. Push Truck) to load, unload, transport, and store materials into appropriate areas (e.g. Trailers)
  • Prepare tickets using the computer, Oracle software system
  • Maintain internal, manual or computerized record keeping system
  • Unpack, breakdown, code, and route goods to appropriate storage areas
  • Record shortages and reject damaged goods
  • Inspect and verify incoming or outgoing goods against invoices or other documents
  • Inspect shipping equipment, machines, and tools; report all malfunctions to supervisors
  • Collect empty trays and refill Tray Unstacker; ensure sufficient supply of trays
  • Ensure all work is carried out in accordance with Health & Safety legislation, Company Joint Health & Safety Programs, and Good Manufacturing Practices
  • Actively participate in, and report all Health & Safety/Quality issues to Shift Supervisor/QA
  • Other duties as required
EXPERIENCE:
  • A grade 12 education is required or equivalent experience will be considered
  • Previous experience working in a warehouse would be considered an asset
QUALIFICATIONS:
  • We require positive individuals with flexibility to work varying shifts between Monday to Friday
  • We require knowledge of the English language both, written and oral.
  • Candidates should have strong communication and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to work well in a team environment
  • Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of following all Attendance and Health & Safety protocols at all times
  • Candidates must have manual dexterity, hand-eye co-ordination as well as attention to detail skills as they are a key requirement for this position
  • Candidates must have the ability to work in a hot and humid work environment
  • Candidates must have their own reliable transportation
  • Candidates must have their own steel-toed safety boots
WORKING CONDITIONS:
  • Environment: Warehouse; this role requires the ability to work in a warm and humid work environment
  • Volume of work: Physically demanding work environment that requires to work in a fast-paced environment and involves repetitive tasks and standing for extended periods
  • Physical requirements: This role is physically demanding and therefore the candidate must be able to handle weight up to 40lbs.
APPLICATION PROCESS

If you are interested in applying for this position, please send your resume by email to Lesley Baker, Human Relations Advisor at lesley.baker@grupobimbo.com

Please note all offers of employment at Bimbo Canada (formerly Canada Bread Company, Limited) are conditional upon the successful completion of a pre-hire background check. This may include anything up to and including a criminal history check, reference checks and post-employment offer test.

Bimbo Canada is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity in the workplace and encourages applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities.

We welcome applications from all interested individuals; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Assistant Residential Worker
description:
Circa Salary: £24,075 per annum

Perks: Annual leave of 29 days (pro-rata) PLUS public holidays, flexible maternity, adoption and paternity packages, annual staff awards, 7% employer contribution pension scheme, employee discount portal with all your favourite brands, check out more on our careers portal

Contract/Hours: Permanent Full Time hours 37 hours a week. Shifts times are 2pm to 10pm, 9am to 5pm, 9am to 9pm (normally school holidays) 10am to 10pm (normally school holidays and weekends) Shifts are on a rota basis.

Location: Northolt

Closing date: Midnight on 19th April - We may stop taking applications earlier than advertised, due to the volume of applications we receive. So, don't delay submitting your application for consideration!

We're thrilled that you're considering a career with Action for Children so here's what you need to know.

About Us

At Action for Children, we believe that every child should have a safe and happy childhood. Last year, we helped more than 600,000 children and families across the UK. We work to ensure their voices are heard, and campaign to bring lasting change to their lives.

About The Role

Haydock Short Breaks based in Northolt, is 6 bedded children's home with modern facilities, providing short breaks to children and their families aged 8 to 18 years of age. The service supports children and young people who have various disabilities and complex needs. The aim is to ensure that they provide a fun and welcoming environment.

In the role of Assistant Residential Worker, it will be your responsibility to liaise with the children, young people and their families to ensure that their care is always to the best possible standard. You will also be supporting them with all aspects of their care.

As An Assistant Residential Worker You'll Be
  • Supporting children and young people in their personal care, administration of medication and procedures in line with the services policies and procedures.
  • Providing a safe and fun environment to achieve positive outcomes.
  • Promoting independence.
  • Updating care plans and risk assessments.
Our job description for the Assistant Residential Worker outlines the requirements of the role but the 'must-haves' are:
  • Experience of working with children or young people (experience working with children with disabilities would be an advantage).
  • The qualification of Level 3 QCF Working with Children and Young People or equivalent is desirable, or the willingness to work towards this funded by Action for Children.
  • Working of own initiative.
  • A flexible approach to working hours (service open seven days a week).
  • A good standard of written English and the ability to make accurate notes for recordkeeping.
  • There will be plenty of on-going training and development to help you reach your potential, with regular supervisions.
Working here is so much more than a job. Whether this is a career change for you or the next step in your journey, we'd love to hear from you.

We work together to reach our vision of safe and happy childhoods. A diverse workforce enriches the lives of the children and young people we work with and we welcome applications from everyone. We value and celebrate our differences and as an inclusive workplace we want everyone to be themselves.

We are committed to safer recruitment practices to protect our service users; therefore, all applicants are expected to have an understanding of and commitment to safeguarding best-practice.

We can't wait to hear from you - stay safe and happy.

title: ACTIVITY WORKER II (CASUAL)
description:
If you are looking for friendly, supportive staff, work life balance and affordable living this may be just the opportunity that will take your career to a new level.

In accordance with the vision and values of the organization and under the general supervision of a senior position such as a Recreation Therapist, Program Coordinator, Registered Nurse or Occupational Therapist, the Activity Worker is a member of the multidisciplinary team within a client and family centered model of care, and is responsible for carrying out an established activity/recreation/leisure program as directed.

Stuart Nechako Manor has 45 publicly subsidized beds, 12 beds specifically for dementia residents and 2 Short Stay Beds used for Respite and Palliative needs. Stuart Nechako manor has a combination of single and double occupancy rooms. Stuart Nechako Manor provides Recreational Therapy Services 5 days a week. Pastoral and Spiritual Services are provided by the Vanderhoof Ministerial Group with regular on site spiritual care. There is a Volunteer Program in place to accompany Residents on social outings, appointments, assist with feeding and provide hospice support. Hairdressing and barber services are available on site for a fee determined by the service provider. Stuart Nechako Manor also provides an on-site integrated community adult day program, operating 3 days a week.

Vanderhoof has a population of 4,500 (2021). Nestled in the fertile Nechako Valley, on the banks of the Nechako River, rural Vanderhoof is the geographical centre of the province of British Columbia. Check out Vanderhoof where there is always something new to experience.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.
  • Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service
  • Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions
  • Employee referral program
  • Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC
  • “Loan Forgiveness Programs” offered through the Federal and BC Government
  • Grade 12, plus completion of recognized recreation course(s)
  • Two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation’s communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

title: Demolition Worker
description:
PeopleReady has an immediate opening forDemolition Workers inGreater Toronto, ON.

We are looking for someone who is hard-working, has a positive attitude and enjoys physical activity while working on a team. If you carry these qualities, People Ready offers a wide variety of demolition jobs and we are in need of someone like you!

Note - Pay rate for this job is $16-22/Hour

Shift timing - 1st shift (Day) andWeekends

Responsibilities
  • Loads, unloads, and identifies building materials, machinery, and tools, and distributes them to the appropriate locations
  • Participates in demolitions
  • Provides assistance to subcontractors
  • Performs heavy physical labor
  • Erects and disassembles scaffolding, braces, barricades, ramps, and other temporary structures.
  • Related duties may be assigned as necessary
Qualifications
  • Experience with demolition or construction
  • You enjoy physical labour
  • You must be reliable
  • Youmust be a positive person
  • Youmust be motivated and hardworking
  • You are always prioritizing working safely, efficiently, and enthusiastically
  • You love fast-paced environments
  • You have a desire to grow and advance with a team
  • You must be able to comfortably lift 80lbs
PeopleReady is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religious affiliation, color, national origin, gender, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other basis protected by law. We will get to know you and connect you with jobs that match your skills, experience and preferences. We work hard every single day to find jobs so each employee has opportunity and variety in their work.

title: Lifestyle Worker
description:
Start your Lifestyle Worker career with Anglicare now!
  • Be part of a committed and vibrant team
  • Make a difference and support older people with social interaction
  • Fulltime position working across our Social Wellness Centres/ Villages and Respite Cottages in the Nepean Region
About Anglicare

As a Christian organisation with a heritage of service spanning 160 years, we exist to serve our community, enrich life and share the love of Jesus. Combining our resources and expertise enables us to work even more effectively to meet changing needs as we reach and serve more people at all stages of life.

To find out more please visit: www.anglicare.org.au .

Designed to make a genuine difference in the lives of older people, Anglicare At Home aims to support and assist people to live independently in their homes valuing them as important members of our community.

About The Role

Anglicare has a number of community centre-based Social Support/ Respite groups and overnight Cottages operating across Sydney, the Blue Mountains and Illawarra. Our centres and social group programs are designed to be fun and enabling environments, we offer interesting recreational activities that are based on what our clients like to do, such as games, dancing, exercise, arts (painting and pottery), crafts, movies, cooking and outings.

Reporting to a Team Leader, you will ensure on a day-to-day basis that older people and people living with dementia attending our services receive tailored support in a professional and respectful manner according to their individualised care plans, organisational policies and procedures. Utilising your knowledge and understanding of wellness and reablement you will work with our clients to support them to remain as independent as possible and enjoy the time they spend with us

This is a full-time position working across our services in Nepean. Applicants must be open to working shifts, day and overnight providing respite mid-week and weekends.

Key Duties
  • Planning and facilitating innovative group and individual activities
  • Meal preparation and serving
  • Personal care such as showering and toileting
  • Medication prompting
  • Cleaning, keeping the workplace safe
  • Transporting people to and from the groups
  • Supporting family carers
Benefits
  • Anglicare is renowned for its reputable training and development program.
  • Anglicare is committed to achieving the highest performance in work health and safety with the aim of creating and maintaining a safe and healthy environment throughout all parts of the organisation.
  • Work regular hours with our lovely clients, each and every client touches your heart. You will feel satisfied that you are really helping to meet the needs of older people.
I want to join. Now what?

If you have a kind heart for serving older people, then we would love to hear from you. We are looking for staff who are committed and passionate about delivering customer service excellence.

Skills And Experience
  • Certificate III in Aged Care/Individual Support/Nursing or equivalent. Certificate IV in Leisure & Health is also desirable.
  • Experience working with older people and people living with dementia
  • A C Class Motor Vehicle License; and
  • Access to use a registered and insured motor vehicle with minimum third-party property damage insurance.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are encouraged to apply.

Jesus Christ honoured, lives enriched and communities strengthened.

Anglicare is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of children and young people and has zero tolerance of child abuse.

Applicants are encouraged to apply as soon as possible as applications may be reviewed prior to the closing date; and as such the closing date is subject to change without notice.

You will feel satisfied that you are really helping to meet the needs of older people.', 'Be part of a committed and vibrant team', 'Supporting family carers', 'Make a difference and support older people with social interaction']

title: Facility Custodian
description:
From $24 to $28 per hour

Toronto Branch

3333 James Snow Parkway North, Milton, ON L9T 8L1

From spotless warehouses to manicured lawns and walking trails, maintaining world-class facilities is as important to Uline as providing quality products and great service. Join a Facilities team that helps manage over 16 million square feet of property on over 50 million square feet of grounds.

Position Responsibilities
  • Perform general labour to support operation requirements as needed.
  • Sweeping, mopping, wiping racks, yard maintenance, building maintenance, etc.
  • Process trash removal and corrugated scraps with a compactor.
  • Clean restrooms.
  • Operate floor scrubber (electric or propane) and other equipment.
  • Set up and clean employee workspaces.
  • Assist with meeting set-up and teardown.
Minimum Requirements
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Previous custodial / cleaning experience required.
  • Ability to lift and / or move up to 50 lbs.
Benefits
  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with 5% employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
  • Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Employee Perks
  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.
  • First-class fitness center.
About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,000 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace.

Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer

(#IN-TOROF)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

title: Custodial Manager (61620001)
description:
How You’ll Make an Impact:  

  • Responsible for overseeing a team of employees and successfully coordinating and directing Environmental Service activities including Building Maintenance
  • Establish and maintain a solid and mutually beneficial business relationship with the client
  • Ensure high levels of client and customer satisfaction and account retention
  • Manage strong employee relations
  • Create a safe work environment through provincial regulations and Sodexo policies and procedures
  • Ensure the achievement of financial goals particularly around labour costs
  • Strategically develop efficiencies in the operation

Qualifications

What You’ll Need to Succeed: 

  • Minimum 2 years of Environmental Services experience in a hospitality/hotel  environment
  • Ability to manage 20-30 employees with proven success in managing service operations in a campus or busy janitorial/custodial setting
  • Management experience in a unionized environment
  • Effective oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to manage and promote a safe work environment and lead a safety culture

Additional Information

 What Makes Sodexo Different:   

  • Flexible work environment   
  • Competitive compensation & great employee benefits  
  • Training and development programs   
  • Countless opportunities for growth   
  • Corporate responsibility & sustainability   
  • Canada’s Top Employers for Young People 2019  
  • Canada’s Best Employers by Forbes 2019  
  • Diversity Inc. Top 50 employer 2019  
  • And so much more!   

Sodexo is committed to Employment Equity and Diversity. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of national origin, race, religion, ethnic group, age, disability, gender, sexual preference, sexual or gender identity, status as a veteran or any other federal, provincial or local protected class. 

 We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodation is available on request from candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. 

Thank you for your interest in Sodexo.

Please note that only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Follow us on social media to see first-hand what we are all about!

Instagram: @SodexoCanadaCareers

Twitter: @SodexoJobsCA

LinkedIn: Sodexo Canada Careers

Facebook: Sodexo CA Jobs
