title: Travailleurs d’entrepôt
description:
Votre trajet

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche de travailleurs d'entrepôt pour notre centre de distribution NAPA de Montréal.

Dans Ce Rôle Clé, Vous Serez Responsable De

Nos préparateurs de commandes en entrepôt veillent à ce que chaque pièce soit comptabilisée et apte à être expédiée. Ils sont fiables, bien formés et étonnants dans ce qu’ils font . Si vous recherchez un poste avec un horaire, des tâches et un environnement de travail stables, pensez à vous joindre à nous.
  • La réception et la mise en tablette des marchandises dans l’entrepôt
  • L’organisation de la marchandise de façon efficace et précise
  • La préparation des commandes pour l’expédition et la réception
  • Le respect des mesures de santé et sécurité
Sous le capot

Pour Vous Joindre à Notre Équipe, Vous Devez
  • Avoir de l’expérience ou une connaissance du travail en entrepôt
  • Avoir le souci du détail et une aisance à distinguer des numéros de pièces et des chiffres
  • Être en mesure de travailler dans un environnement où les délais sont restreints.
À propos de la division

La division des Pièces d’auto regroupe les activités de vente, de distribution et de mise en marché de fournitures et pièces de remplacement pour automobiles et camions légers. Nous avons le plus grand réseau pancanadien de distribution de pièces de rechange pour véhicules. Nos bannières dans cette divisions comprennent la marque de renom NAPA Pièces d’autos, ainsi que Altrom-Autocamping, qui se spécialise dans la vente de pièces pour véhicules importés, ainsi que CMAX, spécalisée dans la peinture et les produits de carrosserie. Avec la diversité des rôles dans nos divisions, on peut facilement trouver le rôle qui nous convient!

title: ACTIVITY WORKER II (CASUAL)
description:
Are you someone who has a real passion for helping others? Are you looking to highlight your knowledge, skills, and abilities in a new and dynamic environment? We currently have an exciting opportunity for you to bring your excellent work ethic to our Recreational Therapy department.

In accordance with the vision and values of the organization and under the general supervision of a senior position such as a Recreation Therapist, Program Coordinator, Registered Nurse or Occupational Therapist, the Activity Worker is a member of the multidisciplinary team within a client and family centered model of care, and is responsible for carrying out an established activity/recreation/leisure program as directed.

Dunrovin Park Lodge is a complex care facility with 117 beds. The facility consists of complex care, hospice, respite and special care unit. Maple House is a secured unit with 20 beds and one respite bed specifically for residents requiring more supervision. Hospice Care Unit has three Hospice Palliative care beds and three respite beds. There is a Volunteer Program in place to accompany Residents on social outings, appointments, and provide hospice support. Hairdressing and barber services are available on site for a fee determined by the service provider. Dunrovin also provides an on-site integrated community adult day program, operating 4 days a week.

Quesnel has a population of 10,000 (2021) local residents and is one of the central interior's oldest cities and home to the world’s largest gold pan. Nestled on the banks of the Fraser and Quesnel rivers, Quesnel is the commercial centre of the North Cariboo. Check out Quesnel for more information on this outdoor playground and its access to a wealth of adventures.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.
  • Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service
  • Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions
  • Employee referral program
  • Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC
  • “Loan Forgiveness Programs” offered through the Federal and BC Government
  • Grade 12, plus completion of recognized recreation course(s)
  • Two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation’s communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1698182 Date posted 04/08/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :REVELSTOKE

Facility :QUEEN VICTORIA HOSPITAL

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

We are presently seeking new team members to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Queen Victoria Hospital in Revelstoke, BC. A strong candidate will have completed a course or certificate from a recognized recreation therapy program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents and short stay clients. This position assists in getting residents to/from their programs and carries out established leisure/recreation therapy programs. Staff go on outings with the residents and facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.) including one-to-one programs. The Recreation Therapy Worker also reports relevant observations of resident progress and behavior to the Supervisor/Recreation Therapist and provides suggestions for changes or modifications to the existing programs.

Casual employment means work requirements can vary between Zero and 37.5 hours per week. Shifts may be available Days or Evenings, with shift times of 07:00 to 15:00, 11:00 to 19:00, 08:00 to 16:00, 08:00 to 14:00. Once hired into a casual role, employees are eligible to apply for internal postings including permanent part time or full time positions. There are many opportunities with Interior Health that begin with casual on-call positions and lead to regular employment.

Apply today to join a great team!
  • We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.
  • Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor
Qualifications
  • Grade 12, completion of a recognized recreation course(s) plus two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license as required
This posting is for casual work at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order. The posting is open to all qualified staff but those currently working at a single site facility should note that the hiring Manager will contact the current Manager to discuss the ability to release staff.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: 2 - Supervised Access Visitation Workers (SAV) Evenings & Weekends (Ki-Low-Na Friendship Society)
description:
Job Posting: (2 ) Supervised Access Visitation Workers (SAV)

Hours: Part-time hours: 4-10 hour a week. Evenings & Weekends

Wage: Depending on experience

Posted: April 14/22

Closing: Until positon filled- Cover letter

Nature Of Position

The SAV worker will provide supervision for Aboriginal families with children in care in a designated visit room or within the community. The SAV will observe and document visits in a neutral and non-judgmental manner.

Duties
  • Facilitate safe arrival and departure of children at the center
  • Provide a supervised environment where access can occur and ensure that visits only occur in designated areas
  • Provide neutral and culturally sensitive third party observation of the nature of the visit
  • Record notes on visits that are accurate, objective and contain factual information on activities, child and parent behavior and interaction, communication skill and other details of visit
  • Ensure that participants abide by the rules set out by their social worker and those of Ki-Low-Na Friendship Society
  • Assist children and parents in engaging at start of visits and disengaging at end of visits
  • Encourage a positive child/parent relationship by assisting parents in selecting age appropriate toys/activities
  • Assist with general care of infants/children and model safe interactions with infant/children when necessary (ex: diaper changes, bottle feeding etc.)
Qualifications
  • Knowledge of conflict resolution
  • Knowledge of child development and effective parenting skills
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and as part of a team
  • Ability to demonstrate effective oral and written communication
  • Must have experience with infants and children
Requirements
  • Must be available weeknights and weekends
  • Have reliable transportation
  • Must consent to a criminal record check
Send Resumė to: Ki-Low-Na Friendship Society

442 Leon Ave

Kelowna, BC V1Y 6J3

E-mail: employmentsupport@kfs.bc.ca

Fax: (250) 861-5514

Telephone: (250) 763-4905

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

Value

title: Food Prep Worker - Yosemite - Ahwahnee Hotel
description:
Job Description

The Food Prep Worker prepares, and portions food items and performs various duties in accordance with production requirements and Aramark sanitation standards. Uses daily worksheets and standardized recipes to cook meals.

Job Responsibilities
  • Prepares all food items using prep lists and standard Aramark recipes.
  • Follows proper food handling procedures.
  • Maintains accurate rotation of food to assure top quality and freshness.
  • Manages leftover foods correctly; cover, label, date, and accurately store according to Aramark standards.
  • Maintains clean and orderly refrigerators and work areas.
  • Ensures stations are cleaned, sanitized, and organized at the end of the shift (including cleaning of kitchen equipment).
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary work environment that conforms to all food safety standards and regulations.
  • Follows safety policies and accident reporting procedures.
  • Completes all required training.
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Minimum one-year prep work or food service-related work preferred.
  • Knowledge of food prep, proper knife handling, temperature control, and sanitation is helpful.
  • Must be able to read and write to facilitate communication with others.
  • Mathematical ability required.
Education

About Aramark

Our Mission

Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.

At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

About Aramark

The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food, facilities, and uniform services in 19 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook , Instagram and Twitter .

title: Custodian / Janitor
description:
About Apotex Inc.

Apotex Inc. is a proudly Canadian, global pharmaceutical company that produces high-quality, affordable medicines for patients around the world. Apotex employs almost 8,000 people worldwide in manufacturing, R&D, and commercial operations. Apotex Inc. exports to more than 100 countries and territories and operates in more than 45 countries, with a significant presence in Canada, the US, Mexico, and India. Through vertical integration, Apotex is comprised of multiple divisions and affiliates including Apotex Inc., focused on generics; Apobiologix, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on biosimilar development; Aveva, an affiliate of Apotex Inc. fully integrated global developer and manufacturer of complete transdermal solutions; Apotex Consumer Products, a division of Apotex Inc. focused on brand name products; and Global Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (GAPI), a division of Apotex Inc. focused on the manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients (API) for Apotex and third parties. For more information visit: www.apotex.com .

Job Summary

Responsible for performing general cleaning duties inside and outside of Apotex facilities as assigned. Areas inside the building include offices, washrooms, Locker change rooms, Production area, Warehouse and Laboratories. At the Etobicoke site, the buildings include the Engineering Site Office.

Outside the buildings, in winter, operate the snow blower and ice melter spreader, in conjunction with manually keeping the walkways, exits and entrances clear of ice and snow.

Job Responsibilities
  • Offices
Clean offices which include dusting and polishing furniture, vacuuming, sweeping, mopping, washing walls and windows. Remove garbage and recycling from the centralized areas.
  • Washrooms
Clean washrooms and change rooms and replenish supplies. (soaps, paper towels, hand cream, etc.)
  • Warehouse
Clean warehouse floors, shelves, walls and where applicable, any marks on the floor from the forklift wheels.
  • GMP areas (Production, Packaging)
Clean the Good manufacturing Practices (GMP) areas, which include washing walls, stairs, ceilings and floors. Clean pails and drums and replenishing supplies.
  • Cafeteria
Clean the cafeteria, including the food preparation area, freezers, coolers and storage areas. Remove Garbage and recycling materials as needed. Maintain coffee brewers as required.
  • Clean the Laboratory and replenish supplies as required.
  • Clean the Controlled Substances/CT vault and walk in refrigerator.
  • Dispose of all garbage and recycling following proper procedures.
  • Operate various cleaning machines including floor polisher, vacuums and floor scrubbing machines.
  • Operate the compactors.
  • Utilize standardized cleaning agents as trained.
  • Ensure that all work is performed in accordance with Good Manufacturing Practices, (cGMP), Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and established safety standards (SWP).
  • Work as a member of a team to achieve all outcomes.
  • Perform all work in support of our Corporate Values of Pride, Accountability, Integrity and Diligence.
  • Perform all work in accordance with all established regulatory and compliance and safety requirement.
  • Perform all other duties as assigned.
Job Requirements
  • Grade 12 education;
  • The ability to lift 50 lbs;
  • Good command of the English language (ability to read, write and understand English);
  • Good oral communication skills;
  • Good interpersonal skills;
  • Previous cleaning experience preferred;
  • Physically fit
COVID-19 VACCINATION POLICY: In accordance with Apotex Inc. (“Apotex”) policy, as of November 15, 2021, all individuals entering a Canadian site (including but not limited to employees, visitors, contractors and agency workers) must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with the current government requirements. Further, all employees must maintain all future booster vaccines as approved and recommended by Health Canada. Accommodation from these requirements for reasons pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code, or any other applicable law (most commonly for medical and/or religious reasons) will be reviewed and considered by Apotex.

At Apotex, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported.

Apotex offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title: Labour Workers
description:
What's in it for you?
  • $16.50-$20.00 to start, based on experience and skill level
  • Regular wage increases
  • Afternoon and night shift premiums available
  • Day, afternoon, and overnight shifts available
  • Opportunity for overtime
  • Benefits available after completion of probationary period
  • Pension after 2 years of continuous service
  • Progression wage increases
  • Perks and discounts on entertainment, travel, attractions, shopping, sports and more
  • All PPE is provided to employees (hard hat, boots, jacket, etc.)
  • Shifts do not rotate
  • Support of a union
  • Highly automated and fast paced learning environment
  • Opportunities for growth and training development
  • Trans Cab Service and Conventional Bus Service is provided through HSR
GENERAL LABOURER/WAREHOUSE WORKER – Opportunity to earn up to $16.50/hour

The General Labour full-time position is responsible for performing packaging, clean-up and other elemental activities related to food processing.

Responsibilities
  • Feed cartons into machines.
  • Check and weigh materials and/or product.
  • Manually pack product into bags, cartons or other containers.
  • Remove finished goods cartons from conveyer and place on pallets.
  • Check products and packaging for basic quality defects.
SEMI-SKILLED WORKER – Opportunity to earn up to $18.65/hour

The Semi-Skilled full-time position is responsible for operating single-function machines to process and package meat products.

Responsibilities
  • Set up and adjust single-function processing and packaging machines preparatory to operation
  • Enables the movement of product from one position/location to another using power equipment; Inspects/weighs product; Operates equipment and makes some decisions and some troubleshooting involved
  • Monitor machines for proper operation watching for jammed materials, defects or other irregularities
  • Operate single function machines required to process or package food products
  • Check products for defects and to ensure conformance to company standards and perform corrective machine adjustments as necessary
  • Participate in continuous improvement programs, meetings, etc.
  • Understand and comply with basic food safety principles
SKILLED WORKER – Opportunity to earn up to $20.80/hour

The Skilled position is responsible for operating multi-function process control or single-function machines to process and package meat products.

Responsibilities
  • Set up multi-function machinery such as a robots/multivac/slicer etc.
  • Relay and communicate issues with leaders as well as reliability
  • Operate multi-function process control machinery through control panels, computer terminals or other control systems to grind, mix, blend, cook, package or otherwise process food products
  • Engages in the conversion of product from one state to another using automated and/or robotic technology; Involves plate changes, analysis of data, decisions based on analysis, HMI interaction.
  • Observe gauges, computer printouts and video monitors to verify specified processing conditions and make adjustments to process variables such as cooking times, ingredient inputs, flow rates and temperature settings
  • Maintain shift log of production and other data
  • Participate in continuous improvement programs, meetings, etc.
  • Understand and comply with basic food safety principles
Required Skill And Qualifications
  • Must comprehend all food and safety, and health and safety protocols
  • Be reliable and dependable, able to be at work every day, on time
  • Eligible to work in Canada
  • 18 years of age or older
  • Ability to withstand continual manual work; standing for most the shift, repetitive movements on a constant basis, and lifting up to 50lbs on occasion
  • Able to work in a cold environment (from 0-4 degrees Celsius)
  • Fully vaccinated (2 vaccinations)
Career Fairs every Thursday!

Onsite interviews every Thursday from 10:00AM-4:00PM

440 Glover Rd L0R 1P0

COVID-19 Safety Measures

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to ensuring the health and safety of all our employees. As part of this commitment, we have adopted a number of COVID-19 safety measures, including a requirement for all employees to be fully vaccinated and to show proof of vaccination. In keeping with this policy, successful candidates will need to provide proof of vaccination prior to the commencement of employment. We will of course consider accommodations for anyone unable to be vaccinated following human rights and other applicable laws.

APPLY NOW!

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at accommodations@mapleleaf.com. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: Lifestyle Worker
description:
Start your Lifestyle Worker career with Anglicare now!
  • Be part of a committed and vibrant team
  • Make a difference and support older people with social interaction
  • Fulltime position working across our Social Wellness Centres/ Villages and Respite Cottages in the Nepean Region
About Anglicare

As a Christian organisation with a heritage of service spanning 160 years, we exist to serve our community, enrich life and share the love of Jesus. Combining our resources and expertise enables us to work even more effectively to meet changing needs as we reach and serve more people at all stages of life.

To find out more please visit: www.anglicare.org.au .

Designed to make a genuine difference in the lives of older people, Anglicare At Home aims to support and assist people to live independently in their homes valuing them as important members of our community.

About The Role

Anglicare has a number of community centre-based Social Support/ Respite groups and overnight Cottages operating across Sydney, the Blue Mountains and Illawarra. Our centres and social group programs are designed to be fun and enabling environments, we offer interesting recreational activities that are based on what our clients like to do, such as games, dancing, exercise, arts (painting and pottery), crafts, movies, cooking and outings.

Reporting to a Team Leader, you will ensure on a day-to-day basis that older people and people living with dementia attending our services receive tailored support in a professional and respectful manner according to their individualised care plans, organisational policies and procedures. Utilising your knowledge and understanding of wellness and reablement you will work with our clients to support them to remain as independent as possible and enjoy the time they spend with us

This is a full-time position working across our services in Nepean. Applicants must be open to working shifts, day and overnight providing respite mid-week and weekends.

Key Duties
  • Planning and facilitating innovative group and individual activities
  • Meal preparation and serving
  • Personal care such as showering and toileting
  • Medication prompting
  • Cleaning, keeping the workplace safe
  • Transporting people to and from the groups
  • Supporting family carers
Benefits
  • Anglicare is renowned for its reputable training and development program.
  • Anglicare is committed to achieving the highest performance in work health and safety with the aim of creating and maintaining a safe and healthy environment throughout all parts of the organisation.
  • Work regular hours with our lovely clients, each and every client touches your heart. You will feel satisfied that you are really helping to meet the needs of older people.
I want to join. Now what?

If you have a kind heart for serving older people, then we would love to hear from you. We are looking for staff who are committed and passionate about delivering customer service excellence.

Skills And Experience
  • Certificate III in Aged Care/Individual Support/Nursing or equivalent. Certificate IV in Leisure & Health is also desirable.
  • Experience working with older people and people living with dementia
  • A C Class Motor Vehicle License; and
  • Access to use a registered and insured motor vehicle with minimum third-party property damage insurance.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are encouraged to apply.

Jesus Christ honoured, lives enriched and communities strengthened.

Anglicare is committed to ensuring the safety and wellbeing of children and young people and has zero tolerance of child abuse.

Applicants are encouraged to apply as soon as possible as applications may be reviewed prior to the closing date; and as such the closing date is subject to change without notice.

You will feel satisfied that you are really helping to meet the needs of older people.', 'Be part of a committed and vibrant team', 'Supporting family carers', 'Make a difference and support older people with social interaction']

title: Facility Custodian
description:
From $24 to $28 per hour

Toronto Branch

3333 James Snow Parkway North, Milton, ON L9T 8L1

From spotless warehouses to manicured lawns and walking trails, maintaining world-class facilities is as important to Uline as providing quality products and great service. Join a Facilities team that helps manage over 16 million square feet of property on over 50 million square feet of grounds.

Position Responsibilities
  • Perform general labour to support operation requirements as needed.
  • Sweeping, mopping, wiping racks, yard maintenance, building maintenance, etc.
  • Process trash removal and corrugated scraps with a compactor.
  • Clean restrooms.
  • Operate floor scrubber (electric or propane) and other equipment.
  • Set up and clean employee workspaces.
  • Assist with meeting set-up and teardown.
Minimum Requirements
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Previous custodial / cleaning experience required.
  • Ability to lift and / or move up to 50 lbs.
Benefits
  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with 5% employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
  • Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Employee Perks
  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.
  • First-class fitness center.
About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,000 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace.

Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer

(#IN-TOROF)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

title: Middle Years Worker
description:
Career Opportunity: Middle Years Worker

Location: Vanderhoof, BC

Full time - 35hr/wk

Carrier Sekani Family Services (CSFS) - A Great Experience Awaits You: CSFS is an innovative and progressive leader in indigenous health and family services where culture is in everything we do. Each day is a new day, where you will learn about the rich history of the Carrier and Sekani peoples while building relationships both within communities and the organization. Enriching experiences inclusive of Carrier Sekani culture is integral to our organizational values where our employees can expect to work with vibrant communities which involves relationship building with Elders and Knowledge holders. Enjoy these experiences and learning opportunities, as well as the natural wonders of the vast geographical landscape while you work. Our work takes us beyond the office and into our communities regularly.

Our Story

Since our humble beginnings 30 years ago, CSFS has grown to almost 300 employees providing services to 11-member Nations. CSFS is mandated to establish a comprehensive infrastructure for social, health and legal programs, for the eventual take-over of these services, consistent with the Tribal Council's objective of working towards Indian Self-Government. We deliver all services in accordance with our great law of sharing wealth set in our Bah’lats (potlatch) system. With the guidance of our elders we are committed to the healing and empowerment of First Nation families. Check out this Video about CSFS at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rOqJDwoQblM

The Opportunity: Join a team that values your contributions and allows you to grow your career with flexibility to utilize your skills, creativity and passion to make a meaningful difference. In this role, you will get to:
  • Provide programming for Equine Therapy, educational programming, girls and boys groups and Yinka Dene Camps
  • Directly assist communities to increase their capacity to identify, and address child and youth development
  • Establish and maintain quality community awareness, support and referral systems for the programs.
Go to www.csfs.org/jobs to view the full job description for this career opportunity.

What You Will Bring To The Role
  • Social Work Certificate, Diploma or equivalent
  • Child and Youth Care Certificate/Diploma
The Location:

Vanderhoof, “where the heart is beckoning”is geographically located near the centre of British Columbia and truly is at the “Heart of it All” when it comes to lifestyle, low cost of living and employment opportunities. The community’s size, services and amenities are well suited for entrepreneurs, and those involved in resource or agricultural sectors. Whether you are looking for an adventuresome way to stretch your legs, are an avid wildlife admirer eager to capture your next signature photo or looking for fun ways to entertain the family, Vanderhoof has something for you. Learn more about the District of Vanderhoof by visiting http://www.vanderhoof.ca/ .

What CSFS Team Members Are Saying
  • We live by our organization values, advocating for vulnerable people and socially responsible
  • Supported to pursue life long learning, professional development and recognition for your contribution
  • Family like atmosphere without traditional corporate inflexibility
  • Growing career opportunities for indigenous people
  • Recognize the value of Carrier Sekani Knowledge holders and language speakers
Its All For You
  • Excellent total compensation package including competitive wages, benefits and pension plan
  • Generous and flexible time off options unique to CSFS, promoting work life family balance
  • Education, and professional development opportunities
Hurry and Apply Now! Go to www.csfs.org/jobs to view the full job description for this career opportunity.

Deadline to apply: This posting will be open until filled. Along with your resume, please submit a cover letter specifically tailored to this role outlining why you are interested in this opportunity, what specific skills and experience you will bring, and how your qualifications will make you successful in this role.

With the continuation of the global pandemic and because CSFS provides services to First Nations communities, classified as “Vulnerable Populations,” and to protect the health and safety of employees, candidates applying for employment will need to agree to provide their covid-19 vaccination status as a condition of employment.

title: ASSISTED DAILY LIVING RECREATION WORKER
description:
RHA Job Number:GO-00672696-1

Number of Vacancies:1

Profession:Continuing Care Assistant

Management:No

Employer:SHA (Sun Country)

Community:Kipling

Hours to International Airport:1.5

Community Website:http://www.townofkipling.ca/

Facility Name:KIPLING INTEGRATED HEALTH CENTRE

Department:Recreation

Employment Type:Temporary

Employment Term:Part Time

Posting Date:May 4, 2022

Closing Date:May 11, 2022 21:30

Hours of Work:Shift Information: Days, Weekends

64.00 hours per 3 week rotation

Rate of Pay:Pay Band 12 $23.170 to $24.840 (3 step range)

Union Name:CUPE

Job Description

Provides personal care and organized recreation/leisure activities to enhance client/patient/resident quality of life

Job Qualifications

Required Qualifications
  • Continuing Care Assistant certificate
Experience

Previous: Six (6) months previous experience working in a health care environment.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Basic computer skills, where required by the job
  • Valid drivers license, where required by the job
  • Organizational skills
  • Communication skills
  • Ability to work independently
  • Ability to work with special needs clients/patients/residents
Other Information
  • The official job descriptions are found on the Provider Group website, http://www.working-for-health.ca/supportjobevaluation/
Additional Information
  • If no qualified applicants, you may be considered as a conditional hire if willing to complete Continuing Care Assistant certificate by an accredited institution within two years of start date. Hours of work may be reduced on designated or statutory holidays.
  • Scheduled hours of work may be reduced during the rotation stipulated when a statutory or designated holiday is recognized during that period.
  • The successful candidate is responsible to obtain and provide an original Criminal Record Check (CRC) & Vulnerable Sector Check (VSC) from their local police service, RCMP or previous country/countries of residence that is dated within the past six (6) months that is satisfactory to the Saskatchewan Health Authority. Internal candidates may be required to provide a CRC & VSC during recruitment and selection process.
Geographic Location: Kipling

Expected Start Date: May 18, 2022

Expected Up To Date: August 31, 2022

FTE®: 0.57

Working in Canada

Candidates are required to be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply on this position.

Direct Inquiries To

SHA (Sun Country)

title: Custodial Buildings and Grounds in Golden, BC
description:
Ensuring that all Golden Skybridge grounds and facilities are kept tidy and clean to provide guests with a high quality experience
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe
  • Work experience in an iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuit’s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an inclusive culture and make life-long friends
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth or future work at other Pursuit locations
  • Access to one of the world’s most beautiful and iconic National Parks
Custodial Buildings and Grounds wage is $18/hr.
  • Upkeep and cleanliness of public areas, staff spaces, storage areas and company vehicles
  • Assisting carpenters with projects
  • Following all safety rules and procedures
  • Maintaining all public and staff spaces
  • Emptying garbage bins and maintaining the recycling program
  • Monitoring cleaning supply inventory
  • Snow shoveling, sweeping exterior decks, walkways and parking lots
  • Horticultural maintenance of flower beds and raking
  • Assisting maintenance as required
  • Ensuring that each customer interaction is friendly and professional
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Proven ability to work within strict policy/procedures and guidelines
  • WHMIS knowledge and cleaning experience an asset
  • A clean Driver’s License required; Alberta Class 4 License an asset
  • To honour our commitment to be “Always Honest” all employees must consent to a criminal record check
This fun, summer job runs from May 2, June 13 or July 4 to August 31, September 4 or October 28.
  • Housing available for $17/day
  • Beautiful. You’ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring locations. You’ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. You’ll participate in team events - and fun!
  • Independent. You’ll spend your days in and around National Parks
  • Remote. Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog. Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of through WiFi
  • Busy. You need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required
This job description describes the role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up. We work as a team and believe that we succeed together - these job duties may change based on the needs of the team and company as a whole.

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in British Columbia, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required.

#HKG

Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Site Facility Management Co-worker
description:
CE QUE TU VAS NOUS APPORTER
• Vous êtes motivé par des solutions efficaces et durables en plus d’être axé sur le service et les clients.
• Vous avez l’esprit d’équipe ; vous retirez autant de satisfaction à aider les autres à se développer qu’à vous développer vous-même.
• Vous avez une expérience réelle en gestion des installations dans une organisation multiservice (ou l’équivalent), préférablement dans le secteur de la vente au détail à volume élevé.
• Vous restez calme et posé lors de situations stressantes et vous savez résoudre des problèmes afin de respecter des échéances ; vous avez d’excellentes aptitudes en relations
interpersonnelles, en analyse et en résolution de problèmes.
• Vous savez comment utiliser MS Office et les logiciels de gestion des installations assistée par ordinateur, et comprenez les processus commerciaux de gestion des installations d’un site.
• Vous avez une compréhension technique de base des aspects d’un bâtiment de vente au détail et de l’équipement qui s’y rattache (le système CVC, l’électricité, la plomberie, l’immotique).

A QUOI RESSEMBLE UNE JOURNEE AVEC NOUS ?
• Fournir les services de gestion des installations convenus en effectuant les inspections, les tests, l’entretien, les réparations et les améliorations conformément aux exigences immobilières
et de vente au détail de IKEA, ainsi qu’à toutes les réglementations locales applicables.
• Contribuer aux projets de gestion des installations au nom du responsable de la gestion des installations.
• Utiliser les différents outils, notamment les outils de gestion des installations assistée par ordinateur, pour consulter et mettre à jour les inspections, les essais et les tâches d’entretien
(activités ITM) qui ont été émis, tant pour le travail du fournisseur que pour le travail interne. Documenter et rapporter les conclusions, les risques ou le risque d’incidents liés à ces activités.
• Soutenir la gestion des fournisseurs, notamment en fournissant de l’aide aux fournisseurs externes et en appuyant le processus d’appel d’offres pour les fournisseurs de services de gestion
des installations nouveaux ou potentiels.
• Promouvoir l’engagement social et environnemental de IKEA ; travailler de concert avec les coéquipiers pour trouver des moyens de contribuer au développement durable.
• Contribuer à la réduction des coûts en travaillant d’une manière agile, simple et efficace, en utilisant et en partageant les bons exemples, et en encourageant les collaborateurs à trouver
des manières plus efficaces de travailler.
• Fournir au quotidien les services de gestion des installations convenus afin d’assurer un environnement durable, sécuritaire, propre et fonctionnel aux collaborateurs, aux visiteurs et aux
clients.

A PROPOS DE CE SECTEUR D'ACTIVITÉ
Sans nous, nos nombreux collaborateurs et clients ne pourraient pas se tourner vers IKEA. Nous nous assurons de sécuriser, de construire et de maintenir nos emplacements physiques, qu’il s’agisse des magasins, des bureaux ou des usines, afin de répondre aux besoins d’un grand nombre de personnes. Ensemble, nous sommes à la pointe de la technologie, proposant des agencements sûrs, conformes, durables et innovants pour chaque établissement. Et nous sommes fiers de voir le tout tourner rondement !




JUSTE POUR QUE VOUS SACHIEZ
Dans le monde IKEA, ce poste est officiellement appelé : Collaborateur, gestion des installations.

Remarque : L’obtention de ce poste est conditionnelle à une vérification satisfaisante du casier judiciaire. Avoir un casier judiciaire en vertu du Code criminel ou d’autres autorités fédérales n’exclut pas nécessairement l’admissibilité à ce poste.

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1676323 Date posted 02/26/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :SALMON ARM

Facility :BASTION PLACE

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

We are presently hiring and looking for new team members to join our Recreation Therapy team at Bastion Place in Salmon Arm.

A strong candidate will have completed a Certificate from a recognized recreation therapy program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents. This position plans programs and assists in getting residents to/from their programs. Staff go on outings with the residents, facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.), and one-to-one programs.

Bastion Place embodies a resident-centered philosophy designed to support residents’ choices, help people function at their highest level, and provide the best quality of life possible.

Once hired into a casual role, employees are eligible to apply for internal postings including permanent part-time or full time positions. There are many opportunities with Interior Health that begin with casual on-call positions and lead to regular employment

If you are looking for a challenging career with a great work life balance, this position is for you. Come and join us! Our focus is on giving people room to grow, to make an impact in the lives of others. Apply Today!

Qualifications
  • Grade 12
  • Completion of a recognized recreation course(s)
  • Two year’s recent, related experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license
**Please Note**

We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.

Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.
skills: ['Two year’s recent, related experience']

title: Shipping Worker
description:
Maple Leaf Foods in Winnipeg is accepting applications for Shipper/Receiver positions for our new Paquin Rd Pork Plant, which require availability for up to 40 hours a week. We currently have numerous vacancies, and a variety of shifts available on both our morning/afternoon and afternoon/evening shifts - come join our team!

BASIC FUNCTION: This position will be responsible for loading and unloading of goods in a timely and cost-effective manner.

Duties/Responsibilities
  • Manage receipt of packaging materials and production work in process ensuring adherence to all quality requirements including timely inputs into SAP.
  • Organization of all packaging and finished good storage areas in accordance of FEFO process.
  • Manage and communicate issues to external warehouses, carriers and dispatch drivers
  • Utilize docks, warehouse layout and plant routings with a focus on minimizing loading time
  • Reports any incident or situation that might affect production to the Supervisor.
  • Other duties as assigned.
MENTAL EFFORT:
  • Has to focus/concentrate while performing the job.
  • Accurate documentation and preparation of sanitation inspection reports.
  • Has to do simple math or calculations
  • Computer Proficiency.
  • WHMIS Training
PHYSICAL EFFORT:
  • Standing or sitting for extended periods of time.
  • Lifting of up to 40 lb boxes.
WORKING CONDITIONS:

A fast paced work environment with multiple, tight and changing priorities.

SPECIFICATIONS (Skills/Qualifications/Other Requirements)
  • Forklift or Electric Power Jack experience
  • Willing to be trained to do the job.
  • Has the ability to do the job.
  • Must be physically fit.
  • Good hand and eye coordination.
  • Good interpersonal skills.
  • Good communication skills. (reading, writing and speaking English)
  • Ability to read and interpret Standard Operating Procedures.
  • Good mathematics skills.
  • Good work ethics and over-all attitude.
We thank all applicants for their interest in exploring employment opportunities with Maple Leaf Foods however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Applicants may be subject to a background check and must meet the security criteria designated for the position.

Maple Leaf Foods is committed to Employment Equity and maintaining a diverse workforce. Job applicants with a disability who require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process can contact our Talent Attraction Team at accommodations@mapleleaf.com. Reasonable accommodations will be determined on a case-by-case basis and your request will be responded to as soon as possible.

title: サービススタッフ
description:
料飲関係の経験を存分に生かせるサービスと料理のアンバサダーとして、温かく、心のこもった対応と豊富な知識でゲストに価値ある体験を提供します。

特典、育成、活動等:
  • ホテルで働く上で特典と思われる見本、サンプルを３，４点箇条書き
  • 世界中のアコーホテルズで使用可能な従業員特典割引カード
  • アカデミーによる研修プログラム
  • CSR(企業の社会的責任)活動への参加（例：プラネット21)
  • 国内外でのキャリア形成のチャンスがあります。
職責:
  • 情報をもとにメニューアイテムをゲスト目線で説明する
  • ドリンクリスト、販売促進アイテム、メニュー、料理方法について十分な知識を持つ
  • 料理、飲料を扱う際は安全衛生基準を遵守する
必要な経験と能力:
  • ゲストの希望を注意深く捉え、常に冷静さを保ち、おもてなしができる
  • 人間構築に長け、問題も解決できる
  • 迅速さが必要な場面でも十分な仕事ができる
  • チームメンバーの1人として結束力を持ち協力的に仕事をすることができる
職場環境:
  • ホテルグループの文化を反映させるようなチーム、ホテル、オフィス環境の紹介を１、2文章

注意：カスタマイズには就業規則のようなそれぞれの地域や法律上必要となるものも含まれる可能性がある

私達の約束、多様性と包括

私達は包括的な会社です。多様な人を採用し、昇進の道を用意することを志しています。

なぜアコーに勤務しますか？

宴会サービス

料飲に関する全ての仕事、またお客様を笑顔にすることに情熱を持ち、お客様の心に触れ、思い出深い特別な経験を作り出します。

特典、育成、活動等:
  • ホテルで働く上で特典と思われる見本、サンプルを３，４点箇条書き
  • 世界中のアコーホテルズで使用可能な従業員特典割引カード
  • 能力向上を推進するためのアカデミーによる研修プログラム
現職のホテル又は世界中のホテルで才能を伸ばし成長できるチャンス
  • CSR(企業の社会的責任)活動への参加（例：プラネット21)

職責:
  • 特別食やお客様の好みを織り交ぜながら宴会メニューの説明をする。食事に合わせた飲み物を提供する
  • ホテル内の会議室や使用エリアを設営する
  • サービスエリアが清潔、整頓されていることを確認しテーブル類を片付ける
  • 食品衛生の基準を守る
必要な経験、能力:
  • 温みのあるサービスや人の世話を得意とする人材; ハウスキーピング経験者等
  • チームの一員として結束力を高めて仕事をする
  • プロとしておもてなしの意識を持ち、お客様の希望を予測し対応できる
職場環境:
  • ホテルグループの文化を反映させるようなチーム、ホテル、オフィス環境の紹介を１、2文章

私達は包括的な会社です。多様な人を採用し、昇進の道を用意することを志しています。

なぜアコーに勤務しますか？

私たちは世界的なリーダー以上の存在です。皆さんを喜んでお迎えしたいと思いますので、あなたの個性に合った仕事やブランドを見つけてください。

私たちはあなたが日々成長し、学ぶことをサポートし、仕事があなたの人生に目的をもたらすことを確実にすることで、私たちと共に旅する間、あなたはアコーの無限の可能性を探求し続けることができます。

アコーに入社することで、あなたのストーリーのすべての章があなた自身が書き上げるものとなり、私たちは共に明日のおもてなしを思い描くことができます。アコーであなたを待っている人生を発見してください。ぜひhttps://careers.accor.com/をご覧ください。

title: Paintline Worker
description:
Do you have a creative way that you like to express yourself? Perhaps you'd be interested in painting this town red? PeopleReady is now hiring Paintline Workers who can bring a positive attitude and professional flair to the jobsite.Professional Paintline Workers begin by preparing surfaces for painting. This may require removing old paint, filling holes, and washing walls. Sandpaper, wire brushes, scrapers, and abrasive blasting may be used to prepare surfaces. ThePaintline Worker fills holes and divots with putty, plaster, or caulk, and then ensures that surfaces are not susceptible to moisture by sealing cracks and corners where building materials meet.After a surface is clean and ready for paint, professional painters apply primer and paint at the appropriate spread rate and temperature in order to ensure the best results. Primer selection is based on the location and type of surface being finished.Our Paintline Workers also show a keen knowledge of color theory. While color selection is ultimately up to the customer, painters advise clients and craft the appearance their customers seek. They may use varnish, oil, or paint additives to derive specific colors and textures. Some special techniques provide decorative and faux finishes. These finishes often require the use of washes, glazes, and layering. Professional Paintline Workers may also use techniques such as sponging, distressing, stippling, and color blocking to build effects for their clients.Paintline Workersalso handle jobsite preparation and cleanup. They may build scaffolding and use dropcloths or tape in order to clean paint spills, dust from sanding, and other materials, and remove them from a completed jobsite. Although some painters do all types of painting, many specialize in one type, such as new construction, signs, exterior or interior work, or remodeling. Regardless of the type, we would love to talk more about this full-time opportunity.Note – Pay Rate for this Job is $16.83/Hour-$17.50/HourShift Timing - 2nd Shift (Evening)Responsibilities Include:
  • Applying various finishes to equipment, buildings, bridges, or other structures
  • Applying primers or sealers to prepare new surfaces, such as bare wood or metal, for finish coats
  • Mixing colors or oils to obtain desired color or consistencyQualifications:
  • Reliable transportation to and from different jobsites
  • Tools of the trade and the ability to bring them to the jobsite
  • Strong work ethic and positive attitude
  • Able to remain in a stationary position for long periods of time and able to occasionally lift and move 20 pounds

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1695619 Date posted 04/21/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :CRESTON

Facility :SWAN VALLEY LODGE

Status :RELIEF PART TIME (0.60 FTE)

Position Summary

We are presently seeking a new Recreation Therapy Worker to join our Adult Day team at Swan Valley Lodge in Creston, BC. A strong candidate will have completed a course or certificate from a recognized recreation therapy program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents and short stay clients. This position assists in getting residents to/from their programs and carries out established leisure/recreation therapy programs. Staff go on outings with the residents and facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.) including one-to-one programs. The Recreation Therapy Worker also reports relevant observations of resident progress and behavior to the Supervisor/Recreation Therapist and provides suggestions for changes or modifications to the existing programs.

This is a relief part-time (0.60 FTE) position until the return of the incumbent, working rotating days with shift times of 10:00 to 16:00.

Apply today to join a great team!
  • Please Note**
  • We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.
  • Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor
    • Qualifications
    • Grade 12, completion of a recognized recreation course(s) plus two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
    • Valid class 4 vehicle license as required
    This posting is for casual work at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order.

    Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: Manufacturing Worker
description:
Job Description

Drake International are currently hiring for a growing Manufacturing Facility in the Brockville area.

This growth has allowed the company to create new jobs within the facility and they would like to hear from experienced Production Workers in medium to heavy settings.

If you are interested in FULL-TIME work and are comfortable with rotating 12-hour shifts, then consider the following.
  • You must have general math and English skills.
  • You must have a hands-on mechanical aptitude and willing to work around heavy equipment. Experience is preferred but this can be learned.
  • Long hours on your feet in an industrial setting is tough, but you are only working half the year!
  • Able to work in a team-based environment and have attention to detail. Most importantly ask clarifying questions!
  • Clear Background check is required.
  • Covid protocols in place.
  • Great starting salary ($19.80) and growth opportunities within the first year up to $22.45 hourly.

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today! Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted.

About Drake International:

Since 1951, Drake International continues to be a global leader in flexible and permanent staffing: we help businesses find the perfect candidate and job seekers find the perfect career in Canada and across the globe. Connect with us today.

INDBrockville

Refer a Friend

Introduce your friends to Drake and we will pay you up to $500* if we place your friend in a permanent position. You can also earn $50* if we place your friend in a temporary assignment. * Please see your local branch for details. (Offer not available in the province of BC)

title: CLEANER/LAUNDRY WORKER I (TEMPORARY PART TIME)
description:
If you are looking for friendly, supportive staff, work life balance and affordable living this may be just the opportunity that will take your career to a new level.

Cleaner

In accordance with established vision and values of the organization, this position performs a variety of housekeeping duties throughout the facility. Maintains clean and disinfected conditions in areas such as patient/resident/client rooms, Operating Rooms, Diagnostic Imaging and Laboratory, Labour and Delivery Rooms, washrooms, corridors, hallways, lounges, offices and common areas used by staff, visitors and patients/residents/clients as established in Northern Health Regional Housekeeping Policies and Processes.

Laundry Worker I

In accordance with established vision and values of the organization and under the supervision of the Laundry Supervisor, positions at this level perform a variety of laundry duties such as sorting, folding and weighing linen, and operating domestic washers and dryer. These duties are conducted within the scope of Regional Northern Health (NH) Laundry Policies and Processes.

Shift Rotation/Hours of work: Days - 06:00 to 14:00, 10:00 to 18:00, 05:30 to 13:30, rotating

Gateway Lodge is a beautiful and bright building with many large open spaces and access to the outdoors to enjoy. There are 2 floors designated for Assisted Living Residents, 3 floors designated and inclusive of Complex Care, Respite, and Convalescent residents/clients. There are 119 long term care beds and 50 assisted living beds, one respite and one short stay. All rooms are single occupancy with private bathrooms. Gateway provides Recreational Therapy Services on a daily basis with therapeutic programs offered on each wing, and in larger group settings in the beautiful multipurpose rooms. They also provide activities such as hymn-sing, school visits with the elderly, choral groups.

Prince George has a population of 89,490 (2021) local residents and is a service centre for approximately 320,000. Prince George has all of the amenities of a larger city mixed with the charm and friendliness of a smaller town. Check out Prince George for more information on what this community has to offer.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.
  • Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service
  • Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions
  • Employee referral program
  • Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC
  • “Loan Forgiveness Programs” offered through the Federal and BC Government
  • Grade 10 or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation’s communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

title: Overnight Custodian & Monitor
description:
Seasonal Full Time (2)

LaRonge SK

Proudly building upon a 60 year heritage of aviation excellence, and employing a diverse fleet of fixed wing aircraft on wheels, skis and floats; Rise Air continues to be the largest Scheduled, Charter and MEDEVAC aviation operation in Saskatchewan. Rise Air has opportunities for Overnight Custodian & Monitor for this summer float season in LaRonge, Saskatchewan

Job Purpose

The Overnight Custodian & Monitor is responsible for the overall monitoring of the building, parking lot, aircrafts and dock as well as light custodial duties at each location. This may include, but is not limited to, monitoring CCTV system, ensuring the security of the building, parking lot, aircrafts, and ground equipment at the water base. All work is completed in accordance with Rise Air standards, policies and procedures.

Responsibilities
  • Monitor CCTV system.
  • Monitor building, parking lot, aircrafts and ground equipment at water base.
  • Liaise with RCMP when necessary.
  • Custodial duties including, but not limited to:
  • Tidying the office area,
  • Cleaning the washroom,
  • Dusting, sweeping and vacuuming,
  • Tidying common areas.
Qualifications

Education and Experience
  • High School diploma is preferred.
  • WHMIS and Dangerous Goods Awareness Training is an asset.
  • Previous experience in a similar role is preferred.
  • A combination of education and experience may be considered.
Skills, Knowledge And Abilities
  • Acute attention to detail and in information retention with high accuracy.
  • Comfortable speaking with law enforcement when necessary.
  • Knowledge of cleaning products, practices and safety.
  • Bondable.
Working Conditions
  • The Overnight Custodian & Monitor works from 10:00 pm to 6:00 am The shift itself is determined by the Manager in accordance with Company requirements.
  • Must be comfortable working alone.
  • No guests are permitted on site.
Typical Physical and Cognitive Demands
  • Ability to lift up to 15 pounds.
  • Able to work with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to quickly identify problems and remain calm while resolving any issues that may arise.
As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for controlled substances and alcohol prior to employment. We appreciate all applicants, however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Plant Worker
description:
Shift: M-F, 3rd shift: 7pm to 7am on a 2-2-3 Continental shift

Seeking a Plant Worker to ensure all waste is unloaded from vehicles, the vehicles are decontaminated, and waste is properly staged for scanning and processing. The individual will perform the duties in a safe and productive manner.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Unload waste from incoming vehicles. Separates non-autoclavable waste to be incinerated.
Stage waste on conveyor system or properly stack waste for scanning in the Biotrack system.
Scan waste into the Biotrack system for proper recordkeeping purposes.
Load autoclave bins or incinerator hopper with waste for processing.
Place re-usable containers on tub wash line for decontamination.
Operates tub wash unit insuring the wash unit is operating properly. Removes clean tubs from wash unit, inspects tubs and stacks for loading onto assigned vehicle for re-use.
Operates tub wash sprayer for oversized reusable tubs insuring the unit is operating properly. Inspects tubs and stacks for loading onto assigned vehicle for re-use.
Decontaminates vehicles cargo-carrying portion, reloads assigned re-usable tubs and insures cargo-carrying portion of vehicle does not have free liquid on the floor. Informs plant supervisor the vehicle is ready to be moved from dock area.
Insures housekeeping issues, e.g., spills cleaned up, floor is dry, and debris not on floor, etc., are addressed immediately.
Assists in other areas of the plant operation as directed.

Education and Experience:
High school diploma or equivalent (GED). One year related experience or training or combination of experience and training, demonstrating strong communication skills and tact.
Position requires extensive lifting, walking, bending, and pushing. Must be able to lift up to 55 pounds and push and/or pull carts weighing as much as 500 pounds.
Demonstrates knowledge of barcode scanning and basic computer skills.
Demonstrates knowledge of Hazardous Materials and OSHA Regulations.
Demonstrates the ability to operate a powered industrial truck, e.g., forklift.

This will be a 12 hour continental shift including working weekends. The shift is 7pm to 7am on a 2-2-3 Continental shift . This Tm will work alongside an incinerator operator. This position could lead to hiring long term if the right fit is found.

title: Spécialiste du Contenu des Listes | Listing Content Specialist
description:
[English description to follow]

Sonder révolutionne l'hospitalité grâce à un service innovant alimenté par la technologie et à des hébergements inspirants et conçus de manière réfléchie, combinés en une seule expérience gérée de manière transparente. Officiellement lancé en 2014 et basé à San Francisco, Sonder rend un monde de meilleurs séjours ouvert à tous avec une variété d'options d'hébergement - des chambres aux suites et aux appartements - que l'on trouve dans plus de 30 villes réparties dans huit pays et sur trois continents. L'application innovante de Sonder permet aux clients d'accéder à des fonctions en libre-service et à une assistance sur le terrain 24 heures sur 24 et 7 jours sur 7. Qu'il s'agisse d'un simple enregistrement en libre-service ou d'équipements de salle de bain de marque, nous offrons le meilleur d'un hôtel sans aucune formalité.

En tant que spécialiste du contenu des listes, vous ferez partie de notre équipe de distribution élargie qui se concentre sur la façon dont Sonder et ses établissements sont présentés et trouvés par les clients potentiels. Nous sommes à la recherche d'un travailleur acharné, doté d'excellentes compétences en rédaction créative et ouvert au changement. Ce poste sera responsable de la création, de la gestion et de l'optimisation des inscriptions sur les plateformes de réservation comme Airbnb, Vrbo, Booking.com, Expedia Group et notre propre site Web.

Chez Sonder, Vous Devrez
  • Créer, rédiger et mettre en ligne des annonces sur tous les marchés de Sonder sur divers canaux et plateformes de réservation.
  • Utiliser les normes de la marque pour actualiser la voix et le ton de Sonder en rafraîchissant le contenu des annonces.
  • Optimiser la sélection et l'ordre des photos pour chaque canal afin d'augmenter la conversion.
  • Utiliser des techniques pour améliorer le classement dans les moteurs de recherche, les pages vues et la conversion.
  • Utiliser la voix et le ton de Sonder pour répondre aux commentaires des clients sur tous les canaux.
  • Effectuer un dépannage de base pour améliorer l'efficacité de notre plateforme d'annonces.
  • Partager des études de marché et de la concurrence pour s'assurer que les annonces de Sonder sont présentées de manière optimale aux clients.
  • Effectuer des audits de qualité en matière de grammaire, de style et d'exactitude.
  • Collaborer avec les parties prenantes de nos équipes d'exploitation, de gestion des revenus, de marketing, de produits et d'ingénierie.
Ce Que Nous Recherchons
  • Minimum 4 ans de diplôme de premier cycle ou une expérience équivalente
  • Au moins un an de marketing, de rédaction créative ou de service à la clientèle de préférence.
  • Excellente communication écrite et compétences relationnelles
  • Maîtrise de la suite Google (Sheets), de Microsoft Office (Excel), ou de compétences connexes
  • Capacité à travailler dans une entreprise à forte croissance et au rythme rapide.
  • Grand souci du détail - capacité à repérer et à corriger les erreurs grammaticales, les photos non conformes, les politiques d'annulation incorrectes ou tout autre problème pouvant avoir un impact sur nos annonces.
  • Organisé, travailleur et capable de s'adapter aux changements de processus.
  • Vous êtes à l'aise pour apprendre à utiliser de nouvelles plateformes logicielles.
Nous Offrons Également D'excellents Avantages Sociaux Pour Vous Faciliter La Vie Et Vous Permettre De Vous Concentrer Sur Ce Que Vous Savez Faire Le Mieux
  • Une rémunération compétitive
  • Plan d'options sur actions généreux
  • Assurance médicale, dentaire et visuelle
  • Les membres de l'équipe exonérés bénéficient de congés payés. Les membres de l'équipe non exemptés accumulent des congés payés.
  • Crédits annuels gratuits et remises pour rester à Sonders
  • Une entreprise avec une grande vision, un environnement de travail dynamique et une équipe de collègues intelligents, ambitieux et avec lesquels il est agréable de travailler !
Nous sommes un employeur qui respecte l'égalité des chances et nous valorisons la diversité au sein de notre entreprise. Nous ne pratiquons aucune discrimination fondée sur la race, la religion, la couleur, l'origine nationale, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'âge, l'état civil, le statut de vétéran ou le statut de handicapé ou d'autres classes protégées.

Sonder is revolutionizing hospitality through innovative, tech-powered service and inspiring, thoughtfully designed accommodations combined into one seamlessly managed experience. Officially launched in 2014 and headquartered in San Francisco, Sonder is making a world of better stays open to all with a variety of accommodation options — from rooms to suites and apartments — found in more than 30 cities spanning eight countries and three continents. Sonder’s innovative app empowers guests by making self-service features and 24/7 on-the-ground support just a tap away. From simple self check-in to boutique bathroom amenities, we bring the best of a hotel without any of the formality.

As a Listing Content Specialist, you will be part of our broader distribution team focused on how Sonder and its locations are presented to and found by potential guests. We’re looking for a hard worker with excellent creative writing skills who embraces change. This position will be responsible for creating, managing, and optimizing listings on booking platforms like Airbnb, Vrbo, Booking.com, Expedia Group, and our own website.

At Sonder You Will
  • Create, write, and upload listings across all Sonder markets on various booking channels and platforms
  • Utilize brand standards to update Sonder’s voice and tone through listing content refreshes
  • Optimize channel specific photo selection and order to increase conversion
  • Use techniques to improve search rank, page views, and conversion
  • Employ Sonder’s voice and tone to respond to guest reviews across all channels
  • Conduct basic troubleshooting to increase efficiency within our Listings Platform
  • Share competitive and market research to ensure Sonder listings are optimally presented to guests
  • Perform quality audits for grammar, style, and accuracy
  • Partner with stakeholders across our City Operations, Revenue Management, Marketing, Product, and Engineering teams
What We Look For
  • Minimum 4 years undergraduate degree or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 1 year marketing, creative writing, or customer service preferred
  • Excellent written communication and people skills
  • Proficient in Google Suite (Sheets), Microsoft Office (Excel), or related skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, high-growth company
  • Strong attention to detail — easily able to spot and correct grammatical errors, off-brand photos, incorrect cancellation policies, or any other issues that can impact our listings
  • Organized, hardworking, and adaptable to process changes
  • Comfortable learning how to use new software platforms
We also have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you’re best at:
  • Competitive compensation
  • Generous stock option plan
  • Medical, dental and vision insurance (where applicable)
  • Flexible vacation
  • Annual free credits and discounts to stay in Sonders
  • A company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of smart, ambitious and fun to work-with colleagues!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status or other protected classes.

title: Attendant Services Worker - Casual/Relief
description:
Independent Living Waterloo Region (ILWR) is a non-profit organization that provides support to people with disabilities by assisting and empowering individuals to eliminate barriers to independent living. Through a variety of programs, the Independent Living Waterloo Region partners with people with disabilities to help them lead full, active, and independent lives while promoting accessibility and inclusion in our community.

Job Opportunity

ATTENDANT SERVICES WORKER

(Casual/Relief)

Position Summary

The Independent Living Waterloo Region is seeking home care professionals who are passionate about making a difference in the lives of people who experience disabilities in our community. This position provides personal assistance with the activities of daily living for adults with physical disabilities in the Region of Waterloo. This includes both personal care tasks, and incidental activities of daily living such as housekeeping, meal preparation, etc. The successful applicant will provide supportive service and demonstrate the highest standard of courtesy and respect in their dealings with other employees, consumers, and internal/external partners.

Key Responsibilities

Provide assistance with a wide range of activities of living including:
  • Providing total personal care such as toileting, bathing, and perineal care.
  • Grooming, including oral care
  • Assist consumer with dressing and undressing
  • Assist in feeding consumers who are unable to feed themselves
  • Support good skin care to prevent skin breakdown (i.e. turn and reposition client, actively
  • encourage movement)
  • Breathing Assistance (e.g. tracheostomy, respirator)
  • Assist client with active and passive range of motions as defined by the care plan.
  • Provide consumer with help walking and transferring
  • Assist consumer in the self-administration of medication.
  • Perform light housekeeping
  • Perform meal preparation and clean up
  • Change bed linens and make up the consumers bed
  • Maintain an orderly client environment.
Requirements
  • Experience working/volunteering in care of persons with disabilities, convalescent care, or other related field.
  • Minimum High School Diploma. Completed or working towards HSW/PSW Certificate Preferred
  • Current First Aid/CPR (or willing to obtain).
  • Available to work in various locations throughout the Region of Waterloo.
  • Driver's license and personal vehicle required for travel between locations and service calls.
  • Willing to work in home-care environment that may include exposure to bodily fluids, household cleaners, pets, residual smoking odour, and fluctuating room temperature.
  • Proof of full COVID-19 Immunization.
  • Available to work rotating weekends
Job Details

Status: Casual, Permanent

Hours: Approx. 8 - 40 hrs/week

Schedule: Rotating schedule consisting of mornings, afternoons, evenings, and weekends.

Location: Region of Waterloo (ex. Kitchener, Cambridge, Waterloo, and Surrounding Area)

Starting Wage: $18.75/Hour + Pandemic Temporary Wage Enhancement ($3/Hour)

Apply: Interested job seekers should apply in writing, submitting a resume and cover letter with a summary of relevant qualifications and reason for interest in this position using the application form on our website.

ILWR is committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection process and work environment. We seek to provide accessibility for all applicants with disabilities consistent with our accessibility policies and the AODA. Please let us know if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. We thank all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
