title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1699325 Date posted 04/13/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :VERNON

Facility :POLSON

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

We are seeking additional team members to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Polson Place in Vernon, B.C.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker, you will carry out established individual or group leisure/recreation therapy programs such as; arts, socio-cultural events, crafts, sports, music, cooking, gardening, and exercises as directed. You will also set up and organize furnishings and equipment for programs and/or special events, porter’s residents to programs, teaches the techniques of related programs to residents, and oversees the resident’s participation and reports problems/changes to supervisor. When attending resident programs outside of the facility and accompanies resident you will check that the resident has appropriate clothing and necessary funds for the outing, and confirm details of the program with the nursing staff or therapist.

Along With Your Organizational Skills You Will
  • Lead individual one to one sessions, groups, and large special events within the established recreation therapy program, adapts programs to meet the physical, social, cognitive, spiritual, emotional needs of the residents, completes resident attendance list on a daily basis, and submits to designated supervisor for care conferencing reports and program evaluation.
  • Assist with promotion and publicizing of programs and or special events, and is responsible for decorating home for seasonal changes.
  • Assist volunteers and/or students by providing functional direction during programs (1:1, small group, large group or special events).
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.
Shifts are Monday – Friday with shift times of 08:30 to 16:30, and 08:00.

This is a Casual opportunity. Casual means there are no guaranteed hours and work requirements can vary from 0 - 37.5 hours per week. Casual employment includes: short-notice, on-call availability; workload coverage during a temporary absences; and/or providing relief coverage in a specific position.

If you are looking for a challenging career with a great work life balance, this position is for you. Apply Today!

We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.

Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor.

Qualifications
  • Grade 12
  • Completion of a recognized recreation course(s).
  • Two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license is required.
  • Along with your resume please provide copies of your completed recreation courses and class 4 DL
This posting is for casual work at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: Worker/Helper - Days/Weekends - FullTime - Concord - 16.45/hr ~ 17.70/hr
description:
Production Helper! - Full-Time!

Are you interested in learning new skills?

Do you like working with manual/semi-automatic hand tools? Do you like working in a fast-paced and fast-growing environment?

Do you have an interest in assembling and building things? Would you like to join one of the best manufacturing plants?

If the answer is Yes! We have an amazing opportunity for you. Join the Randstad team at the Manufacturing Plant at Concord!

Shifts Available:

Days: Monday to Thursday; 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM (Pay: $16.45/hr) - Urgently Hiring

Nights: Monday to Thursday; 7:30 PM to 6:00 AM (Pay: $17.70/hr)

Weekends: Friday, Saturday, Sunday; 7:30 AM to 8:00 PM (Pay: $16.45/hr) - Urgently Hiring

***4-hour bonus pay for 3 consecutive days of work in Weekend Shift***

Pay: Starting $16.45/hr

Address: Applewood Cres, Concord, ON

(Intersection – Highway 400 & Langstaff Rd)

Advantages

What is in it for you as the General Labor at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
  • Weekly pay
  • Competitive pay rate
  • Weekend Bonus / Night Shift premium
  • 4% Vacation Pay
  • Schedule: three shifts to choose from
  • Onsite support to help you succeed and learn new skills

Responsibilities

What will you do as General Labor at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
  • Assembly and packaging of windows and window components
  • Basic reading skills
  • Read a Tape Measure – Metric and Standard
  • Operate Hand Tools, Screw Gun, Drills, and tools
  • Cleaning of assembled frame
  • Other general duties as required by the Manager / Supervisor / Lead Hand

(Training / Ongoing support provided for all responsibilities)

Qualifications

What will make you an IDEAL candidate for the General Labor role at Manufacturing Plant in Concord:
  • Operate manual or semi-automatic hand tools
  • Ability to use a tape measure
  • Lifting up to 50 pounds (regularly)
  • Experience working in a plant/manufacturing environment is an asset but not necessary.
  • MUST be able to drive to the location (Applewood Cres, Concord) - NOT accessible by Public Transport

Summary

Amazing opportunity for those who are looking to get a job instantly!

Get some general labor experience! and learn some skills!

We are ready for you to join us!!

Start ASAP

Contact ‘Krithika’ today, email on ‘krithika.sridhar@randstad.ca’ and mention “Concord-General Labor” in the subject line.

Or Call/Text on 905-867-0297

Randstad Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the diversity of Canada. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage candidates, especially those who identify as a woman, an Aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group, and any others who may contribute to the diversification of our workforce, to apply.

Randstad Canada is also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise your Randstad Representative or your local Randstad branch in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Facility Custodian
description:
From $24 to $28 per hour

Toronto Branch

3333 James Snow Parkway North, Milton, ON L9T 8L1

From spotless warehouses to manicured lawns and walking trails, maintaining world-class facilities is as important to Uline as providing quality products and great service. Join a Facilities team that helps manage over 16 million square feet of property on over 50 million square feet of grounds.

Position Responsibilities
  • Perform general labour to support operation requirements as needed.
  • Sweeping, mopping, wiping racks, yard maintenance, building maintenance, etc.
  • Process trash removal and corrugated scraps with a compactor.
  • Clean restrooms.
  • Operate floor scrubber (electric or propane) and other equipment.
  • Set up and clean employee workspaces.
  • Assist with meeting set-up and teardown.
Minimum Requirements
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Previous custodial / cleaning experience required.
  • Ability to lift and / or move up to 50 lbs.
Benefits
  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with 5% employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
  • Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Employee Perks
  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.
  • First-class fitness center.
About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,000 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace.

Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer

(#IN-TOROF)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

title: Chef·fe d'équipe - Service de distibution
description:
Imprime-Emploi est une entreprise d’insertion sociale et professionnelle dans le secteur de l’imprimerie. Nous accueillons chaque année 42 jeunes vivant des difficultés en lien avec le marché du travail, pour un parcours de formation de 6 mois. Pour ce faire, nous avons une équipe permanente de 13 employés multidisciplinaires.


Le service de distribution fonctionne avec une équipe composée de 8 à 14 personnes sur appel. La Ville de Montréal est le principal client du service de distribution porte-à-porte d’Imprime-Emploi. Nous distribuons les Avis de travaux aux citoyens des 19 arrondissements de la ville. C’est une excellente opportunité de travail pour la saison estivale, puisqu’il s’agit d’un emploi extérieur, qui peut contribuer à une amélioration de la santé physique. Nous marchons plusieurs kilomètres chaque jour, et nous montons nombre d’escaliers.


Le poste de chef·fe d’équipe exige de détenir un permis de conduire valide et d’aimer conduire. Le/la chef·fe d’équipe est doté·e d’un leadership naturel dans le but de créer un esprit de collaboration dans l’équipe. La personne responsable du service de distribution est appelée à planifier l’itinéraire le plus logique et économique afin d’effectuer les distributions de la journée. Elle gère efficacement son équipe par une bonne division du secteur à couvrir selon la carte et les forces de chacun de ses coéquipiers. Elle s’assure que chacune des distributions soit complétée et rencontre les exigences et les normes de qualité établies par le contrat.


Le travail est généralement de jour, la semaine, sauf exception. Les semaines comptent en moyenne de 20 à 35 heures, selon les semaines.


Le quotidien comme chef·fe d’équipe

  • Conduire la voiture fournie par Imprime-Emploi;
  • Faire la distribution porte-à-porte des avis aux résidents des différents quartiers de Montréal;
  • À l’aide d’une carte, prévoir et suivre le trajet à effectuer;
  • Avoir un bon sens de l’orientation (connaissance de Google Map);
  • Exercer un leadership dans le but de maintenir un esprit de collaboration dans l’équipe;
  • Décider des meilleures stratégies pour accomplir les journées;
  • Être en mesure d’effectuer le travail dans différentes conditions météorologiques (prime lors d’avertissements météo);
  • Être en bonne forme physique.


Conditions

  • Travail rémunéré à 17.25$ / heure + prime météo + prime vêtement + prime weekend
  • Sur appel, possibilité de faire 20 à 35 heures par semaine
  • Permis de conduire valide requis


Pour postuler, contactez Sébastien Beaudet dès maintenant au (514) 649-2457 ou par courriel au direction@imprime-emploi.com

﻿

Imprime-Emploi a un fort engagement afin de créer et maintenir un milieu de travail qui valorise les diversités, quelles qu’elles soient. Nous encourageons fortement les personnes racisées, les personnes des communautés LGBTQ+, ou toute autre personne s’identifiant à une communauté discriminée, ainsi que les personnes de tout âge, à postuler.

Nous encourageons fortement les personnes racisées, les personnes des communautés LGBTQ+, ou toute autre personne s’identifiant à une communauté discriminée, ainsi que les personnes de tout âge, à postuler.']

title: Banff Gondola, Custodial Buildings and Grounds $16.50/hr
description:
Ensuring that all Gondola grounds and facilities are kept tidy and clean to provide guests with a high quality experience
  • Work in a dynamic, culturally diverse team from around the globe
  • Work experience in an iconic, unforgettable, and inspiring location
  • Free access to Pursuit attractions for staff and family, send a friend at half the price!
  • Discounted hotel stays under Pursuit’s lodging offerings, and discounted food & beverage and retail experiences
  • A safe work environment with structured COVID procedures and vaccination policies
  • The chance to work in an inclusive culture and make life-long friends
  • Access to subsidized mental health and wellness resources
  • Opportunities for career growth or future work at other Pursuit locations
  • Access to one of the world’s most beautiful and iconic National Parks
  • Upkeep and cleanliness of public areas, staff spaces, storage areas and company vehicles
  • Following all safety rules and procedures
  • Maintaining all public and staff spaces
  • Emptying garbage bins and maintaining the recycling program
  • Monitoring cleaning supply inventory
  • Snow shoveling, sweeping exterior decks, walkways and parking lots
  • Horticultural maintenance of flower beds
  • Assisting maintenance as required
  • Ensuring that each customer interaction is friendly and professional
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Proven ability to work within strict policy/procedures and guidelines
  • WHMIS knowledge and cleaning experience an asset
  • A clean Driver’s License required; Alberta Class 4 License an asset
  • To honour our commitment to be “Always Honest” all employees must consent to a criminal record check
  • Beautiful. You’ll work in iconic, unforgettable and inspiring locations. You’ll see amazing scenery and wildlife. You’ll participate in team events - and fun!
  • Independent. You’ll spend your days in and around National Parks
  • Remote. Our home is filled with trees, lakes and blue-bird skies; rather than buildings, freeways and smog. Connect with friends around a bonfire instead of through WiFi
  • Busy. You need to be prepared for a physical working environment with walking, stair climbing, bending, reaching, lifting (up to 50 pounds with assistance) required
This job description describes the role at a high level, but no document can anticipate every single task, issue or project that could come up. We work as a team and believe that we succeed together - these job duties may change based on the needs of the team and company as a whole.

To handle this job successfully, any person hired must be able to perform responsibilities as described. Pursuit will make any reasonable accommodation to help a person with disabilities perform their job. This job is based in Alberta, Canada. Relocation to the area and the legal ability to work in Canada is required.

#HKAB

Pursuit is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, age, religion, gender, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

title: Warehouse Caretaker, Nights
description:
Job Description

Shift : Sunday – Thursday 10:00 PM – 6:30 AM or Monday – Friday 10:00 PM – 6:30 AM

The North West Company (NWC) is looking to fill a position at our Winnipeg Logistics Service Centre. Your role as the warehouse caretaker involves maintaining the integrity of WLSC through regular cleaning and maintenance to ensure all employees are provided with a clean working environment with contents of infrastructure in working order.

Joining NWC gives you the opportunity for growth and development throughout the company, a competitive salary and benefits package, and to be part of a dynamic and diverse culture.

The North West Company is a leading retailer to under-served rural communities and urban neighbourhood markets in the following regions: Northern Canada, Western Canada, rural Alaska, the South Pacific islands, and the Caribbean. Our stores offer a broad range of products and services with an emphasis on food. Our value offer is to be the best local shopping choice for everyday household and local lifestyle needs. Check out northwest.ca for more information.

Your Role
  • Collect plastic wrap, cardboard, and waste materials from warehouse drop points and ensure effective removal.
  • Collect recycling from offices in warehouse and front main.
  • Operate motorized cleaning equipment.
  • Ensure aisles are clean and debris is removed.
  • Perform general housekeeping duties inside and outside the warehouse. This would include, but limited to: parking lot cleaning, refuse removal from landscaping, water and tend to flowers, shrubs and beds. Washroom sanitation when required.
  • Assist with Supervisor or Maintenance Technician on Preventative Maintenance duties as required.
  • Snow removal assistance as needed for entrance ways.
  • Stock and removal of water jugs to all warehouse offices, common spaces and meeting rooms.
  • Event setup tasks as assigned by supervisor and or manager.
  • Graffiti removal.
  • Applying slip protection to exterior walkways.
  • Cleans light fixtures as required.
  • Wiping racks and dusting of equipment within warehouse.
  • Clean and disinfect water fountains, refrigerators, and microwaves.
  • Completes daily, weekly and monthly checklists on building equipment maintenance procedures.
  • Responds to emergency maintenance requests as required.
  • Perform other tasks as assigned. Undertaking other duties appropriate to the level and character of work as instructed by the Supervisor or Maintenance Manager
Desired Skills & Experience
  • Ability to lift 75lbs unassisted and periodically overhead.
  • Understand the importance of safety in the workplace / follow all health and safety procedures and policies.
  • Ability to effectively multi-task and prioritize;
  • Must work well with others, have a willingness to learn, and maintain positive relationships;
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, able to lead, have clear communication skills; and
  • Must be able to work in inclement weather.
Location: Winnipeg Logistics Service Centre, 100 Murray Park Road

We Create a Collaborative And Constructive Culture By
  • Acting with Integrity
  • Fostering excellence
  • Respecting Others
  • Working Collaboratively
  • Being Accountable
The North West Company is committed to inclusion and diversity and encourages applications from all candidates including but not limited to: all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, BIPOC, and persons with disabilities

You may include your resume and cover letter together as a single document. Opportunities to learn, develop and advance throughout the organization are present. We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1607126 Date posted 09/29/2021

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :WILLIAMS LAKE

Facility :DENI HOUSE

Status :RELIEF PART TIME (0.50 FTE)

Position Summary

Note: Any position that is required to enter a LTC/AL facility to provide services, the successful candidate of that position will be subject to the PHO Order regarding mandatory vaccination.

We are presently hiring and looking for a new team member to join our Recreation Therapy team at Deni House in Williams Lake.

A strong candidate will have completed a Certificate from a recognized recreation therapy program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents. This position plans programs and assists in getting residents to/from their programs. Staff go on outings with the residents, facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.), and one-to-one programs.

Deni House embodies a resident-centered philosophy designed to support residents’ choices, help people function at their highest level, and provide the best quality of life possible.

This is a part-time (0.50 FTE) relief vacancy until the incumbent returns. Shifts are Monday through Thursday, with shift times of 09:30 to 14:30.

If you are looking for a challenging career with a great work life balance, this position is for you. Come and join us! Our focus is on giving people room to grow, to make an impact in the lives of others. Apply Today!

We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.

Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor.

Qualifications
  • Grade 12
  • Completion of a recognized recreation course(s)
  • Two year’s recent, related experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license
This posting is for a position at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.
skills: ['Two year’s recent, related experience']

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1692270 Date posted 04/21/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :KELOWNA

Facility :BROOKHAVEN EXTENDED CARE

Status :RELIEF PART TIME (0.60 FTE)

Position Summary

We are presently seeking a new team member to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Brookhaven in West Kelowna, BC. A strong candidate will have completed a course or certificate from a recognized recreation therapy program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents and short stay clients. This position assists in getting residents to/from their programs and carries out established leisure/recreation therapy programs. Staff go on outings with the residents and facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.) including one-to-one programs. The Recreation Therapy Worker also reports relevant observations of resident progress and behavior to the Supervisor/Recreation Therapist and provides suggestions for changes or modifications to the existing programs.

This is a relief part-time (0.60 FTE) position until the return of the incumbent, working Monday through Friday with shift times of 10:00 to 14:00.

Apply today to join a great team!

Qualifications
  • Grade 12, completion of a recognized recreation course(s) plus two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license as required

title: Shelter Worker (French)
description:
Are you looking for a rewarding part-time position? Are you interested in helping others and making a difference? Andrew Fleck Children’s Services is looking for a passionate and enthusiastic individual to work as Shelter Worker. In this role you will provide early learning and child care on site for the children of mothers residing at Francophone women’s shelters in the Ottawa Area. You will promote a positive, nurturing, developmentally appropriate, healthy and safe environment to meet the needs of children.


What Andrew Fleck Children’s Services offers…

✓ Competitive salary

✓ A unique culture that fosters leadership, responsiveness, communication, and teamwork

✓ A place where your opinions will be respected and your contributions valued

✓ A chance to grow – personally and professionally – through our comprehensive orientation program, on the job learning, and in-house and external training

✓ A strong commitment to equity and diversity in the workplace and community


In this role you will…

✓ Provide a welcoming and nurturing environment by displaying affection, acceptance and support of each child

✓ Guide and assist children in planned activities while modelling appropriate behaviours

✓ Develop and implement programming plans with age/stage appropriate activities, games and crafts that interest the children

✓ Demonstrate creativity and innovation in the time spent with the children

✓ Maintain a safe and quality care environment for the children

✓ Monitor the children’s well-being and ensure children in care are well supervised

✓ Prepare and serve snacks & meals and clean up dishes and areas used for that purpose afterwards

✓ Tidy up the areas and materials used for the purpose of care provided during the placement


To qualify for this role, you have…

✓ Experience working with children

✓ Current Standard First Aid and Infant CPR certification

✓ Clear Police Record Check (Vulnerable Sector) completed in the last 6 months

✓ Fluency in French language skills

✓ Sensitivity and respect for individual and cultural differences

✓ Adequate energy level and ability to meet the physical demands of the job

✓ Strong interpersonal skills and understanding of confidentiality

✓ Ability to communicate effectively We are an equal opportunity employer.


We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Should the applicant require any accommodations during the application process please notify Human Resources at hrrecruiting@afchildrensservices.ca

title: Lifeskills Worker (temporary Full Time) (Northern Health)
description:
Are you are looking for friendly, supportive staff, work life balance and affordable living? This may be just the opportunity that will take your career to a new level.

Reporting to the Team Leader, under the direction of the nursing staff and working as a member of the interdisciplinary team, the Lifeskills Worker assists residents with mental, developmental, and/or physical disabilities to live successfully in the community; works with the Mental Health team to implement appropriate psychosocial rehabilitation (PSR) and recovery plans to meet the resident's needs; provides daily physical, emotional, social support/advocacy, personal life skills assistance, teaching and coaching; supports resident participation in daily living activities such as light housekeeping, personal laundry and side-by-side food preparation; provides transportation services to and from events, outings, appointments and programs. The Lifeskills Worker is expected to engage the resident and their support systems as people with full competence as full collaborators in service planning and evaluation.

Shift rotation/hours of work: Monday - Friday, 08:30 to 16:30

Lakes District Hospital is a 12 acute bed hospital that offers emergency services, laboratory, diagnostic imaging, rehabilitation, pharmacy. There is one labour/delivery/recovery suite and 1 palliative care room. There are provision for public health, mental health and addictions, and home and community care service, as well as local physician and emergency services.

Burns Lake has a population of 1,779 (2021) local residents and serves the surrounding areas of the Regional District of Bulkley-Nechako estimating a population of 7,000. Wilderness and some of BC's largest freshwater lakes where sport fishing is a popular activity for both locals and tourists surround Burns Lake. Check out Burns Lake for more information on this family friendly community.

Qualifications
  • Diploma from a recognized Social Services Support Worker educational program, two (2) years' recent, related experience working with individuals with severe and persistent mental illness, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Current CPR Level C and Food Safe certificates.
  • Valid Class V BC Driver's License.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to work independently and in cooperation with others.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to organize and prioritize.
  • Ability to observe and recognize changes in clients.
  • Ability to establish and maintain rapport with clients.
  • Ability to instruct.
  • Ability to analyze and resolve problems.
  • Home management skills.
  • Conflict resolution and crisis intervention skills.
  • Advocacy skills.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation's communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

Value

title: Ouvrier de Terrain de Golf au Club de Golf Hylands
company: Canadian Forces Morale and Welfare Services
description:
QUI NOUS SOMMES

Les Services de bien-être et moral des Forces canadiennes (SBMFC) appuient les membres des Forces armées canadiennes et leurs familles partout où ils se trouvent dans le monde grâce à des programmes de conditionnement physique, des activités de loisirs, du soutien aux familles et aux activités de bienfaisance, des services de vente au détail et des services financiers personnels. Nous offrons à nos employés l’occasion de travailler au quotidien vers un but, dans un milieu inclusif, sain, respectueux et enrichissant.

LE RÔLE

Depuis sa création, Le Club de Golf Hylands est devenu un complexe de golf de qualité supérieure qui offre une gamme complète de services et de commodités à ses 1200 membres et à leurs invités. Véritable joyau parmi les installations de golf des Forces canadiennes, Hylands continue d'accueillir de nombreux événements régionaux, nationaux et internationaux. Dans le cadre des SBMFC, notre mandat est d'offrir du golf abordable à nos militaires locaux et à leurs familles.

Au sein d'une équipe, le ou la titulaire du poste entretiendra le terrain de golf à l'aide d'équipements manuels et électriques et veillera au respect des programmes de santé et de sécurité, en collaboration avec la gestion.

QUALIFICATION REQUISE

Études, certificats et permis

Une combinaison acceptable d’études, de formation et d’expérience sera aussi considérée

Permis de conduire classe G valide (Ontario) ou l’équivalent

Expérience

De l’aménagement paysager ou de l’entretien d’un terrain de golf

De l’utilisation de l’équipement spécialisé d’entretien du gazon

Connaissances

Des pratiques et des techniques d’entretien des terrains

Des pratiques relatives à la santé et la sécurité

Des règlements et des stratégies du golf

Compétences, aptitudes et capacités

Orientation client, connaissance de l’organisation, communication, innovation, travail d’équipe et leadership

EXIGENCE LINGUISTIQUE

Anglais ou Français essentiel / Bilinguisme un atout

Compréhension de l’écrit : Fonctionnel

Expression écrite : Aucune

Interaction orale : Fonctionnel

AVANTAGES OFFERTS

Santé : Assurance en cas de décès ou de mutilation par accident.

Équilibre travail/vie personnelle : Congés payés et non payés, dont une indemnité de congé annuel et des congés personnels et pour obligations familiales payés.

Planification de la retraite : Régime de retraite à prestations déterminées et régimes d’épargne collectifs.

Apprentissage et perfectionnement : Programme d’aide pour frais de scolarité, paiement des cotisations d’associations.

Autres avantages : Rabais offerts par Reconnaissance FC.

AUTRES RENSEIGNEMENTS

Plusieurs postes offerts :
  • Poste à temps partiel saisonnier
  • Duré prévue de l’emploi : avril - novembre
  • Heures de travail : 13-54 heures par période de paie

Toutes les personnes intéressées peuvent postuler ce poste syndiqué. La préférence sera accordée conformément à la convention collective de l’unité de négociation de TUAC local 175 des employés de catégorie I des SBMFC à la GSFC (O-G).

DATE D’ENTRÉE EN FONCTION

Dès que possible

INCLUSION ET MESURES D’ADAPTATION

Les SBMFC ont à cœur d’offrir un environnement inclusif, équitable et accessible, où tous les employés se sentent valorisés, respectés et appuyés. Nous acceptons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées qui peuvent nous aider à constituer un effectif à l’image de la diversité de nos communautés. Des mesures d’adaptation sont offertes à tous ceux et celles qui en font la demande, à n’importe quelle étape du processus de sélection.

Ontario

title: Pipe Plant Workers
description:
Lafarge Canada Inc (Construction) is looking for Pipe Plant Workers to join our team in Calgary. The scope of work will be in our concrete pipe operation. Experience will be considered an asset, but we are happy to train. It's more important to have a hard working, adaptable, and enthusiastic mindset. If you're ready to be a team player, willing to learn, you'll excel working in our Pipe Plant!

 

Wages for these opportunities range from $22 - $25/hour, based on experience and position. Candidates must have own transportation and Driver’s license. Pre-Employment drug test will be administered. Benefits included. Immediate is work available!

 

The skillsets that will be developed working at our Pipe Plant include:

  • Production Machine Operators
  • Forklift Operators
  • Overhead Crane Operators
  • Labourers
  • Carpenters
  • Patchers

 

Experience & Education:

  • Experience will be considered an asset
  • Successful candidates should be hard working, adaptable, and enthusiastic team players, willing and ready to learn and work in all conditions
  • Must be able to follow company safety policy

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

title: Travailleur d’entrepôt
description:
Votre trajet

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche de Préparateurs de commandes pour notre centre de distribution NAPA de Montréal.

Dans Ce Rôle Clé, Vous Serez Responsable De

Nos préparateurs de commandes en entrepôt veillent à ce que chaque pièce soit comptabilisée et apte à être expédiée. Ils sont fiables, bien formés et étonnants dans ce qu’ils font . Si vous recherchez un poste avec un horaire, des tâches et un environnement de travail stables, pensez à vous joindre à nous.
  • La réception et la mise en tablette des marchandises dans l’entrepôt
  • L’organisation de la marchandise de façon efficace et précise
  • La préparation des commandes pour l’expédition et la réception
  • Le respect des mesures de santé et sécurité
Sous le capot

Pour Vous Joindre à Notre Équipe, Vous Devez
  • Avoir de l’expérience ou une connaissance du travail en entrepôt
  • Avoir le souci du détail et une aisance à distinguer des numéros de pièces et des chiffres
  • Être en mesure de travailler dans un environnement où les délais sont restreints.
À propos de la division

La division des Pièces d’auto regroupe les activités de vente, de distribution et de mise en marché de fournitures et pièces de remplacement pour automobiles et camions légers. Nous avons le plus grand réseau pancanadien de distribution de pièces de rechange pour véhicules. Nos bannières dans cette divisions comprennent la marque de renom NAPA Pièces d’autos, ainsi que Altrom-Autocamping, qui se spécialise dans la vente de pièces pour véhicules importés, ainsi que CMAX, spécalisée dans la peinture et les produits de carrosserie. Avec la diversité des rôles dans nos divisions, on peut facilement trouver le rôle qui nous convient!

title: Workshop worker
description:
Our client, woodwork Raymond SP Eciralized in interior finishing products, is present on the residential construction market in Quebec for more than 60 years. We are currently looking for a

workshop worker

Permanent position - Full time Monday to the Friday of Day

Responsibilities
  • Adjust and calibrate machines.
  • Cut different materials such as framing, doors, etc.
  • machine and / or assemble different products such as retractable door frame, doors, etc.
  • exercise control over quality Products processed.
  • Respect the prescribed quality, quantity and deadline standards.
  • Participate in the continuous improvement of production processes.
  • Respect Laws, standards and occupational safety and safety procedures.
  • Maintain clean and secure work areas.
Qualifications And Skills Sought
  • one (1) year of experience in a similar role (an asset)
  • work experience in the field of manufacturing production - an asset
  • know how to use different wood machines (compressed air nailer, saw bench, tab saw, glider, etc.).
  • Wood species knowledge - an asset .
  • Knowledge of imperial and metric measurement units.
  • WHMU - an asset.
Our client is distinguishes with its many benefits. Here are some:
  • group insurance
  • sickness bank
  • workwear allowance
  • closed business when Construction and holiday holidays
  • Vacures Advantageous and in more than a week of holidays for the holiday season
  • Discount used on the purchase of materials
  • service recognition program
  • proximity with the management team
  • well established business (1958) on a human scale etc.
Please send your Curriculum Vitae, Confidentially , to the attention of Jean-François Giroux

t 418 704-7125

Please note That only successful candidates will be contacted.
  • The use of the masculine has the only purpose of lightening the text.

title: Shipper-Receiver-Yard Worker
description:
As the leader in thermoplastic piping systems, the IPEX companies design and manufacture the largest, most recognized and diverse range of integrated piping products – Everything professionals need to manage the full spectrum of today’s municipal, industrial, commercial and residential challenges.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Distribution Center staff’s responsibility is to accurately and quickly service a very demanding client base while maintaining the highest quality and safety standards in the industry. You will get the opportunity to do a little bit of everything! In this role, you will report to the distribution manager and carry out daily tasks at the St-John’s New-Brunswick distribution center.
  • Perform duties within the RF processes in place;
  • Accurately pick, stack, wrap and stage outbound freight; to ensure warehouse goals are met;
  • Cycle Counts;
  • Stock Replenishment;
  • Receiving and locating product using RF technology;
  • Execute work in the prescribed sequence so deliver-by-date is met;
  • Maintain a strict housekeeping standard in accordance with 5S protocols;
  • Work proficiently to meet Productivity, Quality and Safety targets;
  • Apply and comply with HSE guidelines and C-TPAT policies;
  • Report unsafe work conditions/environment in a timely basis. Maintain equipment and report malfunctions;
  • Commit to the success of the team;
  • Any other related tasks requested by the superior.

Requirements
  • Completion of a high-school diploma or relevant experience;
  • Ability to meet daily deadlines and to work in an environment where assignments and work priorities are reviewed several times a day;
  • Must be able to use RF technology;
  • Able to read and write in English;
  • Previous experience working in a warehouse preferred;
  • Previous experience operating forklifts preferred;
  • Ability to stay on your feet for long periods at a time;
  • Ability to work well as a team but be self-motivated and independent at times;
  • Good communication skills and some computer knowledge;
  • Diligent and Punctual;
  • Ability to lift 5 to 50 pounds repeatedly.

Benefits
  • Eligibility for comprehensive health and dental benefits and RRSP- matching program after 3 months of service
  • Annual bonus and incentive programs

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1648864 Date posted 12/17/2021

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :VERNON

Facility :GATEBY IC FACILITY

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

We are seeking additional team members to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Gateby in Vernon, B.C.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker, you will carry out established individual or group leisure/recreation therapy programs such as; arts, socio-cultural events, crafts, sports, music, cooking, gardening, and exercises as directed. You will also set up and organize furnishings and equipment for programs and/or special events, porter’s residents to programs, teaches the techniques of related programs to residents, and oversees the resident’s participation and reports problems/changes to supervisor. When attending resident programs outside of the facility and accompanies resident you will check that the resident has appropriate clothing and necessary funds for the outing, and confirm details of the program with the nursing staff or therapist.

Along With Your Organizational Skills You Will
  • Lead individual one to one sessions, groups, and large special events within the established recreation therapy program, adapts programs to meet the physical, social, cognitive, spiritual, emotional needs of the residents, completes resident attendance list on a daily basis, and submits to designated supervisor for care conferencing reports and program evaluation.
  • Assist with promotion and publicizing of programs and or special events, and is responsible for decorating home for seasonal changes.
  • Assist volunteers and/or students by providing functional direction during programs (1:1, small group, large group or special events).
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.
Shifts are Monday – Friday with shift times of 08:00 to 16:00, and 08:00 to 15:54.

This is a Casual opportunity. Casual means there are no guaranteed hours and work requirements can vary from 0 - 37.5 hours per week. Casual employment includes: short-notice, on-call availability; workload coverage during a temporary absences; and/or providing relief coverage in a specific position.

If you are looking for a challenging career with a great work life balance, this position is for you. Apply Today!

We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.

Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor.

Qualifications
  • Grade 12
  • Completion of a recognized recreation course(s).
  • Two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license is required.
  • Along with your resume please provide copies of your completed recreation courses and class 4 DL
This posting is for casual work at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1642306 Date posted 04/19/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :NELSON

Facility :NELSON JUBILEE MANOR

Status :RELIEF PART TIME (0.62 FTE)

Position Summary

We are presently hiring and looking for new team members to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Nelson Jubilee Manor!

Nelson Jubilee Manor embodies a resident-centered philosophy designed to support residents’ choices, help people function at their highest level, and provide the best quality of life possible.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents and short stay clients. This position plans programs and assists in getting residents to/from their programs. Staff go on outings with the residents, facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.), and one-to-one programs. A strong candidate will have completed a Certificate from a recognized recreation program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License (or in the process of being licensed).

This is a RELIEF PART TIME opportunity. Type of shifts includes days. Shift time are wither 08:00 to 16:00 or 10:00 to 18:00.

Interior Health strives to create an environment where you enjoy the work you do, the place where you work, and the people around you. Everyone plays a role in the care continuum. Together, we create great workplaces!

Qualifications

Education, Training and Experience
  • Grade 12
  • Completion of a recognized recreation course(s)
  • Two year’s recent, related experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license
  • Certificates in Food Safe/ Serve It Right and First Aid

title: Manager on Duty (Front Desk)
description:
We are seeking a dynamic Manager on Duty to join our busy team. Our Managers understand the meaning of true Customer Service; they are professional, team-oriented, possess good work ethics and are extremely results driven.

Join our team and enjoy the many benefits of working for Canada's fastest-growing, privately-owned hospitality company, including a competitive employee compensation package, diverse employee schedules, and internal corporate career advancement. If you are looking for a future career in hospitality, then the Sandman Hotel Group is for you.

Job Requirements
  • The ability to direct and control the activities of the Front Office, Reservations, Guest Activities, and to ensure adherence to the Sandman Hotel Group standards, policies and procedures in conjunction with the Front Office Manager.
  • Must ensure that all personnel are kept well informed of department objectives and policies. The ability to prepare all necessary forecasts; to work closely with Reservations, Front Office and Sales to maximize occupancy, rate and revenue.
  • The ability to develop relationships with clients, return guests, group contacts etc. to provide maximum personalized guest service.
  • The ability to support Sandman Hotel Group philosophy towards employee development, morale and institute programs to ensure the effectiveness and promotion of the philosophy in within the Rooms Division.
  • The ability to respond properly and take a supervisory role in any hotel emergency or safety situation.
  • Manage all administrational duties as specified by the Company
Duties
  • Responsible for checking guests in and out of the Hotel.
  • Issues room keys, pamphlets, discount cards, etc.
  • Answers various questions from guests and arranges transportation for guests.
  • Computes bills, collects payment and makes change for guests.
  • Runs various reports on the computer for management.
  • Count and verify cash, shift activity, keys, gift certificates, and wireless internet cards with departing shift.
  • Print updated in-house, arrival, departure, and room status reports every two hours
  • Check all unresolved departures.
  • Ensure front desk is stocked with any items guests may require before housekeeping leaves for the day.
  • Complete welcome calls.
  • Clean and tidy front desk area.
  • Respond to telephone, e-mail, and in-person inquiries from clients, business partners, and other parties.
  • Refer all inquiries to the appropriate individuals, divisions, or departments across the organization.
  • As a front-line worker, present a positive and professional image of the organization to all visitors, suppliers, inquiries, and other interactions.
  • Provide information to staff and/or clients about special activities.
Applicable Skills
  • Have previous hotel experience, specifically in the Rooms Division Department. Demonstrate supervisor skills; good judgment and common sense.
  • Computer literate with knowledge of a variety of computer software applications, including the Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Superior written and oral communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to set priorities for self and others.
Extended Medical, Dental, Health Care (STANDARD HOTEL PACKAGE)*
  • For Full Time Employment Only
Summation

Submission of resume does not guarantee an interview or an actual transfer. Qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, provided they meet the minimal requirements of the applicable skills required.

You must be legally entitled to work in Canada to apply as the employer does not have a Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) that would support a foreign worker.
  • Applications will not be accepted via email or in person.
**We thank all applicants for their interest in Career opportunities with The Sandman Hotel Group, however, only those applicants we wish to interview will receive a reply to their application.**

**ABSOLUTELY NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE**

title: Housing Management Worker (Calderdale) - Fusion Housing
description:
Kirklees Council are advertising this role on behalf of Fusion Housing.

Fusion Housing provides housing advice, housing related support services, learning & employment opportunities to people in Kirklees, along with managed tenancy services in Kirklees, Calderdale and Wakefield.

Fusion Housing manages a number of properties in Calderdale for single people and families who are either homeless or at risk of homelessness. We are looking for someone with experience in housing management services, or Housing Officers, to work as part of a team and take on responsibility for a group of these properties.

The Successful Candidates Will Have
  • At least 2 years' experience of working with vulnerable people
  • An understanding of the effects that homelessness has on households
  • Good team working skills
  • The ability to work on own initiative
Benefits Include
  • Generous holiday entitlement (32 days plus bank holidays)
  • Employer's pension contribution is 5% of salary
How To Apply

Please complete our online application form via the Fusion Website .

Or submit CV & supporting statement via email to HR@fusionhousing.org.uk

 NB: CVs will only be accepted if they are accompanied by a supporting statement explaining why you are applying for the post and details of how you meet the requirements listed in the employee specification.

Job description and employee specification, along with guidance notes for applicants are available to download from the Our Website .

The closing date is 9am Monday 9th May 2022.

Interviews will be held week commencing 16th May 2022.

Fusion Housing has a commitment to safeguarding children and adults at risk and will ensure that all its policies reflect this. This recruitment is taking place under our Equality, Diversity and Inclusion Policy and Procedures.

An enhanced DBS check will be required.

title: Casual Caretakers
description:
Support Staff

Location: David Thompson High School

Competition #: 12463

Open To: All

Date Posted: September 17th, 2020

Closing Date: Open Ended

Additional Information

Wild Rose School Division

Requires

Casual Caretakers

For all Locations

Applications are invited for Casual Caretakers for schools and facilities in the Division (Caroline, Condor, Leslieville, Breton, Drayton Valley and Rocky Mountain House).

Casual Caretakers are covered by the International Union of Operating Engineers (IUOE) Agreement. The duties include but are not limited to general custodial duties, site maintenance and snow removal. This is an “on-call” position with no guarantee of hours. The shifts vary but are 8 hours maximum per day / 40 hours maximum per week.

The current Casual Caretaker rate of pay is $19.52 per hour. The payment schedule is bi-weekly and is direct deposit.

W.H.M.I.S. certification is a requirement.

Your Complete Application Package Will Include
  • Cover letter or email indicating preferred locations/schools
  • Resume
  • Three references with contact information
  • Copies of W.H.M.I.S certificate and any other relevant training certificates
  • Current criminal record check (R.C.M.P. detachment)
  • Current intervention record check (Provincial Building, Family Services)
  • Other documents will be required if offered a position
Please forward your complete application package to: humanresources@wrsd.ca

All applications will be given consideration, however only those interviewed will be contacted.

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1579234 Date posted 07/14/2021

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :GRAND FORKS

Facility :HARDY VIEW LODGE

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

We are presently seeking a new casual team member to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Hardy View Lodge in Grand Forks, B.C.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents and short stay clients. This position plans programs and assists in getting residents to/from their programs. Staff go on outings with the residents, facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.), and one-to-one programs.

Hardy View Lodge, located in Grand Forks at Boundary Hospital, embodies a resident-centered philosophy designed to support residents’ choices, help people function at their highest level, and provide the best quality of life possible.

This facility is an 80 bed facility with five cottage style units. 60 beds are all individual with showers in the bathroom area. The 20 bed unit has two semi private rooms and the remaining 16 rooms are private.

Casual employment includes: short-notice, on-call availability; workload coverage during a temporary absences; and/or providing relief coverage in a specific position.

Hours of work: Rotating Days 8:30 to 17:00, 0:900 to 17:00

A strong candidate will have completed a Certificate from a recognized recreation program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License (or in the process of being licensed). There are many opportunities with Interior Health that begin with casual on-call positions and lead to regular employment

Interior Health strives to create an environment where you enjoy the work you do, the place where you work, and the people around you. Come and join our team….Come live, work and play where others only vacation. Make a difference. Love your work. Apply today!

Qualifications

Grade 12, completion of a recognized recreation course(s) plus two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Valid class 4 vehicle license as required.

Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.

title: Environmental Services Worker - Housekeeper
description:
As a Best Managed Company, we are honoured to be named one of London’s Best Places to Work. Sifton Properties Limited is a family owned and operated organization that has been in business for over 95 years. We have a family-based culture where we trust, understand, support and care about each other. As team members, we grow through collaboration, innovation, and open communication. At Sifton, we build outstanding communities where people live, work and play, and we live our values to the fullest.
  • The Environmental Services Worker in Housekeeping will provide a clean environment in resident suites and common spaces within the Residence.
  • Adheres to company policies, procedures, practices and philosophies. Works in accordance with all industry and regulatory compliance agencies, the Ontario Retirement Communities Association, The Retirement Homes Act 2010 and O. Reg 166/1, the Occupational Health and Safety Act, the Ontario Fire Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and other pertinent legislated regulations/ standards.
  • Maintains confidentiality with respect to resident and operational Residence matters, exercises courtesy, good judgment and concern for the safety and wellbeing of residents and visitors. This includes adherence to the Social Media Policy.
  • Grade 12 or equivalent. Must be able to read and write and follow oral instructions.
  • The ability to understand and perform duties effectively, communicate any pertinent issues regarding residents and their care and work accurately and quickly.
  • Self-directed and team-oriented, with proficient organizational and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Must be committed to multi-disciplinary team work and demonstrate an ability to work through collaboration, joint decision making and integrated strategies.
  • Must successfully complete a Police Records Check and disclose any convictions, charges, restraining orders, probation orders and/or warrants during the course of employment that affect in any way the clear Police Records Check.
  • Must provide a Tuberculosis Skin Test (TST) document or Medical Note from Physician stating free from infectious disease.
  • Previous housekeeping experience desirable but not mandatory.
  • Experience in laundry operation is desirable but not mandatory. Must understand the basis of good laundry techniques/practices.
  • We’ll set you up for success by providing in-depth training with your team and mentors, working in partnership with our leadership team.
  • You’ll enjoy special events, celebrations, and unique perks, specific to your role and work environment, that reinforce our commitment to creating a wonderful employee experience.
  • Our unique rewards and recognition programs are designed to celebrate you, your contributions and promote your success.
  • Our Employee Assistance Program is available for your everyday needs.
We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.

Sifton Properties would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted.

title: Customer Service Co-Worker
description:
WHO YOU ARE
• You have at least 6 months of customer service work experience in retail, distribution, or similar environment
• Your coordination skills are top notch – you can brush your teeth, iron your clothes, feed the dog, make a cup of coffee, and just get things done in a beautiful, quick, effortless sequence (or something like that!)
• You have an amazing attention for detail and can effortlessly juggle multiple priorities while keeping a smile on your face
• You are a total people-person and can strike up a conversation easily
• Organization is your middle name… (or it should be because you are all for it!)
• You are very comfortable with computers and are generally technology-savvy
• You are totally cool with working in a physically demanding, fast-paced, environment (where you may have to lift heavy items that weigh up to 50 lbs. at any given time)

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES
• Be an IKEA Ambassador by recognizing that the customer experience depends on your core ability to prepare and deliver the right products to the right customer quickly and efficiently
• Pick and stage deliveries for customer pick-up, ensuring order accuracy
• Be aware of daily and weekly service delivery targets
• Assemble furniture when required to determine quality/usage issues
• Maintain stock accuracy and inventory integrity
• Stay knowledgeable on IKEA products, in-store and online specials, as well as all applicable internal policies and standards
• Assist your team members with additional duties, as required

TOGETHER AS A TEAM
At IKEA it’s all about our customers, and in Customer Relations we build and retain long-lasting relationships with new and existing customers in a multichannel retail environment. We’re a diverse team that work together to ensure a positive and joyful experience for all IKEA visitors and customers: we set up services, gather feedback and make things right! Our modus operandi is to connect to people by listening to their personal needs and to create genuine interactions. We’re a bunch of people who are truly passionate about people!




JUST SO YOU KNOW
In the IKEA world, this position is officially referred to as: Home Delivery Co-worker

Part-time: 12-20 hours per week (Including Weekends).

Address: 1475 The Queensway, Etobicoke, Ontario M8Z 1T3

Internal candidate application deadline: April 18, 2022

Please note: This position requires the submission of a satisfactory criminal record check. A record under the Criminal Code and/or other federal offence record(s) does not automatically mean you will be ineligible for the position.

title: Ouvrier de Terrain de Golf au Club de Golf Hylands
company: Canadian Forces Morale and Welfare Services
description:
QUI NOUS SOMMES

Les Services de bien-être et moral des Forces canadiennes (SBMFC) appuient les membres des Forces armées canadiennes et leurs familles partout où ils se trouvent dans le monde grâce à des programmes de conditionnement physique, des activités de loisirs, du soutien aux familles et aux activités de bienfaisance, des services de vente au détail et des services financiers personnels. Nous offrons à nos employés l’occasion de travailler au quotidien vers un but, dans un milieu inclusif, sain, respectueux et enrichissant.

LE RÔLE

Depuis sa création, Le Club de Golf Hylands est devenu un complexe de golf de qualité supérieure qui offre une gamme complète de services et de commodités à ses 1200 membres et à leurs invités. Véritable joyau parmi les installations de golf des Forces canadiennes, Hylands continue d'accueillir de nombreux événements régionaux, nationaux et internationaux. Dans le cadre des SBMFC, notre mandat est d'offrir du golf abordable à nos militaires locaux et à leurs familles.

Au sein d'une équipe, le ou la titulaire du poste entretiendra le terrain de golf à l'aide d'équipements manuels et électriques et veillera au respect des programmes de santé et de sécurité, en collaboration avec la gestion.

QUALIFICATION REQUISE

Études, certificats et permis

Une combinaison acceptable d’études, de formation et d’expérience sera aussi considérée

Permis de conduire classe G valide (Ontario) ou l’équivalent

Expérience

De l’aménagement paysager ou de l’entretien d’un terrain de golf

De l’utilisation de l’équipement spécialisé d’entretien du gazon

Connaissances

Des pratiques et des techniques d’entretien des terrains

Des pratiques relatives à la santé et la sécurité

Des règlements et des stratégies du golf

Compétences, aptitudes et capacités

Orientation client, connaissance de l’organisation, communication, innovation, travail d’équipe et leadership

EXIGENCE LINGUISTIQUE

Anglais ou Français essentiel / Bilinguisme un atout

Compréhension de l’écrit : Fonctionnel

Expression écrite : Aucune

Interaction orale : Fonctionnel

AVANTAGES OFFERTS

Santé : Remboursement des médicaments sur ordonnance, assurance voyage, régimes de soins dentaires et de la vue, assurance vie, assurance invalidité de longue durée et assurance en cas de décès ou de mutilation par accident.

Équilibre travail/vie personnelle : Vaste gamme de congés payés et non payés, dont des congés annuels, personnels et pour obligations familiales payés.

Planification de la retraite : Régime de retraite à prestations déterminées et régimes d’épargne collectifs.

Apprentissage et perfectionnement : Programme d’aide pour frais de scolarité et programme d’apprentissage avancé, paiement des cotisations d’associations professionnelles, cours en ligne et formation linguistique.

Autres avantages : Rabais offerts par Reconnaissance FC.

AUTRES RENSEIGNEMENTS

Plusieurs postes offerts :
  • Poste à temps plein saisonnier
  • Duré prévue de l’emploi : avril - novembre
  • Heures de travail : 75 - 80 heures par période de paie

Toutes les personnes intéressées peuvent postuler ce poste syndiqué. La préférence sera accordée conformément à la convention collective de l’unité de négociation de TUAC local 175 des employés de catégorie I des SBMFC à la GSFC (O-G).

DATE D’ENTRÉE EN FONCTION

Dès que possible

INCLUSION ET MESURES D’ADAPTATION

Les SBMFC ont à cœur d’offrir un environnement inclusif, équitable et accessible, où tous les employés se sentent valorisés, respectés et appuyés. Nous acceptons les candidatures de toutes les personnes qualifiées qui peuvent nous aider à constituer un effectif à l’image de la diversité de nos communautés. Des mesures d’adaptation sont offertes à tous ceux et celles qui en font la demande, à n’importe quelle étape du processus de sélection.

Ontario

title: LAUNDRY WORKER I (CASUAL)
description:
Are you looking for friendly, supportive staff, work life balance and affordable living this may be just the opportunity that will take your career to a new level.

In accordance with established vision and values of the organization and under the supervision of the Laundry Supervisor, positions at this level perform a variety of laundry duties such as sorting, folding and weighing linen, and operating domestic washers and dryer. These duties are conducted within the scope of Regional Northern Health (NH) Laundry Policies and Processes.

Bulkley Valley District Hospital is a 19-bed acute care hospital which integrates home and community care into one facility. Services include emergency/outpatient, medical/surgical, maternity, palliative care, laboratory, radiology, pediatrics, home & community care and community cancer clinic. The medical staff in Smithers consists of family physicians, anesthetists, a pediatrician, visiting surgeons and other specialists.

Smithers has a population of 5,401 (2021) local residents and is located in the picturesque Bulkley Valley surrounded by three mountain ranges that provide a backdrop for the towns’ Alpine setting. Check out Smithers where there is always something new to experience.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.
  • Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service
  • Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions
  • Employee referral program
  • Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC
  • “Loan Forgiveness Programs” offered through the Federal and BC Government
  • Grade 10 for an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Ability to organize work.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation’s communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

title: LAUNDRY WORKER III (CASUAL)
description:
If you are looking for friendly, supportive staff, work life balance and affordable living this may be just the opportunity that will take your career to a new level.

In accordance with established vision and values of the organization and working within the scope of Regional Northern Health Policies and Processes, the Laundry Worker III operates non-domestic laundry equipment such as washers/tunnel washers, extractors, dryers, etc. and provides supervision to designated Laundry Workers by performing duties such as scheduling and coordinating work assignments, and determining related training and orientation requirements.

Kitimat General Hospital is a 19 acute bed hospital with a full range of services. Some services provided are emergency, laboratory, diagnostic imaging, outpatient chemotherapy clinic, physiotherapy, diabetes and chronic disease management. Regular rotation of visiting specialists in internal medicine, urology, otorhinolaryngology (ENT), dermatology, neurology, ophthalmology, and radiology.

Kitimat has a population of 8,131 (2020) local residents. Kitimat offers excellent fishing, endless trails, and backcountry. People come to Kitimat to enjoy more of the things you love. Check out Kitimat where there is always something new to experience.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.

Skills And Abilities

  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.

  • Some knowledge of washing ingredients.
Who We Are

title: Facilities Custodian / Janitor
location: Sun Peaks Mountain, British Columbia, Canada
description:
Work, Live and Play
  • Full access Summer Alpine Hike and Downhill Bike season pass
  • Employee access Golf Membership and discounted Golf Cart season pass
  • Employee Health and Wellness Program including EFAP services
  • Companywide discounts and benefit programs
  • Eligibility to participate in our Peak Performer Recognition Program, awarded at the end of our summer season at a special planned event
  • Reciprocal riding at other participating BC and Alberta bike parks
Role Overview

The Facility Custodians are an integral part of our overall resort operation. This team works daily, behind the scenes, to ensure our public and administrative areas are clean and welcoming for our guests/employees. While this position is highly operational, the variety of work locations and tasks from working on this team, in a ski resort setting, will open up opportunities of advancement internally and externally throughout the Ski Resort/Tourism industry.

Job Skills Required
  • Reliable and responsible person with team-based ethics
  • Knowledge of standard cleaning methods and procedures is an asset but not required
  • Physically able to stand, walk, crouch, bend, lift and be in motion for the majority of the shift and the ability to safely lift 50 lbs/23 kg, climb ladders and work at heights
  • Experience with using cleaning equipment, including vacuum cleaners, floor buffers, and cleaning solutions is an asset
  • Knowledge and experience in safely handling, mixing, and using cleaning chemicals
  • Ability to communicate effectively with departmental team members and leadership
  • Holds a valid WHIMIS Certification is an asset
  • Has interest in working towards a career in the Ski Resort/Tourism industry
Role Responsibilities
  • Executes daily cleaning of all SPRLLP buildings (public and administrative) and ensures they are in orderly condition, including but not limited to: sweeping, mopping, vacuuming, window washing, and sanitizing
  • Performs routine maintenance activities in accordance with the preventative maintenance schedule and any immediate maintenance requirements
  • Ensures the perimeter of all SPRLLP buildings is clean and orderly
  • Performs routine deep cleaning duties in accordance with the schedule
  • Removes daily refuse, ensuring proper disposal in accordance with SPG standards
  • Safely restocks/handles cleaning solutions and chemicals in preparation for cleaning and keeps the supervisor aware of inventory levels
  • Follows procedures for the use of chemical cleaners and power machinery to prevent damage to floors and fixtures
  • Drives SPRLLP vehicles required to perform or travel to cleaning locations within resort bounds, including industrial trucks, vans, or industrial vacuum cleaners
  • Notifies managers of any needed repairs or additions to building operating systems

title: Casual Caretakers
description:
Support Staff

Location: Rocky Mountain House

Competition #: 12467

Open To: All

Date Posted: September 17th, 2020

Closing Date: Open Ended

Additional Information

Wild Rose School Division

Requires

Casual Caretakers

For all Locations

Applications are invited for Casual Caretakers for schools and facilities in the Division (Caroline, Condor, Leslieville, Breton, Drayton Valley and Rocky Mountain House).

Casual Caretakers are covered by the International Union of Operating Engineers (IUOE) Agreement. The duties include but are not limited to general custodial duties, site maintenance and snow removal. This is an “on-call” position with no guarantee of hours. The shifts vary but are 8 hours maximum per day / 40 hours maximum per week.

The current Casual Caretaker rate of pay is $19.52 per hour. The payment schedule is bi-weekly and is direct deposit.

W.H.M.I.S. certification is a requirement.

Your Complete Application Package Will Include
  • Cover letter or email indicating preferred locations/schools
  • Resume
  • Three references with contact information
  • Copies of W.H.M.I.S certificate and any other relevant training certificates
  • Current criminal record check (R.C.M.P. detachment)
  • Current intervention record check (Provincial Building, Family Services)
  • Other documents will be required if offered a position
Please forward your complete application package to: humanresources@wrsd.ca

All applications will be given consideration, however only those interviewed will be contacted.
