title: Laundry Worker 2 - Rural Bella Bella
description:
Job Title Laundry Worker 2Work Site Laundry and Linen, R.W. Large Memorial Hospital - Bella Bella, BCStatus CasualStart Date As soon as possibleSalary $21.77 per hourHours VariousReference# 162596-jma

Come work as a Laundry Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Laundry Worker to join the Laundry and Linen team at R.W. Large Memorial Hospital in Bella Bella, BC. Apply today to join our team!

As a Laundry Worker you will operate domestic and non-domestic washers and dryers and perform laundry duties such as sorting, folding and weighing linens.

About Bella Bella, Bc

Bella Bella is a beautiful island community off the central coast of British Columbia, 690 km north of Vancouver. It is surrounded by a magical world of channels, inlets and old growth forest. It is home to salmon, orcas, humpbacks, bald eagles and the other denizens of the Pacific Northwest. The climate is mild and the area is a paradise for kayaking, sport fishing, hiking and photography.

The R.W. Large Memorial Hospital in Bella Bella has 7 acute beds, 7 long term care beds and a 4-bed emergency department open 24/7, along with Laboratory and Diagnostic Imaging services. It offers telehealth services as well as speciality clinics. R.W. Large Memorial Hospital also has an Intensive Case Management team for mental health and substance use. There is a medical clinic and a pharmacy located in the hospital. The healthcare team consists of Physicians, RNs, LPNs, PCAs, Laboratory and Radiology Technologists, Combined Lab/X-Ray Technologists, Pharmacist, Pharmacy Assistants, and Support Services Personnel.

R.W. Large Memorial Hospital is located on the traditional territories of the Heiltsuk Nation. It is one of the only provincial hospitals located on a reserve in all of Canada.

For more information, please refer to this link https//www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/aboriginal-peoples/information-indians.html#hdng2

Qualifications

Education & Experience
  • Grade 10 plus recent related experience in a commercial or industrial laundry or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Recreation Therapy Worker – Adult Day Program
description:
Job ID 1695544 Date posted 04/13/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER – ADULT DAY PROGRAM

Community :VERNON

Facility :GATEBY IC FACILITY

Status :PERMANENT FULL TIME

Position Summary

We are seeking an additional team member to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Gateby in Vernon, B.C.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker, you will carry out established individual or group leisure/recreation therapy programs such as; arts, socio-cultural events, crafts, sports, music, cooking, gardening, and exercises as directed. You will also set up and organize furnishings and equipment for programs and/or special events, porter’s residents to programs, teaches the techniques of related programs to residents, and oversees the resident’s participation and reports problems/changes to supervisor. When attending resident programs outside of the facility and accompanies resident you will check that the resident has appropriate clothing and necessary funds for the outing, and confirm details of the program with the nursing staff or therapist.

Along With Your Organizational Skills You Will
  • Lead individual one to one sessions, groups, and large special events within the established recreation therapy program, adapts programs to meet the physical, social, cognitive, spiritual, emotional needs of the residents, completes resident attendance list on a daily basis, and submits to designated supervisor for care conferencing reports and program evaluation.
  • Assist with promotion and publicizing of programs and or special events, and is responsible for decorating home for seasonal changes.
  • Assist volunteers and/or students by providing functional direction during programs (1:1, small group, large group or special events).
  • Perform other related duties as assigned.
This is a permanent full-time position working Monday to Friday with shift times of 08:00 to 16:00.

If you are looking for a challenging career with a great work life balance, this position is for you. Apply Today!

We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.

Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor.

Qualifications
  • Grade 12
  • Completion of a recognized recreation course(s).
  • Two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license as required.
  • Along with your resume please provide copies of your completed recreation courses
This posting is for casual work at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: Permanent part-time (38% - 3 hrs per day) Caretaker - Lumsden Elementary
description:
Job Purpose: The caretaker is responsible for providing a safe, clean and healthy environment for students, staff and the public and overseeing day to day building operations, working as part of both the school-specific and Division-wide Facilities teams.

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities
  • Knowledge and ability to safely monitor and reset a boiler and associated+ HVAC system.
  • Ability to safely operate floor cleaning, stripping and waxing equipment and outdoor equipment such as snow blowers and lawnmowers.
  • Ability to perform basic building maintenance and repair functions.
  • Ability to manage confidential material and maintain staff and student privacy.
Education & Qualifications
  • Grade 12 diploma or equivalent.
  • WHMIS training is an asset.
  • Fireman’s Certificate is an asset.
  • A minimum of three (3) years caretaking experience.
Working Conditions
  • As per Conditions of Employment (non-union)
  • Monday to Friday, 3 hours per day; exact scheduling to be determined, 12 months per year
  • Commencing September 1, 2022
  • Salary Range: $20.96 - $24.51
  • Ability to perform physical labour, including lifting heavy objects, moving furniture
For the full job description, please click here. For further details of the position, please contact Kristine Klovansky, Caretaking Manager, at 306-949-3366 or by email kristine.klovansky@pvsd.ca.

Application Procedure
  • Interested applicants should submit their application online at www.pvsd.ca/careers by midnight on Thursday, May 12, 2022.
Selection Procedure: Only applicants selected for an interview will be contacted by email.

Prairie Valley School Division supports the principles of a representative work force and welcomes applications from all qualified candidates.

title: Custodial Services Worker (Hotel Porter) - Yosemite - Ahwahnee Hotel
description:
Position Summary: The Custodial Services Worker cleans and maintains assigned area(s) to meet customer and client satisfaction Essential functions and responsibilities of the position may vary by Aramark location based on client requirements and business needs.

Essential Functions
  • Adheres to established procedures to provide a safe working environment including complying with OSHA, state/local, federal, and Aramark regulations
  • Maintains a clean and orderly environment to project the safety and health of others
  • Properly cleans and maintains housekeeping equipment
  • Cleans assigned areas to Aramark and client standards and requirements
  • Follows procedures for storage and disposal of trash and transports it to designated areas
  • Reports maintenance concerns via work order requests to appropriate personnel
  • Secures the facility, ensuring building is locked/unlocked as required
  • Ensures security of company assets
  • Other duties and tasks as assigned by manager
This location requires all new hires who live in company housing to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of 02/24/2022

title: Moulding Worker - Night
description:
Are you looking for an opportunity to work in fast paced environment with a growing team?

If Yes, We have got you covered.

Randstad Canada is hiring Full Time Production Workers in the Moulding Department for Polycon Industries in Guelph, Ontario.

As a member of the team your duties will include working in close coordination with other co- members. The general duties will include operating moulding press, inspecting parts, trimming and correcting defects in the parts as needed. In addition to this, as a production worker you will be responsible for other duties such as lifting between 15 to 20 lbs and active moving around.

As a production worker you will have the chance of working with various departments to gain on hand experience in the industrial business sector.

Shifts Available: Nights

Location: Guelph, Ontario.

If this sounds like the right opportunity, please apply online at randstad.ca.

If you have any questions, please reach out to romil.monga@randstad.ca or alternatively call/text at 519 - 831- 1499

Advantages
  • Pay Rate $ 18.75
  • Easily accessible by car and Guelph Transit.
  • Potential for permanent hire after 3 months probation.
  • Referral bonus $150 per person referred (unlimited, starts Day 1)
  • You will be paid for your lunch and breaks.
  • Straight shifts to provide work- life balance.
  • You can bank 4% vacation pay on each check OR have it paid out.

Responsibilities
  • Operating Moulding Press and Inspecting products for damages
  • Lifting between 15 - 20lbs
  • Material Handling and assembling parts.
  • Trimming and Correcting defects in the parts
  • Stacking and Lifting trays

Qualifications
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada.
  • CSA Approved Work Boots or Shoes.
  • Excellent Team player and solution oriented.
  • Comfortable using hand tools frequently.

Summary

We are looking for active individuals who would love to learn and grow with the company.

If you have any questions, please reach out to romil.monga@randstad.ca or alternatively call/text at 519 - 831- 1499

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Ouvrier d’atelier – jour ou soir
description:
Poste : ouvrier d'atelier

Lieu de travail : Montréal

Salaire : à partir de 18,50 $ l'heure

Quart de travail : jour ou soir

Nous recherchons plusieurs ouvriers d'atelier pour venir aider à la production de portes et moulures. Vous avez une première expérience en fabrication, usinage ou êtes très bricoleur? Nous avons un poste pour vous!

Avantages
  • Horaire de jour ou de soir – à vous de choisir
  • Salaire à partir de 18,50 $ l'heure + prime de soir
  • Poste à temps plein à 40 heures par semaine
  • Embauche rapide
  • Poste stable

Votre Mission En Tant Qu'ouvrier D'atelier
  • Lire des plans
  • Prendre des mesures
  • Découper des pièces à l'aide de scies
  • Faire l’assemblage en équipe des composants de bois
  • S’assurer de la bonne qualité de son travail afin de respecter les critères de qualité
  • Trier les matériaux nécessaires à la fabrication
  • Respecter les règles de santé et de sécurité au travail

Exigences
  • Aimer travailler le bois (un atout)
  • Aimer le travail manuel, être habile avec les outils
  • Avoir de bonnes aptitudes en lecture de plan
  • Posséder de l'autonomie, de la débrouillardise, faire preuve d'initiative
  • Connaitre son galon à mesurer en pouces

Le poste vous intéresse ? Contactez Blandine Martin au 514 985-6004 ou par courriel à blandine.martin@quantum.ca .

RECOMMANDEZ ET GAGNEZ UNE CARTE-CADEAU DE 50 $ ! Pour plus d’informations, cliquez ici .

NOS PORTES VIRTUELLES SONT OUVERTES! En plus, vous passerez les entrevues à domicile grâce à différentes applications Web! Alors, contactez-nous dès aujourd’hui pour relever votre prochain défi professionnel.

title: Night Custodian - Swiss Chalet
description:
Swiss Chalet is looking for a Night Custodian for our Grimsby location!

At Swiss Chalet we deliver delicious “home-made” food, made fresh in-house just for you. Our atmosphere is warm, welcoming and feels like home.

At Swiss Chalet, we work as a team and help each other succeed. Our Managers are hands-on and our team works together to deliver the Perfect Guest Experience to our guests each and every time. We genuinely care about each Guest and every Associate.

We are looking for individuals that are passionate about Food, Hospitality, and are Guest focused as well as being a strong and motivating team player.

Responsibilities
  • Keep stockroom area organized, tidy and clean
  • Complete cleaning jobs outlined by management teams
  • Keep garbage containers emptied and cleaned
  • Adhere to all Health & Safety policies and procedures
  • Assist all team members whenever needed
Qualifications
  • Responsible and reliable
  • Ability to multi-task and maintain high energy in a fast-paced environment
  • Takes pride in doing a job well done
  • Follows standards and procedures
  • Willing to help and support the team
  • Reliable and punctual
  • Able to work a flexible schedule (i.e. days, nights, weekends)
PERKS! Why should you work for us?
  • 20% employee discount dining card valid at all Recipe brands
  • Flexible scheduling
  • Competitive wages
  • Growth and advancement opportunities within the restaurant
  • Career advancement opportunities in a company that has more than 1,400 restaurants across Canada
At Swiss Chalet "Every Guest Leaves Happy "!

If you want to be part of a great team and have an exciting career then apply online today!

Some opportunities may exist with our Franchise partners which are independently owned and operated.

Recipe is committed to providing a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace. Celebrating people, being passionate and curious, owning it, and doing the right thing are the values that guide how we build our teams, support our franchisees and create a company that unlocks the full potential of everyone.

Recipe is dedicated to providing accommodations in accordance with applicable human rights and accommodation legislation. For individuals that require accommodations please contact recruit@recipeunlimited.com.

title: Casual Caretakers
description:
Support Staff

Location: Breton & Drayton Valley

Competition #: 10400

Open To: All

Date Posted: September 17th, 2020

Closing Date: Open Ended

Additional Information

Wild Rose School Division

Requires

Casual Caretakers

For all Locations

Applications are invited for Casual Caretakers for schools and facilities in the Division (Caroline, Condor, Leslieville, Breton, Drayton Valley and Rocky Mountain House).

Casual Caretakers are covered by the International Union of Operating Engineers (IUOE) Agreement. The duties include but are not limited to general custodial duties, site maintenance and snow removal. This is an “on-call” position with no guarantee of hours. The shifts vary but are 8 hours maximum per day / 40 hours maximum per week.

The current Casual Caretaker rate of pay is $19.52 per hour. The payment schedule is bi-weekly and is direct deposit.

W.H.M.I.S. certification is a requirement.

Your Complete Application Package Will Include
  • Cover letter or email indicating preferred locations/schools
  • Resume
  • Three references with contact information
  • Copies of W.H.M.I.S certificate and any other relevant training certificates
  • Current criminal record check (R.C.M.P. detachment)
  • Current intervention record check (Provincial Building, Family Services)
  • Other documents will be required if offered a position
Please forward your complete application package to: humanresources@wrsd.ca

All applications will be given consideration, however only those interviewed will be contacted.

title: Recreation Therapy Worker
description:
Job ID 1696710 Date posted 04/05/2022

Job title :RECREATION THERAPY WORKER

Community :KAMLOOPS

Facility :OVERLANDER EXTENDED CARE

Status :CASUAL

Position Summary

We are presently seeking new team members to join our Recreation Therapy Department at Overlander Extended Care in Kamloops, BC. A strong candidate will have completed a course or certificate from a recognized recreation therapy program and hold a Class IV BC Driver’s License.

Working within a client centered model, the Recreation Therapy Worker works as a member of the interdisciplinary team and is responsible for the implementation and evaluation of an established Recreation Therapy Program.

As the Recreation Therapy Worker you will be primarily working with geriatric residents and short stay clients. This position assists in getting residents to/from their programs and carries out established leisure/recreation therapy programs. Staff go on outings with the residents and facilitate groups specific to the needs of the residents (i.e. social, physical, spiritual, etc.) including one-to-one programs. The Recreation Therapy Worker also reports relevant observations of resident progress and behavior to the Supervisor/Recreation Therapist and provides suggestions for changes or modifications to the existing programs.

Overlander Residential Care is a 183 bed residential care facility located in Kamloops that believes each resident is a unique and valuable individual who will be treated with respect and dignity. We encourage the involvement of the residents, their family and friends in decision making. We recognize that this is “home for the resident.”

Casual employment means work requirements can vary between Zero and 37.5 hours per week. Shifts may be available Days or Evenings, with shift times of 07:00 to 15:00, 09:30 to 17:30, or 14:00 to 18:00. Once hired into a casual role, employees are eligible to apply for internal postings including permanent part time or full time positions. There are many opportunities with Interior Health that begin with casual on-call positions and lead to regular employment.

Apply today to join a great team!
  • We invite applicants to self-identify as First Nation, Métis or Inuit within cover letters and/or resumes.
  • Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal (First Nations, Métis or Inuit) and if you would like assistance with the application process, job readiness, interview readiness or tips for resume and cover letter writing, send your question via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to be redirected to the Employment Advisor
Qualifications
  • Grade 12, completion of a recognized recreation course(s) plus two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license as required
This posting is for casual work at a facility covered by the Provincial Health Officer’s Single Site Order and selected applicant(s) must comply with the requirements of the order. The posting is open to all qualified staff but those currently working at a single site facility should note that the hiring Manager will contact the current Manager to discuss the ability to release staff.

Interior Health values diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to cultivate a workforce rich in culture, experience and knowledge to ensure equitable health outcomes for all of the clients we serve. We are welcoming of all populations including our Aboriginal partners throughout the Interior Health Region. We are committed to increasing our Aboriginal representative workforce to build an engaged, culturally diverse organization focused on the goal of providing high quality, sustainable healthcare through an engaged workforce and healthy workplaces. We build inclusive, trusting and respectful relationships through our partnerships.

title: Yard Worker
description:
Job description: Yard Worker – Edmonton, AB

AFA Forest Products Inc. is 100% Canadian owned and operated distribution company that stretches coast to coast with a goal to provide unmatched service in the distribution industry, while leading the way with innovative products and marketing ideas for the building materials future. AFA prides itself in keeping up with today’s trends and staying at the forefront of the ever-evolving distribution industry. For more information about the company and the products we provide, please visit www.afaforest.com.

The AFA Forest Products Inc. Branch in Edmonton, AB is seeking a Yard Worker for Full-Time employment to work alongside our team, Monday-Friday (no weekends).

Responsibilities
  • Serve customers as they enter the yard
  • Load and unload building materials operating a forklift
  • Prepare, pick and pack customer orders

Qualifications
  • Previous experience in lumber and building material industry
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Detail-oriented with commitment to doing things right
  • Strong customer service skills
  • Ability to lift and carry items up to 60 lbs on a daily basis
  • Forklift certification and minimum 1 year experience of operation

Additional Information
  • Group Benefit Plan available
  • RRSP Contribution available
  • Profit sharing program available
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $40,000.00-$50,000.00 per year

COVID-19 considerations: COVID-19 Protocols are in place.

title: Warehouse Custodian / Janitor
description:
From $24 to $28 per hour

Edmonton Branch

25 Richardson Drive, St. Albert, AB T8N 7W4

From spotless warehouses to manicured lawns and walking trails, maintaining world-class facilities is as important to Uline as providing quality products and great service. Join a Facilities team that helps manage over 16 million square feet of property on over 50 million square feet of grounds.

Position Responsibilities
  • Perform general labor to support operation requirements as needed.
  • Sweeping, mopping, dusting racks, yard maintenance, building maintenance, etc.
  • Process trash removal and corrugated scraps with a compactor.
  • Operate floor scrubber (electric or propane) and other equipment.
Minimum Requirements
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Previous custodial / cleaning experience preferred.
  • Ability to frequently lift, push and slide packages that typically weigh up to 50 lbs., and may weigh up to 70 lbs.
Benefits
  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with 5% employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
  • Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Employee Perks
  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.
  • First-class fitness center.
About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,500 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace.

Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer

(#IN-EDMWH)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

title: Site Services Custodian
description:
Position Summary

Strike’s Site Service employees are responsible for the general cleaning and up keep of project work site trailers, wash carts, and other various infrastructure as required.

Employees are expected to support and participate in a "culture of safety" and adhere to and be ambassadors of Strike's Code of Conduct and Values, and to treat others with dignity, respect and fairness.

POSITION LOCATION/ DETAILS
  • Project is at the Empress Gas Plant Complex, approximately 1 hour from Medicine Hat
  • Start dates in July and August 2022
  • Day shift and Night shift positions available
  • Strike will provide daily transportation to and from Medicine hat to project site
Core Accountabilities
  • Identify and report hazards or unsafe work practices
  • Clean and maintain construction work trailers
  • Perform other activities at construction sites, as directed
  • Participate in pre-job toolbox meetings to identify potential hazards and measures to eliminate or minimize them
  • Correct unsafe acts and bring unsafe conditions to the attention of the immediate supervisor
  • Return tools (clean) back to the proper area after the job is complete or at the end of the shift
  • Ensure the appropriate use of Personal Protective Equipment while performing tasks
Qualifications
  • May be required to successfully complete pre-employment drug and alcohol testing
  • Valid driver’s license and a clean driving record
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
  • Valid driver’s license and a clean driving record
  • Capable of working with small tools
  • Capable of working as part of a team
  • Fluent in speaking and reading English
  • Must be able to follow directions
Who We Are

Strike Group is a Canadian company with various locations in Alberta, Saskatchewan, British Columbia and Manitoba. Strike Group has been named one of Canada's Best Managed Companies since 2007, and in 2013 was awarded Contractor of the Year by Alberta Venture.

At Strike we demonstrate leadership, drive, creativity and initiative and reward people for their commitment, energy, enthusiasm and results. We treat others as we wish to be treated and, most importantly, ensure that every employee goes home safe.

Why work for us

Strike encourages and supports professional development through education and mentorship. We offer comprehensive benefits, competitive wages, and opportunities for career growth. We support the communities where we live and the Strike team that makes those communities thrive.

title: Yard Worker
description:
We are looking for a passionate, enthusiastic, and hardworking Yard Worker/General Labourer for a busy warehouse located in Delta, BC

This will make a great fit for you if you have a background in manual order picking and loading/unloading merchandise. It is an excellent opportunity for you if you thrive in a fast-paced environment and possess strong communication skills.

What you need to know:
  • Monday - Friday (7:00 am - 3:30 pm)
  • $19/hour
  • Full-time; 40 hours per week with an immediate start date
  • Transit friendly location in Delta
  • Working 80% of your shift Indoor & 20% Outdoors
  • You will be responsible for maintaining and packing merchandise, ensuring they are prepped for shipment
  • Maintain accurate records of inventory levels and location; replenish as needed
  • Conduct physical inventory count as required

If you consider yourself a team player, adaptable, energetic, and maintain a positive attitude we want to hear from you!!

Two easy ways to apply:
  • E-mail resume to Meg at meghna.kashyap@randstad.ca or Holly at holly.benoit@randstad.ca
  • Apply online: http://www.randstad.ca

Advantages
  • $19/Hour
  • Full-time opportunity with an immediate start date
  • Monday - Friday (7:00 am - 3:30 pm)
  • Weekly Paychecks
  • 4% Vacation Pay
  • This is a great opportunity leading to a permanent placement within the company for the ideal candidate
  • This is a growing company with opportunities for promotions and improvement
  • Safe Working Conditions
  • Team working environment

Responsibilities
  • You are comfortable working 80% of your shift Indoor / 20% Outdoors
  • You will be responsible for maintaining and packing merchandise, ensure they are prepped for shipment
  • Maintain accurate records of inventory levels and location; replenish as needed
  • Conduct physical inventory count as required
  • Ensures compliance with health and safety standards and company policies and procedures
  • Ensures proper use of the equipment and ensures a clean and organized work environment
  • Lifting Requirements: 45-55 lbs (occasional lifting)
  • Willingly performs any other related task, maintain the cleanliness of the yard and work station

Qualifications
  • You are comfortable in manual order picking, loading/unloading, and inventory counting
  • You can commit to the Monday-Friday / 7 AM-3:30 PM schedule
  • Ability to work in a high-paced environment
  • A reliable means of transportation is an asset
  • Attention to detail and ability to maintain a high degree of accuracy
  • Ability to follow company policies, procedures, and regulatory compliance
  • Ability to communicate effectively in English
  • Ability to work efficiently and in an organized manner

Summary

Two easy ways to apply:
  • E-mail resume to Meg at meghna.kashyap@randstad.ca or Holly at holly.benoit@randstad.ca
  • Apply online: http://www.randstad.ca

Randstad Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the diversity of Canada. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage candidates, especially those who identify as a woman, an Aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group, and any others who may contribute to the diversification of our workforce, to apply.

Randstad Canada is also committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free selection processes and work environments. If contacted in relation to a job opportunity, you should advise your Randstad Representative or your local Randstad branch in a timely fashion of the accommodation measures which must be taken to enable you to be assessed in a fair and equitable manner. Information received relating to accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.

For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

Meg

Holly

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Ouvrier des matières premières
description:
L'ouvrier des matières premières assure l’approvisionnement des matières premières entrant dans la fabrication des projets.

RESPONSABILITÉS
  • Transporte les produits de l'entrepôt au site de production, effectue les mélanges de matières selon les recettes, opère et nettoie les séchoirs, assure l'entretien des broyeurs, etc.
  • Faire le suivi des changements de lot des matières premières et des colorants ;
  • Assurer l’approvisionnement de la production en boîtes;
  • Respecter la planification de production en fournissant la matière correspondante au projet et planifier le changement de résine en collaboration avec le responsable procédé;
  • Faire le nettoyage des équipements auxiliaires ;
  • Comptabiliser tous les déplacements de composantes ou de matières ;
  • Remplacer les agents de production aux presses lors de leurs pauses;
  • Effectuer les bonnes transactions au système pour ne pas occasionner de déséquilibre d'inventaire.
Qualifications
  • DES complété
  • Permis conduite de chariot élévateur
  • Minimum de 3 à 6 mois d'expérience en milieu manufacturier
  • Connaissance de base des outils MS-Office (Word, Excel)
  • Connaissance des matières plastiques
PROFIL RECHERCHÉ
  • S'adapte facilement aux imprévus et polyvalent dans la gestion de plusieurs tâches en même temps;
  • Minutieux dans la mesure des mélanges de matière première ;
  • Souci de la qualité et du bon fonctionnement de la production ;
  • Travaille aisément en équipe et communique facilement ;
  • Avoir un bon jugement dans le calcul du temps d'intervalle de remplissage de la matière première ;
  • Être attentif et alerte au changement de bruit des séchoirs ;
  • Avoir une vue d’ensemble de la production, être en mesure d’organiser et de planifier le travail à faire;
  • Bonne compréhension et utilisation du système de matière en place;

Déplacements fréquents

L’opportunité Que Nous Vous Offrons!

Un défi à votre mesure

Relevant de la directrice aux opérations ressources humaines, vous serez un collaborateur de premier plan dans l’accueil, l’intégration et le soutien de nos travailleurs étrangers temporaires (TET). En étroite collaboration avec le conseiller ressources humaines dédié à l’agricole ainsi que les gestionnaires des différentes fermes, vous assurerez le transport des TET vers leur logement et les accompagnerez dans l’acquisition des commodités nécessaires à l’arrivée, vous veillerez au bien-être des travailleurs en effectuant des suivis en cours de contrat et vous procéderez à l’inspection périodique des logements afin de respecter un certain standard au niveau du confort et de la sécurité.

Êtes-vous la personne que nous recherchons?

Le collègue par excellence

Votre parcours professionnel vous a permis de développer d’excellentes habiletés en communication. Vous avez de la facilité à établir et à maintenir des relations positives et constructives avec l’ensemble de vos collaborateurs. Vous vous démarquez par votre esprit d’équipe, votre collaboration et votre sens du service à la clientèle. Vous possédez une voiture et un permis de conduire valide et vous êtes disponibles pour des déplacements fréquents. Vous maitrisez une bonne base en espagnol.

Passez à l’action

Le poste est pour vous? Alors, foncez! Postulez dès maintenant!

Mentionnez le numéro de l’offre : ADM-2022-12.

Faites-nous parvenir votre curriculum vitæ à l’adresse : carrieres@avantis.coop

title: Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker
description:
Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker – Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Services (Full Time – Permanent)

The Role and Opportunity

  The NTCCS Is Governed In Partnership With a Collaborative Which Includes The Following Organizations

The Canadian Mental Health Association is looking for a Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker for the newly funded Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Service (NTCCS). This service provides 24/7 support to people experiencing a mental health and/or addiction crisis in northwest Toronto.  This pilot program is part of a City of Toronto police reform initiative that is evaluating the effectiveness and impact of non-police-led responses to people experiencing non-emergency crises.  This program aims to reduce the harms experienced by people who have mental health and addictions challenges as well as Black, Indigenous, racialized, LGBTQ2+ and other marginalized individuals.
  • Addiction Services Central Ontario
  • Black Creek Community Health Centre
  • Black Health Alliance
  • Canadian Mental Health Association Toronto
  • Caribbean African Canadian Social Services
  • Jane Finch Centre
  • Rexdale Community Health Centre
  • Yorktown Family Services
Canadian Mental Health Association (CMHA) is the most established and extensive community mental health organization in Canada. We identify and respond to Canada’s most pressing mental health and addictions priorities. At the national level, we push for nationwide system and policy change. At the community level, millions of people in Canada rely on CMHA’s extensive grassroots presence. Since 1918, CMHA has grown to provide mental health services and supports across Canada in over 330 communities. CMHA Toronto was, established in 1953. CMHA Toronto proudly provides services to over 10,000 clients per year, in 31 programs at 13 locations across the City of Toronto. Our services are delivered by a passionate and diverse team.  Join us in providing high quality mental health and addictions services, advocating for a better mental health and addiction system, and providing education and mental health and addiction supports to clients across Toronto. 

Responsibilities

The Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker will be part of a multi-disciplinary Mobile Crisis Response Team, which will provide crisis response 24 hours a day, 7 hours a week. This team is a multidisciplinary team of community crisis specialists that may include nurses, peer specialists, mental health clinicians, and concurrent disorders specialists. The Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker will incorporate experiences in crisis assessment and intervention, de-escalation, harm reduction, suicide prevention, anti-oppressive practice, client-centered and recovery-oriented care, trauma-informed care, and culturally competent care to support individuals experiencing crisis in Northwest Toronto. Reporting to the Program Manager, the Concurrent Disorder Specialist will work within the context of CMHA’s mission and strategic directions.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will exercise sound judgement to employ de-escalation strategies and provide suicide and risk assessments and interventions. The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will have excellent clinical assessment skills to develop safety and support plans to address immediate, intermediate and long-range needs. The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will work collaboratively with the person, their family, and other health service providers to facilitate access to community resources as needed.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will participate in community outreach and liaison with key stakeholders and partners and maintain trusting, respectful and collaborative relationships with clients, families, colleagues, referral sources, service providers and the public.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will maintain accurate and timely clinical and non-clinical records and actively participate in developing, implementing, and evaluating the Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Service through meetings, training, strategic planning and evaluation initiatives.

Skills You Bring

The ideal candidate will have at minimum an Undergraduate Degree/Diploma in Social or Health Services and a certificate in Addictions. The candidate will have a minimum of three years of community mental health and addictions experience with a strong knowledge of clinical and crisis assessments, crisis intervention strategies, Trauma-Informed Care service delivery and strengths-based models. The candidate will have demonstrated skill in client-centered and recovery-oriented care.

The candidate will bring an understanding and knowledge of working with persons with mental health and/or addictions issues as well as an understanding of the intersectionality of systemic barriers and social determinants of health. The candidate will require strong knowledge of systemic and structural factors (SDoMH) that impact Black, Indigenous, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities. The candidate will have knowledge and/or experience of community services in the northwest Toronto area including Black Creek, Downsview, Rexdale, and Humber neighbourhoods.

The candidate will possess excellent communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills and the ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team. The candidate will have proficiency in Microsoft Office applications. The candidate must be able to work shifts that include overnight, weekends and holidays. Fluency in a second language and experience working with diverse communities is considered an asset. A valid Driver’s Licence is required.

WHY CHOOSE CMHA TORONTO?

Our Benefits Include

If you care about mental illness and mental health and you have the right skills, then CMHA Toronto may be the place for you. We have a positive and fair workplace culture, where staff are provided with opportunities for learning and advancement. We are also big believers in wellness and work-life balance.
  • Health Care of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP), a predictable, secure monthly income upon retirement 
  • Comprehensive Group Health Insurance – Health, Dental, Vision, Paramedicals 
  • Short-term and Long-term Disability programs and life insurance to protect your income upon illness or injury 
  • Work-life balance and flexibility – to ensure you have time for the things that matter to you 
  • Annual Professional Development Funding for career learning and advancement 
  • Work with like-minded, passionate individuals and make an impact on mental health service delivery 
  • Build genuine and authentic connections, with colleagues and clients, with the goal of making a difference 
Salary: $52,531 – $65,154

CMHA Toronto is committed to promoting a workplace culture of inclusion, openness, mutual respect, and a ‘no blame and accountable’ environment. Our staff report that they value the flexibility in work schedules and the work-life balance CMHA Toronto encourages. They appreciate the training and development opportunities provided to staff and the encouragement for continuous learning. Staff often comment on the sense of family and personal support that exists throughout the organization.

CMHA Toronto is committed to an equitable, diverse, inclusive, anti-racist and anti-oppressive workforce reflecting the diversity of the communities within which we work and is an equal opportunity employer. As such, we encourage equity-seeking candidates to apply, especially those who identify as black, Indigenous, people and women of colour, people with disabilities, 2SLGBTQ+ or women. We recognize and honour the intersectionality of equity-based identities. Personal experience with mental health issues, either through self or a loved one, is an asset. If you are contacted by our offices regarding a job opportunity, please advise prior to the interview should you require any accommodation.

To be eligible for this role candidates will be required to adhere to our COVID-19 policy and provide proof of vaccination.

title: Sanitization Worker
company: Patron Career Staffing - Innovative Solutions in Staffing Services
description:
Job Description

We are currently seeking an energetic and highly motivated individual to join our team as a Janitor. The ideal candidate for this position is detail-oriented, flexible, and willing to take on non-routine cleaning and special projects as the need arises.

Duties And Responsibilities
  • General cleaning of the building and keeping it maintained and in good condition.
  • Vacuum, sweep, and mop floors.
  • Cleaning and stock restrooms.
  • Ensure doors are locked after hours.
  • Clean up spills with appropriate equipment.
  • Perform minor repairs.
  • Notify supervisors or managers of major repairs.
  • Collect and dispose of trash.
  • Complete tasks in a timely manner with minimal supervision.
  • Keep cleaning supplies in stock.
  • Work with a contract cleaning service when necessary.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $15.00 per hour

title: Food Prep Worker - Yosemite Valley Lodge
description:
Job Description

The Food Prep Worker prepares, and portions food items and performs various duties in accordance with production requirements and Aramark sanitation standards. Uses daily worksheets and standardized recipes to cook meals.

Job Responsibilities
  • Prepares all food items using prep lists and standard Aramark recipes.
  • Follows proper food handling procedures.
  • Maintains accurate rotation of food to assure top quality and freshness.
  • Manages leftover foods correctly; cover, label, date, and accurately store according to Aramark standards.
  • Maintains clean and orderly refrigerators and work areas.
  • Ensures stations are cleaned, sanitized, and organized at the end of the shift (including cleaning of kitchen equipment).
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary work environment that conforms to all food safety standards and regulations.
  • Follows safety policies and accident reporting procedures.
  • Completes all required training.
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Minimum one-year prep work or food service-related work preferred.
  • Knowledge of food prep, proper knife handling, temperature control, and sanitation is helpful.
  • Must be able to read and write to facilitate communication with others.
  • Mathematical ability required.
Education

title: Front Desk Worker - Yosemite - Wawona Hotel
description:
Job Description

The Hospitality Worker II is responsible for ensuring guest satisfaction by booking reservations, assisting with guest needs, and resolving or escalating any guest concerns or issues. Essential functions and responsibilities of the position may vary by Aramark location based on client requirements and business needs.

Job Responsibilities
  • Greet and provide customer service to guests while anticipating their needs
  • Supply guests or travelers with directions, travel information, and other information such as available services and points of interest.
  • Book reservations, rentals, and coordinate registration
  • Operate a register and/or software system to complete cash and credit card transactions.
  • Answers phone calls and emails and delivers messages as needed.
  • Maintains excellent customer service and positive attitude towards guest, customers, clients, co-workers, etc.
  • Coordinate resolution of guest concerns
  • Communicates closely with all departments to ensure a seamless guest experience.
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Previous guest services experience required
  • Previous cash handling experience preferred
  • Demonstrates excellent customer service skills
  • Demonstrates interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Demonstrate organizational skills, accuracy, and attention to detail

title: Employé de service
description:
Job Seekers can review the Job Applicant Privacy Policy by clicking HERE.

You are the driving force behind our company.

Start your career with Ryder today!

Summary

Ryder is seeking a motivated individual to join our team as a Service Employee I. The position works with the Maintenance Team to ensure that vehicles are prepped and transferred to the appropriate location within the facility. This role assists the team to organize the Shop and ensure that vehicles are presentable and ready for customers. Joining Ryder as a Service Employee is a great way to get your career started, with opportunities to move into Lube Technician roles and work toward our Heavy Duty Apprentice Mechanic training program. Ryder supports top performers to complete academic and practical requirements for becoming a Licensed Heavy Duty Mechanic.

Essential Functions
  • Fuel Vehicles
  • Wash and detail vehicles. Move heavy duty vehicles
  • Perform multi-point inspection on inbound units as required by company policies and procedures. Check tire pressure. Report service issues to shop
  • Record fuel activity and maintain proper fuel and DEF inventories and reconciliation
  • Maintain fuel island area to Six Sigma standards and policies.
  • Perform some facility maintenance. Perform minor maintenance tasks as assigned by supervisor
Additional Responsibilities
  • Changing tires
  • Inspecting refrigeration units on trucks
  • Emptying trash
  • Performs other duties as assigned
Skills And Abilities
  • Proficient in English written and verbal communication skills
  • Demonstrates customer service skills
  • Must be able to understand customer's verbal communication
  • Understand computer hardware and software, especially word processing, spreadsheets, and email
  • Must be able to read and understand codes and instructions on the computer
  • Must have basic computer skills and ability to perform data entry
  • Must be 18 years of age or older
  • Highly thorough and dependable
  • Must be able to work flexible schedules including shift work, weekends, holidays
  • Must be able to work different locations
  • Ability to create and maintain professional relationships within all levels of the organization (peers, work groups, customers, supervisors)
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
  • Flexibility to operate and self-driven to excel in a fast-paced environment
  • Capable of multi-tasking, highly organized, with excellent time management skills
  • Detail oriented with excellent follow-up practices
Qualifications
  • H.S. diploma/GED required
  • No prior experience required preferred
Travel: None

Safety Sensitive

Yes

DOT Regulated: No

Job Category: Maintenance Support

Ryder is an equal opportunity employer. We value Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace and encourage all qualified candidates to apply including women, visible minorities, aboriginals and persons with disabilities.

In accordance with our commitment to diversity and inclusion, Ryder welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment, selection, and assessment process. Should you require an accommodation, please inform the Human Resources representative of the nature of the accommodation requested so that we may discuss your needs with you. If you require assistance in order to apply please contact us at 905-302-3924.

Ryder est un employeur offrant l’équité en matière d’emploi. Nous valorisons la diversité et l’inclusion en milieu de travail et nous encourageons tous les candidats qualifiés à postuler, y compris les femmes, les minorités visibles, les autochtones et les personnes avec un handicap. (L'emploi du genre masculin dans ce texte ne se veut pas discriminatoire et n'a pour but que de l'alléger)

Conformément à son engagement envers la diversité et l'inclusion, Ryder accueille et encourage les candidatures de personnes handicapées. Des accommodements peuvent être proposés sur demande pour les candidats qui participent à toutes les sphères du processus de recrutement, de sélection et d'évaluation. Si vous nécessitez un accommodement, veuillez informer le représentant des ressources humaines de la nature de l'accommodement souhaité afin que nous puissions discuter de vos besoins avec vous. Si vous avez besoin d'assistance pour postuler, veuillez nous appeler au 905-302-3924.

title: Oven Room Worker
description:
Our client in Guelph is looking for Oven Room Attendants to start immediately on straight day shifts.

Afternoon and Night shifts are available as well.

Needed Immediately in a clean manufacturing facility that is accessible on a bus route available.

This position is on a continuous basis and could potentially lead to a full time hire for the right candidate.

Advantages

What's in it for you?
  • Ongoing position
  • Working for a successful local company
  • Day, afternoon, and night shifts available - $20..48 hourly
  • Weekly pay cheques
  • 4% vacation pay added each week

Responsibilities
  • Working in the oven room
  • Lifting/Mixing bags of flour (50 lbs)
  • Working in a hotter environment
  • Clean safe work environment
  • Fast paced

Qualifications

Qualifications
  • Have industrial background
  • Able to lift up to 50 lbs
  • Able to work in a fast paced environment
  • Works well in a hotter environment
  • Be flexible for overtime
  • Other duties as assigned

Summary

How to apply:
  • Respond directly to this job posting
  • Apply on www.randstad.ca
  • Email your resume to

barbara.bator@randstad.ca or tara.buchanan@randstad.ca
  • Call 519-763-7775 ext 1

We are currently working from home, so please call the office and/or email us.

Our services will not ever be at a cost to you. Registration with Randstad offers you the benefit of our industry knowledge and client database which spans many industries.

Do you believe a strong work ethic builds character? Do you think an honest, hard day’s work is something to be proud of? Do you take pride in being a part of an industry that builds communities? Industrial support might be the field for you.

Industrial support makes up the majority of Randstad Canada's workforce. At any given time, we have several thousand roles available in this sector. If you're looking for work in industrial support or general labour, we can help

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to accessibility@randstad.ca to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Abatement Asbestos Worker
description:
Morgan Demolition and Abatement Ltd is a part of the Morgan Group of Companies. With more than 50 years of operating experience, Morgan is a privately owned and operated specialty contracting company, with bases of operations throughout Western Canada.

Morgan Demolition and Abatement expands the groups service offering with our specialized abatement services and commercial demolition team. The integrated forces of Morgan and MDA's project experience, allows us to offer creative, cost-conscious and turn-key solutions to our client's diverse project needs throughout Western and Northern Canada.

Morgan believes that our greatest strength is our people. We seek out highly skilled and professional team players who are subject matter experts in their respective fields. Our team is capable of delivering the highest quality of service to our valued clients in today's complex marketplace. Morgan's continued success and sustained growth has allowed us to attract nearly 600 quality employees to ensure the highest level of project execution.

Morgan Demolition and Abatement is seeking qualified asbestos workers to join the growing team.

Candidates must be willing to work the following; (days / evenings / nights / weekends). Projects are located in Edmonton and surrounding areas. They are to fulfill the following duties, including but not limited to:
  • Complete all abatement tasks as instructed by foreman
  • Hauling of site debris
  • Interior and exterior abatement
  • Use of hand tools and power tools daily
  • Operation of equipment when deemed competent (skid steer, floor machine, lifts and company vehicles)
  • Lifting 50lbs+ on a regular basis
  • Follow specific instructions and complete tasks in a timely matter
  • Must be able to work alone, as well as be a great team player
  • Must always be safety conscious, following Morgan safety policies and procedures
  • Assist project foreman with any required documentation (Safety or equipment related)
  • Assist project foreman with any site-specific dispatch requirements (materials, equipment, bins, fuel)
  • Must have a full understanding of practice and procedure at hand before beginning work
  • General clean and sweep of project site at end of every shift
  • Assist project foreman ensuring project is safe and materials are always secure

Requirements

Must have the following;
  • Valid Alberta Asbestos Worker ticket
  • Valid driver's license and reliable transportation
  • Successfully complete an alcohol and drug test
  • 2 years experience in low / moderate / high risk containment
  • Steel Toed Boots

Only those candidates that are being considered for the role will be contacted.

title: ouvrier non qualifié/ouvrière non qualifiée - fabrication
description:
Nous sommes présentement en période de recrutement pour plusieurs postes!

Joignez l’équipe de Portes et Fenêtres Boulet, une entreprise familiale établie à Sorel-Tracy depuis 1976. Nos produits d’une qualité exceptionnelle sont vendus à travers le Québec et nous sommes en plein essor.

Nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un candidat qui se démarque pour se joindre à notre équipe. L'ouvrier non qualifié exécute différentes tâches liées à la production. Il s'assure de respecter les échéances et les priorités dans diverses tâches manufacturières.

Le genre masculin est utilisé seulement pour alléger le texte.

Principales responsabilités
  • Préparer diverses pièces et composantes de portes et de fenêtres.
  • Assembler diverses pièces et composantes de portes et de fenêtres.
  • Installer diverses pièces et composantes de portes et de fenêtres.
  • Poser diverses pièces de quincaillerie sur les cadres de fenêtres et de portes.
  • Gérer et organiser les différentes commandes qui sont terminées ou en cours de production.
  • Planification, gestion et organisation du matériel au quai de chargement et dans les entrepôts.
  • Travailler en collaboration avec le chef d’équipe, le superviseur ainsi que les livreurs dans la planification et l’accomplissement du travail à faire dans le transfert des entrepôts ainsi que dans le chargement des camions de livraison.
  • Entretien des différents airs de travail intérieurs et extérieurs.
  • Autres tâches connexes.
Formation et expérience
  • Connaitre et savoir travailler avec des outils (exemples : scie onglet, perceuse, …)
  • Savoir travailler avec un ruban à mesurer et faire la lecture en métrique;
  • Avoir une facilité avec les calculs;
  • Avoir une expérience dans un environnement manufacturier ou connexe (un atout).
  • Toute autre combinaison de formation et d’expérience pertinente pourra être considérée.
Aptitudes et qualités requises
  • Responsable, ponctuel et fiable.
  • Bonne dextérité manuelle.
  • Bonne condition et force physique (lever et déplacer des charges).
  • Autonomie, polyvalence et débrouillardise.
  • Minutie et le sens du travail bien fait.
  • Esprit méthodique, rigueur et précision dans le travail.
  • Leadership, proactivité et sens de la planification.
  • Capacité à travailler seul et en équipe.
  • Comportement sécuritaire et une excellente attitude.
  • Habileté à travailler dans un environnement où les activités se déroulent rapidement.

title: Environmental Services Worker - Housekeeper
description:
As a Best Managed Company, we are honoured to be named one of London's Best Places to Work. Sifton Properties Limited is a family owned and operated organization that has been in business for over 95 years. We have a family-based culture where we trust, understand, support and care about each other. As team members, we grow through collaboration, innovation, and open communication. At Sifton, we build outstanding communities where people live, work and play, and we live our values to the fullest.

We would love for you to join our Westhill Waterloo team!

NOTE: Day shifts Mon-Fri 8-4pm and weekend availability.
  • The Environmental Services Worker in Housekeeping will provide a clean environment in resident suites and common spaces within the Residence.
  • Adheres to company policies, procedures, practices and philosophies. Works in accordance with all industry and regulatory compliance agencies, the Ontario Retirement Communities Association, The Retirement Homes Act 2010 and O. Reg 166/1, the Occupational Health and Safety Act, the Ontario Fire Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and other pertinent legislated regulations/ standards.
  • Maintains confidentiality with respect to resident and operational Residence matters, exercises courtesy, good judgment and concern for the safety and wellbeing of residents and visitors. This includes adherence to the Social Media Policy.
  • Grade 12 or equivalent. Must be able to read and write and follow oral instructions.
  • The ability to understand and perform duties effectively, communicate any pertinent issues regarding residents and their care and work accurately and quickly.
  • Self-directed and team-oriented, with proficient organizational and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Must be committed to multi-disciplinary team work and demonstrate an ability to work through collaboration, joint decision making and integrated strategies.
  • Must successfully complete a Police Records Check and disclose any convictions, charges, restraining orders, probation orders and/or warrants during the course of employment that affect in any way the clear Police Records Check.
  • Must provide a Tuberculosis Skin Test (TST) document or Medical Note from Physician stating free from infectious disease.
  • Previous housekeeping experience desirable but not mandatory.
  • Experience in laundry operation is desirable but not mandatory. Must understand the basis of good laundry techniques/practices.
  • We'll set you up for success by providing in-depth training with your team and mentors, working in partnership with our leadership team.
  • You'll enjoy special events, celebrations, and unique perks, specific to your role and work environment, that reinforce our commitment to creating a wonderful employee experience.
  • Our unique rewards and recognition programs are designed to celebrate you, your contributions and promote your success.
  • Our Employee Assistance Program is available for your everyday needs.
At Sifton Properties Limited, we are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their full potential. Further, your well-being and safety are important to us. We prioritize work-life balance and offer strong health and safety programs, including required COVID vaccination for all roles, to support our employees, families, and the larger communities we serve.

Job ID: 2022-1605

Company Location: The Westhill by Sifton

External Company Name: Sifton Properties Ltd.

External Company URL: https://sifton.com/

Street: 25 Westhill Dr.

Division: Retirement Living

title: Addictions Crisis Worker
description:
Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker – Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Services (Full Time – Permanent)

The Role and Opportunity

The Canadian Mental Health Association is looking for a Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker for the newly funded Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Service (NTCCS). This service provides 24/7 support to people experiencing a mental health and/or addiction crisis in northwest Toronto.  This pilot program is part of a City of Toronto police reform initiative that is evaluating the effectiveness and impact of non-police-led responses to people experiencing non-emergency crises.  This program aims to reduce the harms experienced by people who have mental health and addictions challenges as well as Black, Indigenous, racialized, LGBTQ2+ and other marginalized individuals.  The NTCCS is governed in partnership with a Collaborative which includes the following organizations:
  • Addiction Services Central Ontario
  • Black Creek Community Health Centre
  • Black Health Alliance
  • Canadian Mental Health Association Toronto
  • Caribbean African Canadian Social Services
  • Jane Finch Centre
  • Rexdale Community Health Centre
  • Yorktown Family Services

Canadian Mental Health Association (CMHA) is the most established and extensive community mental health organization in Canada. We identify and respond to Canada’s most pressing mental health and addictions priorities. At the national level, we push for nationwide system and policy change. At the community level, millions of people in Canada rely on CMHA’s extensive grassroots presence. Since 1918, CMHA has grown to provide mental health services and supports across Canada in over 330 communities. CMHA Toronto was , established in 1953. CMHA Toronto proudly provides services to over 10,000 clients per year, in 31 programs at 13 locations across the City of Toronto. Our services are delivered by a passionate and diverse team.  Join us in providing high quality mental health and addictions services, advocating for a better mental health and addiction system, and providing education and mental health and addiction supports to clients across Toronto. 

Responsibilities

The Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker will be part of a multi-disciplinary Mobile Crisis Response Team, which will provide crisis response 24 hours a day, 7 hours a week. This team is a multidisciplinary team of community crisis specialists that may include nurses, peer specialists, mental health clinicians, and concurrent disorders specialists. The Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker will incorporate experiences in crisis assessment and intervention, de-escalation, harm reduction, suicide prevention, anti-oppressive practice, client-centered and recovery-oriented care, trauma-informed care, and culturally competent care to support individuals experiencing crisis in Northwest Toronto. Reporting to the Program Manager, the Concurrent Disorder Specialist will work within the context of CMHA’s mission and strategic directions.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will exercise sound judgement to employ de-escalation strategies and provide suicide and risk assessments and interventions. The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will have excellent clinical assessment skills to develop safety and support plans to address immediate, intermediate and long-range needs. The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will work collaboratively with the person, their family, and other health service providers to facilitate access to community resources as needed.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will participate in community outreach and liaison with key stakeholders and partners and maintain trusting, respectful and collaborative relationships with clients, families, colleagues, referral sources, service providers and the public.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will maintain accurate and timely clinical and non-clinical records and actively participate in developing, implementing, and evaluating the Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Service through meetings, training, strategic planning and evaluation initiatives.

Skills You Bring

The ideal candidate will have at minimum an Undergraduate Degree/Diploma in Social or Health Services and a certificate in Addictions. The candidate will have a minimum of three years of community mental health and addictions experience with a strong knowledge of clinical and crisis assessments, crisis intervention strategies, Trauma-Informed Care service delivery and strengths-based models.The candidate will have demonstrated skill in client-centred and recovery-oriented care.

The candidate will bring an understanding and knowledge of working with persons with mental health and/or addictions issues as well as an understanding of the intersectionality of systemic barriers and social determinants of health. The candidate will require strong knowledge of systemic and structural factors (SDoMH) that impact Black, Indigenous, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities. The candidate will have knowledge and/or experience of community services in the northwest Toronto area including Black Creek, Downsview, Rexdale, and Humber neighbourhoods.

The candidate will possess excellent communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills and the ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team. The candidate will have proficiency in Microsoft Office applications. The candidate must be able to work shifts that include overnight, weekends and holidays. Fluency in a second language and experience working with diverse communities is considered an asset. A valid Driver’s Licence is required.

WHY CHOOSE CMHA TORONTO?

If you care about mental illness and mental health and you have the right skills, then CMHA Toronto may be the place for you. We have a positive and fair workplace culture, where staff are provided with opportunities for learning and advancement. We are also big believers in wellness and work-life balance. Our benefits include:
  • Health Care of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP), a predictable, secure monthly income upon retirement
  • Comprehensive Group Health Insurance – Health, Dental, Vision, Paramedicals
  • Short-term and Long-term Disability programs and life insurance to protect your income upon illness or injury
  • Work-life balance and flexibility – to ensure you have time for the things that matter to you
  • Annual Professional Development Funding for career learning and advancement
  • Work with like-minded, passionate individuals and make an impact on mental health service delivery
  • Build genuine and authentic connections, with colleagues and clients, with the goal of making a difference

Salary: $53,056 – $65,806

Hours of Work: Rotational 12 hour shifts from 7am to 7pm and 7pm to 7am; 3 days on and 4 days off

CMHA Toronto is committed to promoting a workplace culture of inclusion, openness, mutual respect, and a ‘no blame and accountable’ environment. Our staff report that they value the flexibility in work schedules and the work-life balance CMHA Toronto encourages. They appreciate the training and development opportunities provided to staff and the encouragement for continuous learning. Staff often comment on the sense of family and personal support that exists throughout the organization.

CMHA Toronto is committed to an equitable, diverse, inclusive, anti-racist and anti-oppressive workforce reflecting the diversity of the communities within which we work and is an equal opportunity employer. As such, we encourage equity-seeking candidates to apply, especially those who identify as black, Indigenous, people and women of colour, people with disabilities, 2SLGBTQ+ or women. We recognize and honour the intersectionality of equity-based identities. Personal experience with mental health issues, either through self or a loved one, is an asset. If you are contacted by our offices regarding a job opportunity, please advise prior to the interview should you require any accommodation.

To be eligible for this role candidates will be required to adhere to our COVID-19 policy and provide proof of vaccination.
